description:
Sobre a vaga
Did you know that about 10% of all insurance payouts are flowing directly into the pockets of fraudsters? The future of insurance starts with Decisions Made Better.

Shift Technology harnesses the power of AI to enable the world‚Äôs leading insurance organizations to make better decisions. Our products automate and optimize decisions from underwriting to claims, resulting in increased operational efficiency, reduced costs, and superior customer experiences for millions of people around the globe.

Our culture is built on innovation, trust, and a drive to transform the insurance industry by imagining and innovating solutions that impact insurers and their customers - like you! We come from more than 40 different countries and cultures and together we are creating the future of insurance.

The Data Science team works on a broad range of subjects. We actively participate in the definition and development of our suite of products on fraud detection, anti-money laundering and claim automation. We have a lot of technical and professional experience in data science, data engineering, coding, business understanding and client interactions. Additionally, we also work on various data types such as structured data, free text, documents and images.

Please note that to be eligible for this job YOU should be currently enrolled to a S√£o Paulo (Capital) University AND be already on the last year of your studies.

What You‚Äôll Do‚Ä¶

As a member of the data science team, and working alongside our technical experts, you will be able to:

Understand insurance data and fraud mechanisms;
Create the associated mathematical models;
Implement, test and optimize the associated algorithms;
Participate in workshops with the clients to gather feedback and integrate it into the models;
Continuously provide ideas to improve the solution.

What You Bring...

You are native in Portuguese and fluent in English (mandatory)
You have advanced technical skills in Applied Mathematics, preferably in machine learning and/or operations research;
You combine strong analysis with synthesis abilities and are not afraid to deal with the details;
You can write quality production code;
You are keen to face our clients to discuss their needs and integrate their feedback into your projects;
You can communicate clearly in English and are fluent in another language.

RECRUITER TAG

To support our employees at every stage of their careers and lives, we are always assessing the benefits we offer to ensure we are competitive. Here are some we‚Äôd like to highlight:

Flexible remote and hybrid working options
Competitive Salary and a variable component tied to personal and company performance
Company equity
Generous PTO and paid holidays
Parental leave opportunities
Extensive mental health benefits provided via our global Employee Assistance Program
Paid volunteering time - 16 hours annually

We offer many benefits in various countries - ask your recruiter for more information.

At Shift we strive to be a diverse and inclusive workforce. We hire and trust people without regard to race, color, religion, marital status, age, national or ethnic origin, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or other non-merit criteria.

Shift Technology is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in our application and employment process. Should you require accommodation, please email accommodation@shift-technology.com and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs.

Shift Technology does not accept unsolicited CVs from recruiters or employment agencies in response to the Shift Technology Careers page or a Shift Technology social media post. Any unsolicited CVs, including those submitted directly to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of Shift Technology.

description:
Sobre a vaga
Job description:

Job Summary
We are looking for a Digital Analyst who will provide overall expertise, technology know-how, support, and consultancy for industrial digital systems including MES/MOM applications, ERP integrations, business applications, and system infrastructure enablers. Primarily involved in the deployment of industrial digital service solutions and in operational support to manage solution lifecycle, handling escalated problems, and driving activities and services to secure solution performance over time (configuration, optimization, documentation)
You can be based in Monte Mor or S√£o Paulo.
You will be travelling 75 % of your time to our customer sites
Tetra Pak is not sponsoring work visas or relocation for this position.

What you will do
As a Digital Specialist you will:

Service MES/MOM applications with specific automation competence (PLC/HMI, Database management, object-oriented languages, etc.)
Service solutions, business applications, and software in the upper part of the Internet of Things stack.
Provide troubleshooting and root cause analysis with aid of prevailing problem-solving methodologies.
Use the Quality and Technical Issue Management ( QTIM )process, and provide Technical Documentation and reporting including QuTI-P. 24/7 remote support.
Support Order Fulfilment Capital Equipment ( OFCE ) with Automation Specific expertise during pre-project and installation of Capital Equipment.
Build service system infrastructure with specific competence (Servers specification and configuration, networking, virtualization, connectivity and Database administration)
Support automation upgrades business being an active part in the development and deployment of kits.
Train customers & Market Companies‚Äô staff in key technologies, when relevant. Mentor other service engineers when necessary
Maintain a good knowledge and understanding of existing Automation and Digital portfolio, support Key Account/sales teams in pursuing business opportunities
Build and maintain technical network in Americas and global level, across different Automation and Digital organizations.


Profile description:

We believe you have

Good experience in designing digital solutions.
University degree in Engineering, Technology Science, Computer Science or related field.
Advanced or Fluent English proficiency is mandatory
Intermediate Spanish proficiency is desirable.
Must have experience in HTML5, CSS, Javascript, Web Services and APIs Development, Cloud, and Databases (SQL and MySQL)
Good knowledge at Agile methodology
Good to have experience in C#, MVC 5, Entity Framework
Demonstrate good technical skills.
Good knowledge of customer commissioning and service operations on site.
Good autonomy in activity organization.
Contribute to developing necessary standards, guidelines, tools, and methods for Industrial Digital systems design.
Understanding of service portfolio, proficient in communication and stakeholder management.
Team player and results-oriented.
Innovation and continuous improvement mindset.


We offer:

We Offer You

A variety of exciting challenges with ample opportunities for development and training in a truly global landscape
A culture that pioneers a spirit of innovation where our industry experts drive visible results
An equal opportunity employment experience that values diversity and inclusion
Market competitive compensation and benefits with flexible working arrangements
Apply Now

If you are inspired to be part of our promise to protect what‚Äôs good; for food, people, and the planet, apply through our careers page at https://jobs.tetrapak.com/.

This job posting expires on May 26,2023.

description:
Sobre a vaga
Create the change that everyone wants a taste of. Make a difference at IFF.

If you haven‚Äôt heard of IFF before (treasures are truly hard to find), it‚Äôs time to get excited. Welcome to the world‚Äôs best-kept secret and scent.

At IFF, we apply science and creativity for a better world, push past traditional boundaries and towards a more sustainable future. We are on a mission to co-create sensorial experiences that delight and go beyond the expectations of consumers everywhere.

While we have grown over the years, we remain agile in our approach and put our customers‚Äô needs at the forefront of our thinking. We are an international collective of thinkers represented at over 110 manufacturing sites and 100 R&D centres globally.

You will have the opportunity to join IFF at a very unique moment in time (as we spearhead our digital transformation) and impact our business directly by the work you do.

How You‚Äôll Leave Your Mark

As a Data Scientist, you will be part of our cross-functional digital team. You‚Äôll support the team by implementing scalable and sustainable solutions for our business problems. Based on your scientific and statistical expertise, these will not only influence your base office but will expand to our global IFF network as well.

What Your Work Will Taste Like ‚Äì You Will‚Ä¶

Solve challenging, large-scale problems by applying advanced statistical analyses and machine-learning techniques
Drive crucial prediction models based on large data sets from our sites
Shape automated decision making by integrating your own models and algorithms into our business processes
Advise our manufacturing sites by analyzing and optimizing modelling features
Support your team to communicate complex solutions and models in an easily understandable way

How You‚Äôll Spice Up Our Results ‚Äì You‚Ä¶

Have scientific expertise in chemical engineering or STEM equivalent (BSc, MSc, PhD)
Mastered your analytical and problem-solving skills during the last 5+ years
Are experienced in working with large data sets, SQL, Python, and R
Are flexible and open for agile working in a constantly evolving environment
Break down complex problems easily and make them understandable to anyone else

Why working at IFF will be the cherry on the cake of your career
We cherish your individuality. Our diversity, equity, and inclusion programs prove every day that different backgrounds and attitudes are the key factors to our success.

We know your worth. An attractive and competitive payment is a must to show you our appreciation.

We value your personal workstyle. We trust you. Whether you work remotely or on site, do what‚Äôs best for you and shape your work the way it fits into your life.

We trust your creativity. We support out-of-the-box thinking without hierarchies. On our teams, it‚Äôs the best idea that wins, not the one from the highest up.

We want you to thrive. Our IFF university will meet all your needs for personal development and growth. Because now is only the beginning.

We care about you. With our health insurance and pension plans we make sure that your well-being is secure ‚Äì professionally and privately.

We are a global leader in taste, scent and nutrition, offering our customers a broader range of natural solutions and accelerating our growth strategy. At IFF, we believe that your uniqueness unleashes our potential. We value the diverse mosaic of the ethnicity, national origin, race, age, sex or veteran status. We strive for an inclusive workplace that allows each of our colleagues to bring their authentic self to work regardless of their religion, gender identity & expression, sexual orientation, or disability.



Visit IFF.com/careers/workplace-diversity-and-inclusion to learn more.

Sobre a vaga
O candidato deve apresentar as seguintes caracter√≠sticas:

Experi√™ncia pr√°tica em desenvolvimento de modelos de algoritmos de Machine Learning (classifica√ß√£o, cluster, supervisionado e n√£o supervisionado, aprendizado por esfor√ßo).
Conhecimentos avan√ßados e experi√™ncia pr√°tica em linguagens de programa√ß√£o, como Python, para coletar, organizar, limpar e transformar dados.
Conhecimento avan√ßados e experi√™ncia pr√°tica em banco de dados SQL e suas integra√ß√µes com outras aplica√ß√µes.
Conhecimentos avan√ßados em m√©todos de an√°lise e interpreta√ß√£o de dados atrav√©s de estudos estat√≠sticos, probabilidades de eventos, teste de hip√≥teses etc.
Desej√°vel conhecimento em plataformas Oracle e seus m√≥dulos de BI, como o EBS, OAS e ODV.
Habilidade de comunica√ß√£o em diferentes n√≠veis da organiza√ß√£o a fim de mostrar resultados de forma clara e concisa.
Ser proativo e buscar constantemente atualiza√ß√£o no mercado em temas de an√°lises e aplica√ß√µes com dados, machine learning etc.

Ingl√™s e espanhol, m√≠nimo n√≠vel intermedi√°rio, sendo capaz de comunicar-se e entender os projetos e seus resultados sem aux√≠lio de terceiros.

Sobre a vaga
About Us

WEX is a global leader in financial technology solutions, based in Portland, Maine, United States, with over 6,000 WEXers distributed in over 40 countries. We simplify the complexities of payment systems across continents and industries like Fleet, Corporate Payments, and Benefits. We look to manage employee benefits, streamline how companies pay and get paid by suppliers, save on fuel costs, or modernize how companies manage their fleet, WEX solutions reduce the administrative burdens.


You Will Be Expected To

Have exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills
Are self motivated and able to work independently with minimum supervision.
Have experience writing modern data pipelines deployed in the cloud.
Have worked on agile teams to deliver software iteratively.

We Are Looking For a Professional Who Has

Good understanding of dbt to perform data transformation tasks
Good understanding of data design principles and dimensional data modeling
Good SQL skills and understanding of query optimization strategies in Snowflake
Good understanding of basic programming concepts (in Python or similar modern languages)
Analytics Engineer developing complex data models using dbt, macros, and Jinja.

It would be great, if you had already had the opportunity to work with:

Can show us one or more passion projects or open-source work you have contributed to in your own time.
Have experience with AWS, Airflow, Docker, Qlik Replicate, or Fivetran.

If you are looking for a growing career ‚Äì come be part of WEX today!

description:
Sobre a vaga
Aurora is looking for a Data Analyst to join our S√£o Paulo office

About the position
Are you looking to leverage your data skills while helping deal with the energy crisis? Based in S√£o Paulo, as an early member of the geographically dispersed Data Team within the Software Solutions team, you will contribute to setting up processes and streamlining data pipelines that power Aurora‚Äôs energy model forecasts for countries around the world that are used by movers, shakers and policy makers in the energy industry. You will work closely with other teams at Aurora to understand data requirements, support data acquisition, QA and analysis. It is an exciting opportunity to work on several aspects of the data lifecycle while supporting the larger global energy transformation.

About us
From its academic roots, Aurora Energy Research has grown to become the largest dedicated power market analytics company in Europe, providing data-driven intelligence for strategic decisions in the global energy transformation. We are a diverse team of around 400 experts with vast energy, financial and consulting backgrounds, covering power, hydrogen, carbon and fossil commodities.

We are active in Europe, Australia and the US, working with world-leading organisations to provide comprehensive market intelligence, bespoke analytic and advisory services, and cutting-edge software. We are a thriving, rapidly growing company with offices across the globe and more opening soon. We currently serve around 600 of Europe‚Äôs most influential energy sector participants, including utilities, investors, and governments, and expect to continue to grow rapidly, adding new countries and products to our portfolio.

Key responsibilities
Liaise with Aurora teams to understand data requirements, support data acquisition from public and third-party sources, QA and analyse data.
Support development, QA and launch of Aurora dashboards to visualise the data
Support data discovery by cataloguing data and relevant metadata
Support Aurora teams on data analysis projects

What we offer
A fun, informal and international work culture
A competitive salary package
Access to regular coaching and mentoring sessions and the opportunity to learn from experienced HR professionals
Access to the Aurora Academy, our training programme offering a range of opportunities to develop your skills

At Aurora we will consider all requests for flexible working. For most roles, the following types of flexibility are usually possible: a hybrid model of remote and in-office working, part-time hours and flexible start and finish times. Please talk to us at interview about the flexibility we could offer and we will explore what‚Äôs possible for the role.

The Company is committed to the principle that no employee or job applicant shall receive unfavourable treatment on grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, marriage and civil partnership and pregnancy and maternity.

What we are looking for
Required attributes:
At least 1 year of experience with relational and/or columnar databases and SQL
At least 1 year of experience coding with Python and working with YAML, JSON
Familiarity with data scraping, data wrangling and QA
Hands-on experience with data analytics and visualisation tools like Power BI, Tableau, Excel
Proficiency (C1 Level) in English
Good communication skills

Desirable attributes:
Familiarity with statistical and/or AI models

Please note, the start date of the successful candidate is to be confirmed. We are currently in the process of building out the team in S√£o Paulo so please submit your application to register your interest in this role. We will be reaching out to you as soon as possible.We will review applications as they are received. Salary will be competitive with experience.

To apply, please submit your CV, a brief cover letter, your salary expectations and state your earliest possible start date to the Apply Button above.

description:
Sobre a vaga
Description

Lead Data Scientist

Location: Sao Paolo, Brazil

Please make sure you include a cover letter with your application, with reasons for your interest in this role.

About Argus

Argus is an independent media organization with 1,300 staff. It is headquartered in London and has 29 offices in the world‚Äôs principal commodity trading and production centers. Argus produces price assessments and analysis of international energy and other commodity markets and offers bespoke consulting services and industry-leading conferences. Companies in 140 countries around the world use Argus data to index physical trade and as benchmarks in financial derivative markets as well as for analysis and planning purposes.

Argus was founded in 1970 and is a privately held UK-registered company. It is owned by employee shareholders, global growth equity firm General Atlantic and Hg, the specialist software and technology services investor. Argus Media is committed to ensuring career and personal growth for all its staff and provides extensive training and career development opportunities, as well as participation in employee-led initiatives, including a women‚Äôs network. Our core values are Excellence, Integrity, Partnership, and Inclusivity

What we‚Äôre looking for

We are looking for a passionate and resourceful reporter to join one of our teams in Houston, Texas.

You will be a skilled writer, a lateral thinker as well as a logical one, driven by an interest in the economics of markets. You will be able to engage with contacts, develop relationships, and work collaboratively.

You do not need prior experience of commodities markets. Intelligence, curiosity, writing ability and a real desire to become a journalist are the primary qualities we look for in a very diverse pool of candidates.

Responsibilities
Review existing and develop new methods for Argus Possibility Curves
Review existing and develop new methods for Argus Forward Curves
Contribute to the development of the Argus DS Studio.
Prototype algorithm techniques and run extensive benchmarks for all Argus DS products.
Engage in discussions with stakeholders to ensure smooth development of the DS products and commercial launch.
Identify opportunities to improve our end-customer experience across our products and services using machine learning methods.
Maintain current knowledge of the AI technology landscape and be able to identify emerging methods or technologies and best practices.
Contribute to the enhancement of the Argus AI/ML library for possibility & forward curves that can be used globally.
Contribute to the commercialization of Argus possibility curves and data-science signals for trading and risk management.
Monitor the production processes for the Argus DS products (such as possibility curves, forward curves, and the Studio), identify if any issues arise and fix them to ensure that the curves are available to the clients before the deadlines. It will be expected to work from 12:00 to 20:00 about 2-3 days a week.

Education and Experience
BA in mathematics, finance, statistics, engineering, computer science or related field.
Experience in model validation.
Experience in model development.
Experience in production level coding and documentation.
Advanced R coding skills (5+ years).
Good knowledge and experience of SQL
Experience in GitHub version control system for code development.
Experience in unit testing to ensure that all code meets quality standards before it's deployed.
Experience in leading teams and/or projects (1+ years).
Excellent spoken and written English.
Maker mindset & self-directed.
Passion for open source.

Benefits

Our rapidly growing, award winning business offers a dynamic environment for talented, entrepreneurial professionals to achieve results and grow their careers. Argus recognizes and rewards successful performance and as an Investor in People, we promote professional development and retain a high-performing team committed to building our success.
Competitive salary and company bonus scheme.
Group medical and dental plans.
Company life insurance plan.
Private pension scheme.
Meal voucher.
Extensive internal and external training.

For more details about the company and to apply please make sure you upload your CV with a Cover Letter via our website: www.argusmedia.com/en/careers/open-positions

Argus Media is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. Equal Employment Opportunity Posters If you‚Äôd like to view a copy of the company‚Äôs affirmative action plan or policy statement, please contact us. If you have a disability and you believe you need a reasonable accommodation in order to search for a job opening or to submit an online application, please contact us. This email is provided exclusively to assist disabled job seekers whose disability prevents them from being able to apply online. Only messages sent for this purpose will be returned. Messages sent for other purposes, such as following up on an application or technical issues not related to a disability, will not receive a response.

Sobre a vaga
(Este √© um trabalho hibrido, nosso escrit√≥rio fica na regi√£o da avenida Paulista.)

Job Summary

This position performs fraud analysis tasks and calibrations within a specific functional area or data type. Requires analytical abilities and an interest to bring value to our customers.

Experience and Education:

Previous experience in fraud area is a plus.

Key Responsibilities May Include:

description:
Sobre a vaga
Overview

#Locations: Barcelona, Spain; Vitoria-Gasteiz, Spain

PepsiCo is using the power of data to transform the way our world famous portfolio of brands are sold every day. Our Data Science & Analytics group influences every aspect of how we sell and move our products. In just a short period of time, they‚Äôve built new capabilities that have defined the data science roadmap across all of our brands. Members of our team solve complex problems facing our rapidly changing business and get to see their work come to life in the real world.

Join our Data Science team where you will be part of a collaborative interdisciplinary team around data, where‚ÄØyou will be responsible of building deployable statistical/machine learning models, starting from the discovery phase.

Data Science Analyst

PepsiCo operates in an environment undergoing immense and rapid change, in part driven by emergent retail technologies. To ensure continued success in the food and beverage space, PepsiCo has assembled a dedicated Sales Effectiveness Data Science (SE-DS) Team ‚Äì tasked with optimizing our sales operations and developing innovative solutions that will give PepsiCo a sustainable competitive advantage. This SE-DS team forms part of the broader global Data Science group within our global Data & Analytics (D+A) organization.

While tied closely to the broader organization, this team can be seen more as a flexible, experimental and execution-focused group; embracing the core values of having bias for action, being results oriented, maintaining a community-focus, and prioritizing people.

The team consists mainly of data scientists, technology specialists, and business innovators who operate directly with business teams and/or functional stakeholders, with the objective of quickly adding value to the business through innovative, quickly executed and often experimental solutions, while always focusing on future global scalability of each solution.

What the PepsiCo Data Science Sales Effectiveness Team does:

Build machine learning systems to understand and solve business problems.
Perform statistical analysis across diverse datasets to drive and measure performance
Work with PepsiCo‚Äôs strategic partners to expand their technical capabilities, thereby creating a more robust data environment
Add quick value to the business through fast and geographically fenced POCs that, if successful, have the potential to be scaled into global tools that drive automation and optimize business operations
Create basic visualization on demand (e.g., Power BI, Tableau‚Ä¶) to facilitate story telling towards business stakeholder.

As a Data Science Analyst, you will play a critical role in executing the global DS-SE growth agenda. You will work directly with members of this team in identifying, designing, and implementing data science/machine learning solutions to address business problems.

Responsibilities

Work within the SE-DS team to analyze (large) data sets
Assist in the development of custom models/algorithms to uncover trends, patterns and insights
Write clean, organized machine learning code using standard software engineering methodologies
Explain your findings and conclusions both to a Data Science audience as well as to a business audience. Always keep in mind the business relevance of your work
Integrate into a multidisciplinary team, collaborate with other members to improve the overall team efficiency and results
Create and maintain documentation for insights and knowledge transfer

Qualifications

Master‚Äôs Degree in Data/Computer Science, an engineering or scientific disciple, or equivalent experience. Other academic backgrounds are not automatically discarded though
3+ years of relevant working experience
Experience and familiarity with Python, in particular, data processing, feature engineering and data modelling using relevant/standard python libraries.
Familiarity with mathematical models underlying data science methods
Demonstrated ability to effectively and concisely communicate with both business and technical audiences
Experience in building complete ML solutions, including data exploration, model design and evaluation (model deployment is a considered a pre)
Business storytelling and communicating data insights in business consumable format.
Fluent in git
Experience with Cloud computing platforms (ideally Azure and/or DataBricks)
Agile methodology for team work and analytics 'product' creation

What makes us different?

Hybrid working model: combination of remote and collaborative office experience to enable innovation
Flexible work schedule
Variety of benefits to support your physical, emotional and financial wellbeing
Professional growth possibilities & learning opportunities
Volunteering opportunities to help external communities
Space to be you to promote our Diversity & Inclusion strategy

What makes us different?

Hybrid work model: combination of remote and collaborative office experience to enable innovation
Entrepreneurial environment in leading international company
Professional growth possibilities & learning opportunities
Variety of benefits to support your physical, emotional and financial wellbeing
Volunteering opportunities to help external communities
Diverse team from over 30 countries
Have a stake in D&I strategy and Bring your whole self to work

About PepsiCo

We believe that culture should be at the cornerstone of everything we do at PepsiCo D+A. We operate with start-up mindset ‚Äì agile, innovative and not afraid of failure. We want our team to come to work every day excited to explore new ways bring enjoyment, refreshment and fun to the world.

PepsiCo Positive (pep+) is the future of our organization ‚Äì a strategic end-to-end transformation, with sustainability at the center of how we will create growth and value by operating within planetary boundaries and inspiring positive change for the planet and people.

So, if you‚Äôre ready to be a part of a playground for those who think big, we‚Äôd love to chat.

We encourage the diversity of applicants across gender, age, ethnicity, nationality, sexual orientation, social background, religion or belief and disability

description:
Sobre a vaga
Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 160,000 employees who are committed to safe, responsible and sustainable ways to nourish the world. This position is in Cargill‚Äôs food ingredients and bio-industrial business, where we anticipate trends around taste, nutrition and safety to innovate and provide solutions to manufacturers, retailers and foodservice companies.

Job Purpose and Impact

The Analytics Visualisation Analyst will develop an in depth understanding of the business to innovate significant data driven insights to help business leaders make better decisions and will develop and combine subject matter expertise in key data domains. In this role, you will act as a partner with internal stakeholders and technical staff to execute a business technology strategy that delivers reporting and analytics solutions.

You will be designing and building these strategic and actionable insights utilizing the comprehensive visual analytics capabilities, connecting to the underlying data models in our Big Data Platform. In this role, you will act as an authority for key metrics and KPI‚Äôs, data lineage, access, visualizations, and storytelling across functions and regions. The insights will drive value for the Cargill FIBI business and help the business make fact-based decisions, and become an insight driven organization.

We are looking for a candidate with proven data analytics experience utilizing data analysis methodologies and tools to increase efficiency and effectiveness. This role requires strong technical skills, curiosity to learn new business processes, a creative mindset, critical thinking, and interpersonal skills.

Key Accountabilities
Identify and analyze business needs, gather requirements and define the scope and objectives to drive business decisions.
Prepare data and explore new potential data to support reporting and analysis initiatives.
Prepare reports and analysis to identify, analyze and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets for values and new opportunities.
Lead analysis in collaboration with process and operations leadership to identify the top opportunities for improvement and track progress and impact on future results.
Mentor and coach peers and recommend process improvements related to delivery and new methodologies.
Partner with the team to develop a detailed understanding of the business and offer mentorship or technical solutions to identify business problems.
You will work under minimal supervision and independently handle complex issues while referring only the most complex issues to higher-level staff.
Build prototypes to test new concepts and be a key contributor of ideas that improve fact-based decision making, (advanced) analytics, and key performance metrics.
Other duties as assigned

Qualifications

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a related field or equivalent experience
Minimum of four years of related work experience
Business acumen and the ability to partner and communicate effectively with business counterparts
3+ years applied experience in working with Visual Analytics Platforms like Tableau and/or PowerBI
2+ years applied experience in optimizing performance of dashboards (front-end) to accommodate for non-functional requirements
Supported and enabled management information and business intelligence strategy
Applied experience with UI/UX concepts and story-telling through data
Applied experience with data process mapping and business analysis
Fluent English is mandatory

Preferred Qualifications
Certification in programming language or business intelligence tools
Confirmed skills querying relational databases with query language
Confirmed experience working with large data stores
Applied experience with Data Warehousing concepts (e.g. dimensional modelling) and the use of traditional RDBMS;
Experience with the Agile mindset
Experience with Alteryx, Tableau Prep and/or KNIME
Experience with SAP Business Objects
Experience in Diagnostic & Advanced Analytics

At Cargill, everyone matters and everyone counts. Cargill is committed to creating and sustaining an inclusive and diverse work environment where all employees are treated with dignity and respect. As such and in alignment with our Guiding Principles, Cargill's long-standing equal employment opportunity policy prohibits discrimination and harassment against any employee or applicant based on race, ethnicity, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, pregnancy, genetic information, marital status, family status, citizenship status, veteran status, military status, union affiliation, or any other status protected by law. Cargill also complies with all applicable national and local laws and regulations pertaining to non-discrimination and employment.

Did you know that about 10% of all insurance payouts are flowing directly into the pockets of fraudsters? The future of insurance starts with Decisions Made Better.

Shift Technology harnesses the power of AI to enable the world‚Äôs leading insurance organizations to make better decisions. Our products automate and optimize decisions from underwriting to claims, resulting in increased operational efficiency, reduced costs, and superior customer experiences for millions of people around the globe.

Additionally, we also work on various data types such as structured data, free text, documents and images.

Work closely with our clients to understand their needs, their feedback to improve our solutions
Work closely with the sales team for prospects demo

What You Bring...

You have an advanced degree in Engineering or Computer Science
You are familiar with an object-oriented programming (C++, Java or C#)
You can write quality production code
You combine strong analysis with synthesis abilities and are not afraid to deal with the details
You are comfortable working with clients
You speak fluent English. Fluency in other languages is a big plus

CodinGame
Technical interview with Data Scientist
Last round interview with the hiring manager


I-

Company equity

Parental leave opportunities

Paid volunteering time - 16 hours annually

We offer many benefits in various countries - ask your recruiter for more information.

At Shift we strive to be a diverse and inclusive workforce. We hire and trust people without regard to race, color, religion, marital status, age, national or ethnic origin, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or other non-merit criteria.

Shift Technology does not accept unsolicited CVs from recruiters or employment agencies in response to the Shift Technology Careers page or a Shift Technology social media post. Any unsolicited CVs, including those submitted directly to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of Shift Technology.

Sobre a vaga
Varsity Tutors, a Nerdy company, is looking for a Data Scientist based in Brazil with mastery in analytics, statistics and machine learning to join our team. This individual in this role will partner with product and engineering teams to discover insights and develop algorithmic solutions that support the personalization of live learning experiences at scale. The qualified Data Scientist will hold an advanced quantitative degree with experience building forecasting systems, recommender models, or ranking algorithms. The candidate is expected to be comfortable developing prototypes that can be productized by engineering to develop real-time systems. Candidates must be comfortable with pushing through ambiguity and passionate about solving problems at scale and with speed.

About Nerdy:

Nerdy (NYSE: NRDY), the parent company of Varsity Tutors, is a leading platform for live online learning, with a mission to transform the way people learn through technology. The Company‚Äôs purpose-built proprietary platform leverages technology, including AI, to connect learners of all ages to experts, delivering superior value on both sides of the network. Nerdy‚Äôs comprehensive learning destination provides learning experiences across 3,000+ subjects and multiple formats‚Äîincluding one-on-one instruction, small group classes, large format group classes, and adaptive self-study. Nerdy‚Äôs flagship business, Varsity Tutors, is one of the nation‚Äôs largest platforms for live online tutoring and classes. Its solutions are available directly to students and consumers, as well as through schools and other institutions. Learn more about Nerdy at https://www.nerdy.com/.

Qualifications:
Master's degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g. Mathematics, Statistics, Machine Learning, Econometrics).
3+ years of professional data science experience
Applied skills in the areas of statistical inference, probability, machine learning (unsupervised and supervised).
Previous experience with production models, i.e. post-deployment responsibility
Ability to develop ML or statistical analyses software in R or Python
Experience with building recommender systems and implementation with a breadth of matching algorithms is a plus.
Experience with Bayesian reasoning, Natural Language Processing, classification, ranking systems is a plus.
Relentlessly curious and strong bias for action.
Fluent in English

Responsibilities:
Develop algorithmic systems to enable personalization for our consultative sales organization.
Partner with operations and engineering to identify impactful problems, and turn business goals into objective functions.
Design experiments to rapidly establish causal relationships.
Drive initiatives from conception to production with measurable impact to the business.
Define creative services to thorny problems using mathematical algorithms

Varsity Tutors Leadership Principles

Relentless Focus on Customers * Comfort with Ambiguity * Ownership * Simplify * Intellectual Curiosity * Build Teams * Think Big * Insist on High Standards * Bias for Action * Build Trust * Go Deep * Have Conviction * Deliver Results * Are Right, a Lot

Benefits:
Competitive Pay (USD)
Fully Remote Position
Work for a leading U.S.-based learning technology company
A once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to help transform how the world learns!
A fun, collaborative, and team-oriented work environment with plenty of training and a feedback-rich culture

Varsity Tutors is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. (INDHP)

description:
Sobre a vaga
A rapidly-growing company that is forging a reputation for itself as a world-class trader and investor in energy assets is looking for a Data Scientist. The selected candidate will be responsible for effortlessly combining data and research to address large-scale issues that affect both customers and businesses. The company derives revenue by using proprietary trading to optimize battery assets for wholesale electricity markets. This is an amazing opportunity for developers to showcase their talent and quickly climb the corporate ladder.

Job Responsibilities:

Recognize connections and patterns in the data as well as any elements that might have an impact on the model's predictions
Increase value by connecting internal and external data sources to new insights
Actively collaborate with senior management, team members, and other stakeholders to meet a range of project goals
Organize information, look for errors, correct and weight the raw data, and then prepare it for processing

Job Requirements:

Bachelor‚Äôs/Master‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 3+ years of relevant experience as a data scientist
Extensive experience with production-level software development in Python
Nice to have prior C++, Java, and/or Go experience
In-depth knowledge of data science and machine learning, including training, testing, and model deployment
Prior experience working with vast amounts of data in a cloud environment
Extensive expertise in the use of AWS, Docker, and Kubernetes
Prolific knowledge of Git, CI/CD, and general professional software development
Demonstrable experience with operations research and optimization
Comprehensive knowledge in time series analysis, forecasting, and reinforcement learning
Strong traditional finance background and prior trading experience
Sound knowledge of designing and implementing quantitative trading algorithms (more on the sell side than the buy side)
Must be well-versed in swaps, futures, options, and basic contractual duties related to financial products
Must be an effective team player that can solve and solve tough issues
Strong knowledge of power markets
Fluent in spoken and written English communication

description:
Sobre a vaga
Overview

#Locations: Barcelona, Spain; Vitoria-Gasteiz, Spain

PepsiCo is using the power of data to transform the way our world famous portfolio of brands are sold every day. Our Data Science & Analytics group influences every aspect of how we sell and move our products. In just a short period of time, they‚Äôve built new capabilities that have defined the data science roadmap across all of our brands. Members of our team solve complex problems facing our rapidly changing business and get to see their work come to life in the real world.

Join our Data Science team where you will be part of a collaborative interdisciplinary team around data, where‚ÄØyou will be responsible of building deployable statistical/machine learning models, starting from the discovery phase.

Data Science Analyst

PepsiCo operates in an environment undergoing immense and rapid change, in part driven by emergent retail technologies. To ensure continued success in the food and beverage space, PepsiCo has assembled a dedicated Sales Effectiveness Data Science (SE-DS) Team ‚Äì tasked with optimizing our sales operations and developing innovative solutions that will give PepsiCo a sustainable competitive advantage. This SE-DS team forms part of the broader global Data Science group within our global Data & Analytics (D+A) organization.

While tied closely to the broader organization, this team can be seen more as a flexible, experimental and execution-focused group; embracing the core values of having bias for action, being results oriented, maintaining a community-focus, and prioritizing people.

The team consists mainly of data scientists, technology specialists, and business innovators who operate directly with business teams and/or functional stakeholders, with the objective of quickly adding value to the business through innovative, quickly executed and often experimental solutions, while always focusing on future global scalability of each solution.

What the PepsiCo Data Science Sales Effectiveness Team does:

Build machine learning systems to understand and solve business problems.
Perform statistical analysis across diverse datasets to drive and measure performance
Work with PepsiCo‚Äôs strategic partners to expand their technical capabilities, thereby creating a more robust data environment
Add quick value to the business through fast and geographically fenced POCs that, if successful, have the potential to be scaled into global tools that drive automation and optimize business operations
Create basic visualization on demand (e.g., Power BI, Tableau‚Ä¶) to facilitate story telling towards business stakeholder.

As a Data Science Analyst, you will play a critical role in executing the global DS-SE growth agenda. You will work directly with members of this team in identifying, designing, and implementing data science/machine learning solutions to address business problems.

Responsibilities

Work within the SE-DS team to analyze (large) data sets
Assist in the development of custom models/algorithms to uncover trends, patterns and insights
Write clean, organized machine learning code using standard software engineering methodologies
Explain your findings and conclusions both to a Data Science audience as well as to a business audience. Always keep in mind the business relevance of your work
Integrate into a multidisciplinary team, collaborate with other members to improve the overall team efficiency and results
Create and maintain documentation for insights and knowledge transfer

Qualifications

Master‚Äôs Degree in Data/Computer Science, an engineering or scientific disciple, or equivalent experience. Other academic backgrounds are not automatically discarded though
3+ years of relevant working experience
Experience and familiarity with Python, in particular, data processing, feature engineering and data modelling using relevant/standard python libraries.
Familiarity with mathematical models underlying data science methods
Demonstrated ability to effectively and concisely communicate with both business and technical audiences
Experience in building complete ML solutions, including data exploration, model design and evaluation (model deployment is a considered a pre)
Business storytelling and communicating data insights in business consumable format.
Fluent in git
Experience with Cloud computing platforms (ideally Azure and/or DataBricks)
Agile methodology for team work and analytics 'product' creation

What makes us different?

Hybrid working model: combination of remote and collaborative office experience to enable innovation
Flexible work schedule
Variety of benefits to support your physical, emotional and financial wellbeing
Professional growth possibilities & learning opportunities
Volunteering opportunities to help external communities
Space to be you to promote our Diversity & Inclusion strategy

What makes us different?

Hybrid work model: combination of remote and collaborative office experience to enable innovation
Entrepreneurial environment in leading international company
Professional growth possibilities & learning opportunities
Variety of benefits to support your physical, emotional and financial wellbeing
Volunteering opportunities to help external communities
Diverse team from over 30 countries
Have a stake in D&I strategy and Bring your whole self to work

About PepsiCo

We believe that culture should be at the cornerstone of everything we do at PepsiCo D+A. We operate with start-up mindset ‚Äì agile, innovative and not afraid of failure. We want our team to come to work every day excited to explore new ways bring enjoyment, refreshment and fun to the world.

PepsiCo Positive (pep+) is the future of our organization ‚Äì a strategic end-to-end transformation, with sustainability at the center of how we will create growth and value by operating within planetary boundaries and inspiring positive change for the planet and people.

So, if you‚Äôre ready to be a part of a playground for those who think big, we‚Äôd love to chat.

We encourage the diversity of applicants across gender, age, ethnicity, nationality, sexual orientation, social background, religion or belief and disability

description:
Sobre a vaga
Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 155,000 employees who use new technologies, dynamic insights and over 154 years of experience to connect farmers with markets, customers with ingredients, and people and animals with the food they need to thrive.

Job Purpose and Impact

The Senior Data Scientist will work collaboratively in multidisciplinary teams to develop complex proof of concepts, minimum viable products and fully deployable solutions. In this role, you will create complex predictive and optimization models that help deliver significant value to the company's businesses and functions.

Key Accountabilities
Continuously seek out best practices and develop skills.
Work on multidisciplinary teams of data engineers, software engineers, data scientists and business subject matter experts to deliver complex projects on time and within budgets.
Translate ambiguous and complex business problems into project charters clearly identifying technical risks and project scope.
Take ownership for the entire data science workflow that includes a well defined, complex project scope, exploratory data analysis, model development, deployment and monitoring.
Independently handle complex issues with minimal supervision, while escalating only the most complex issues to appropriate staff.

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in data science, computer science, math, engineering or related field or equivalent experience,
Confirmed ability to present to non technical audiences
Strong python programming skills
Experience in a minimum of two machine learning algorithms approaches: unsupervised, supervised and reinforcement learning
Minimum of four years of related work experience
Fluency in English

Preferred Qualifications
Master's degree or PhD in data science, computer science, math, engineering or related field
Strong data visualization skills
Strong SQL skills
Experience working with continuous integration and delivery (CI/CD) pipelines
Experience working with Hadoop and other distributed computing frameworks
Experience working with AWS
Experience in software development environment and code management or versioning
Experience in agriculture

At Cargill, everyone matters and everyone counts. Cargill is committed to creating and sustaining an inclusive and diverse work environment where all employees are treated with dignity and respect. As such and in alignment with our Guiding Principles, Cargill's long-standing equal employment opportunity policy prohibits discrimination and harassment against any employee or applicant based on race, ethnicity, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, pregnancy, genetic information, marital status, family status, citizenship status, veteran status, military status, union affiliation, or any other status protected by law. Cargill also complies with all applicable national and local laws and regulations pertaining to non-discrimination and employment.

It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.

Position Overview

Elaborates and analyzes Quality concepts, methods, tools and procedures as parts of effective Quality Management Systems, in a specific Quality area, or in an assigned organization unit. Assisting with data management and resource management tasks as directed by team lead for Quality Inspectors

Relocation will not be offered for this role.

Responsibilities
Prepares Quality-related analyses, concepts, methods and tools, for respective management to decide.
Advices business accountable management in specific Quality-related issues. Ensures and Implements quality related standards, guidelines and programs in a specific quality area, or in organizational unit(s) assigned.
Analyzes working environment and proposes improvements to management.
Keeps abreast of industry and legal trends in a specific quality area.
Drives and coaches unit-related general Quality projects in a specific Quality area.
Contributes to budget planning processes.

Required Knowledge, Education, Experience, And Skills
Must have a minimum of 2-5 years of experience as a Data Analyst
Must have a High School Diploma or GED equivalent
Development of Power BI charts as team identifies needs for new data views/flows
Competencies required include being systems savvy and knowing how to manipulate and report on data in systems such as Excel and PowerBI

Team skills and ability to collaboratively work with peers across all levels of the business both local and international
A passion for key performance metrics, using them to communicate status and demonstrate improvements

#Associate

Required Knowledge, Education, Experience, And Skills
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in engineering or equivalent degree/experience

Sobre a vaga
Location : BAL - S√ÉO PAULO CORPORATIVO

City : S√£o Paulo, Brasil

State : S√£o Paulo (BR-SP)

Country : Brazil (BR)

Requisition Number : 26352

Bunge has an exciting opportunity available for a Data Scientist. In this role you will be part of a global team working on challenging, meaningful projects impacting core business activities.

Since 1818, Bunge has been connecting farmers to consumers to deliver essential food, feed, and fuel to the world. Looking to the future, our ambition is to continuously reinvent ourselves, leveraging data to be at the forefront of analytics, technology and talent to accomplish our purpose in a better, faster and simpler way. Bunge is committed to operating and thriving in the digital world ‚Äì creating world class agile teams where teammates are empowered and encouraged to collaborate and test and learn to succeed.

At Bunge, people don‚Äôt just come here to work, they come here to grow ‚Äì solving challenges that directly impact the world with a diverse team of thinkers and doers. Most importantly, in all we do we live our values:

Act as One Team by fostering inclusion, collaboration, and respect
Drive for Excellence by being agile, innovative and efficient
Do What's Right by acting safely, ethically, and sustainably

Overview:

The Data Scientist applies strong expertise in machine learning, data mining, and information retrieval to design, prototype, and build next generation advanced analytics engine and services. The data scientist collaborates with translators to define technical problem statement and hypothesis to test; develops efficient and accurate analytical models that mimic business decisions

Responsibilities:

Design, create, test and implement complex models and algorithms that drive analytical solutions throughout the organization
Conduct advanced statistical and other analysis to provide actionable insights, identify trends, and measure performance.
Collaborate with translators and understands business problems to implement scalable and sustainable solutions
Coordinate with MIS, Digital Specialists, and Data Engineers to deliver holistic analytical solutions
Support translators in communicating the design, functioning and output of the analytical models/solutions developed
Ensure timely analysis and testing for regular maintenance of solutions over time

Qualifications/Requirements:

MS/PhD(Computer Science or Electronics), or MS in Computer Applications, Economics, Statistics or Mathematics or related technical discipline
2-3 years‚Äô experience in a statistical and/or data science / business intelligence role
Should have experience in machine learning, statistics, optimization or related fields; deeper experience in working with large data sets, simulation/ optimization or distributed computing tools is a plus
Experience with programming is required; specific experience in R or Python is a plus
Experience of working with large data sets, simulation/ optimization and distributed computing tools (Map/Reduce, Hadoop,
Hive, Spark, etc.) is a plus
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong understanding of Agile methodologies
Openness to working in Agile environments with multiple stakeholders
Professional attitude and service orientation; team player
Good verbal and written communication skills
Quick learner to business needs and translate them into potential analytics solutions
Strong work ethic; ability to work at an abstract level and gain consensus
Able to build a sense of trust and rapport that creates a comfortable and effective workplace Attitude to thrive in a fast-paced environment
Open minded to new approaches of learning

Hybrid work - Gaspar - Santa Catarina or S√£o Paulo - SP

Bunge (NYSE: BG) is a world leader in sourcing, processing and supplying oilseed and grain products and ingredients. Founded in 1818, Bunge‚Äôs expansive network feeds and fuels a growing world, creating sustainable products and opportunities for more than 70,000 farmers and the consumers they serve across the globe. description:
Sobre a vaga
Description


We are looking for a dynamic Database Engineer to join our team with our MSSQL, Postgres and Kubernetes (k8s) experience and the opportunity to learn automation and many more data technologies we support.

Who are we?

KORE is a recognized global leader in IoT solutions and management capabilities and is consistently recognized as the highest-ranked non-carrier in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Machine-to-Machine Services worldwide. KORE creates value for customers in the explosive IoT market and is the largest independent IoT connectivity management provider today.

The global market for IoT networking solutions is expected to grow 22% (CAGR) per year through 2022, with the number of IoT devices predicted to grow to 55 billion units by 2025. Come be a part of this dynamic and exciting marketplace as a high-performance team member with KORE!

Responsibilities

Work with the application development teams to develop database architectures, coding standards, and quality assurance policies and procedures
Advanced troubleshooting in coordination with other teams and 3rd parties, query / schema optimizations, fine tuning of back-end databases
Perform advanced system monitoring and preventive maintenance
Participate in on-call rotation
Database / Server ownership
Propose database and platform enhancements
Drive maturity through our IT Engineering environment through Infrastructure as Code
Turnover operations runbooks to our IT Operations teams

Skills Required

3+ years working with SQL Server and Postgres including Replication and HA/DR
BS in Information Technology, Computer Science, or related field
Good written and speaking knowledge of the English language

Skills Desired

Experience with PowerShell and Ansible
IaC and or CI/CD experience and related tools (Jenkins/Octopus, GitLab/Bitbucket)
Knowledge and experience of the following: Clickhouse, Redis, Elastic, Kafka, Spark
Knowledge of MySQL, Oracle
Knowledge/Experience in Kubernetes or similar container environment

What We Offer

A fun team environment collaborating across the globe
A dynamic working environment in an innovative and growing industry

description:
Sobre a vaga
A fast-growing company that is developing the first trusted data platform in the world to reconcile the data demands of businesses with the privacy concerns of consumers, is looking for a Lead Data Scientist. The selected candidate will be responsible for providing suggestions and market information to assist in resolving complex business issues. The company's free browser extension eliminates intrusive trackers and cookies while enabling users to earn royalties while browsing, giving users control over their data and safeguarding their privacy. This is an amazing opportunity for developers who are eager to work with a team of professionals while developing cutting-edge solutions.

Job Responsibilities:

Take charge of the organization's data science vision and strategy
Create innovative tools, cutting-edge analytical methods, and products.
As part of co-innovation projects, collaborate with important clients and stakeholders to assist in the creation of proprietary analytical products and bespoke scores
Make sure that all analytical output is subject to quality monitoring by beginning and experienced data scientists
Successfully convey the "so what" of the analysis to key stakeholders by utilizing powerful data visualizations, excellent presentation techniques, and business language
Help junior and intermediate data scientists enhance their careers and their skill sets in data science
Using cutting-edge approaches and procedures, as well as developing new ones when necessary, support the redesign of the data science model development lifecycle
Take care of project management, including establishing the technical and business requirements, scheduling resources, and designing analytical solutions

Job Requirements:

Bachelor‚Äôs/Master‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 3+ years of relevant experience as a data scientist
3+ years of experience working in a large data environment with Python, SQL, and R
3+ years of experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, and neural networks (including LSTMs, and RNNs)
3+ years of relevant experience in the development and application of analytical solutions to real-world problems
2+ years of modeling experience with the top tools, such as Transformers, Tensorflow, XGBoost, Scikit Learn, and PyTorch
2+ years of experience developing and leading the technical vision of an organization and working independently and closely with senior leadership to lead data science to continued success into the future
Knowledge of, innate skill for, and excitement for experimenting with new technology and swiftly determining their value within organizations
Nice to have some working knowledge of financial services, telecommunications, or utilities
Prior experience working with browser-level data to extract insights is desirable
Nice to have some experience working with credit or fraud data
Experience in leadership and mentorship along with development and deployment of models in a cloud-based environment such as GCP and Firestore is desirable
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills

description:
Sobre a vaga
Job Description

We have a view beyond the ocean: integrating container logistics, connecting, and simplifying our customers' supply chain. We count on our people to make that happen!
Join us as we embark on a digital transformation that will revolutionize the logistics business: you will play a vital role in our success, managing the customer experience and building a successful track in your career.

What do we offer?

We are on a revolutionary journey to simplify global trade, which will give us the chance to offer a major impact on the world economy, and on your career. With significant personal responsibility, you will hone your industry knowledge and build highly valued business skills and communication skills into customer-facing roles ‚Äì quite possibly at a pace that will surprise you.
Energizing and pioneering, this is also an environment that keeps you motivated. You will join a genuinely diverse and talented team that is enthusiastic about focusing on customers, and colleagues.
And thanks to our global scale, you will be well positioned to explore opportunities at Maersk around the world. The many other highlights include the most modern talent development initiatives and competitive benefits.

Our opportunity

We are looking for our new 4PL Data Analyst, who will conduct full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design. Data analysts will develop analysis and reporting capabilities. They will also monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.
You will take responsibility for managing our master data set, developing reports, and troubleshooting data issues. To do well in this role you need a very fine eye for detail, experience as a data analyst, and a deep understanding of the popular data analysis tools and databases.

Main responsibilities

Work with Customer Experience Team and other business leaders to identify opportunities for improvement
Create reports for internal teams and/or external clients
Collaborate with team members to collect and analyze data
Use graphs, infographics, and other methods to visualize data
Establish KPIs to measure the effectiveness of business decisions
Structure large data sets to find usable information
Work with a team of analysts and other associates to process information
Create presentations and reports based on recommendations and findings
Gather data: Analysts often needs to refine or improve way to collect data. This could include conducting surveys, tracking visitor characteristics on a company website, or buying datasets from data collection specialists.
Clean data: Raw data might contain duplicates, errors, or outliers. Cleaning the data means maintaining the quality of data in a spreadsheet or through a programming language so that your interpretations won‚Äôt be wrong or skewed.
Model data: This entails creating and designing the structures of a database. You might choose what types of data to store and collect, establish how data categories are related to each other, and work through how the data actually appears.
Interpret data: Interpreting data will involve finding patterns or trends in data that could answer the question at hand.
Present: Communicating the results of your findings will be a key part of your job. You do this by putting together visualizations like charts and graphs, writing reports, and presenting information to interested parties.

We are looking for

If you have the requirements below, this is your chance to join this high-performance team and be part of this great moment in our organization!

Fluent Portuguese, English and Intermediate Spanish;
University degree Experience or college in computer science;
Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office packages and in particular, Excel, Powe BI;
Work experience as a data analyst or in a related field.
Ability to work with stakeholders to assess potential risks.
Ability to translate business requirements into non-technical, lay terms.
High-level experience in methodologies and processes for managing databases.
Demonstrated experience in handling large data sets and relational databases.
High-level written and verbal communication skills.
International Trade and Incoterms ‚Äì Imports & Exports knowledge is a bonus point;
Strong mathematical skills to help collect, measure, organize and analyze data
Knowledge of programming languages like SQL, Oracle, R, MATLAB, and Python
Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation.
Experience in handling reporting packages like Business Objects, programming (Javascript, XML, or ETL frameworks), databases
Experience in statistics and statistical packages like Excel, SPSS, SAS to be used for data set analyzing
Knowledge of how to create and apply the most accurate algorithms to datasets in order to find solutions

Disposition

Forward thinking
Problem-solving skills
Accuracy and attention to detail
Adept at queries, writing reports, and making presentations
Team-working skills
Verbal and Written communication skills

At Maersk we value the diversity of our talents and will always strive to recruit the best person for the job. We value diversity in all its forms, including ‚Äì but not limited to ‚Äì gender, age, nationality, race, sexual orientation, disability, or religious beliefs. We are proud of our diversity and to see it as a true source of strength for building high-performance teams.

About us

A.P. Moller-Maersk is an integrated container logistics company that works to connect and simplify our customers' supply chains. As a global leader in transportation services, we operate in 130 countries and employ about 70,000 people.
With an offer of end-to-end products and digital services, continuous customer engagement and a superior end-to-end delivery network, we enable our customers to trade and grow by transporting goods anywhere in the world. Learn more about us: https://www.maersk.com

Maersk is committed to equal employment opportunity and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. We value diversity and prohibit discrimination against any candidate based on race, color, gender, sex, age, religion, creed, nationality, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, medical condition, veteran status, gender identity, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

description:
Sobre a vaga
Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 160,000 employees who are committed to safe, responsible and sustainable ways to nourish the world. This position is in Cargill‚Äôs food ingredients and bio-industrial business, where we anticipate trends around taste, nutrition and safety to innovate and provide solutions to manufacturers, retailers and foodservice companies.

Job Purpose and Impact

The Analytics Engineer will prepare business relevant information and reduce time to insight by leading technical activities that enable information capture, business intelligence and analytics competency. In this role, you will ensure teams have the data needed to make timely, accurate and actionable insights by investing in the core capabilities of data management, data engineering and key decision support applications that consume data. You will be a key partner between business needs and data engineering and will deliver the final information product including the dashboards that enable business value.

Key Accountabilities
Design and implement internal process improvements, optimize data delivery and create scalable data sets.
Build existing data assets and prepare data to meet specific reporting and analytics needs.
Build data solutions to enable automated and self service data consumption.
Model, design, develop, test and implement complex backend and front end structures to meet business visualization, reporting and analytics requirements.
Evaluate the performance of processes, services and outcomes and recommend performance improvement.
Partner collaboratively with data engineers on complex infrastructure projects and advocate for and emphasize the business value of applications and offer mentorship and technical solutions to solve business problems.
Independently handle complex issues with minimal supervision, while escalating only the most complex issues to appropriate staff.
Other duties as assigned

Qualifications
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a related field or equivalent experience
Confirmed skills of enabling data content for reporting or analytics solutions
Minimum of four years of related work experience
Fluent English is mandatory

Preferred Qualifications
Certification in programing language
Confirmed skills in querying relational databases with query language
Confirmed experience working with large data stores

At Cargill, everyone matters and everyone counts. Cargill is committed to creating and sustaining an inclusive and diverse work environment where all employees are treated with dignity and respect. As such and in alignment with our Guiding Principles, Cargill's long-standing equal employment opportunity policy prohibits discrimination and harassment against any employee or applicant based on race, ethnicity, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, pregnancy, genetic information, marital status, family status, citizenship status, veteran status, military status, union affiliation, or any other status protected by law. Cargill also complies with all applicable national and local laws and regulations pertaining to non-discrimination and employment.

description:
Sobre a vaga
No Mercado Livre estamos democratizando o com√©rcio, o dinheiro e os pagamentos na Am√©rica Latina.
Nosso neg√≥cio Fintech oferece para toda a regi√£o uma proposta de valor integral, que visa democratizar os servi√ßos financeiros e satisfazer as necessidades de mais de 60 milh√µes de usu√°rias e usu√°rios.
Disponibilizamos uma plataforma online que permite receber pelas vendas eletr√¥nicas realizadas, tanto dentro como fora do Mercado Livre, e um sistema de c√≥digos QR e dispositivos Point para as vendas realizadas no mundo f√≠sico.
Para milh√µes de com√©rcios, empreendimentos e profiss√µes, damos a possibilidade de processar suas opera√ß√µes com seguran√ßa, atrav√©s de mais de 50 meios de pagamento na Am√©rica Latina.

description:
Sobre a vaga
We believe that every business should have access to affordable, easy-to-use payment solutions, no matter their size. Back in 2012, SumUp was founded by a small team with one goal in mind ‚Äì to create a world where small business owners can be successful doing what they love. Today, over 4 million businesses rely on SumUp to get paid. What started out as one card reader has now turned into a range of readers, multiple remote payment solutions such as Invoices, Gift Cards, Payment Links and so much more.

As a (Senior) Data Scientist you will be part of our MarTech mission to build a data-powered product roadmap to automate, measure and optimise Marketing activities. You will join a global team that is building foundations and running experiments to acquire customers efficiently.

What you‚Äôll do in this role:

Evolve our multi-touch attribution model, which tells the credit for conversions by marketing channel
Work on predictions and insights that contribute to shaping the direction of the company
Collaborate with an international team spanning 2 continents, made up of engineers, product manager, and marketing specialists
Act as the main Data Scientist expert in the domain, guiding the solutions and supporting team members

You will be great for this position if you have:

A degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economy, Computer Science or a comparable degree.
5+ years of experience in data science, and in marketing (marketing budget optimisation, MMM, attribution, bidding automation)
Experience building and deploying machine learning models and algorithms end-to-end at scale
Experience in experimenting and measuring marketing strategies (set up A/B test, lift test or geo test and evaluate it)
Proven experience using Python and its scientific stack (pandas, sklearn, numpy, statsmodels, xgboost, matplotlib, seaborn)
Good communication and visualisation skills in working with non-technical stakeholders
Advance knowledge of SQL
Proven experience working with Cloud Technologies (AWS, Snowflake, Airflow) and CI pipeline (GitHub Actions)
Embrace best practices and have a passion for clean, maintainable and testable code

Why you should join SumUp

We‚Äôre a truly global team of 3000+ people from 60+ countries, spread across 3 continents. We have a close, welcoming and international community
Learning & development budget for attending conferences and training
Health and life insurance
Dental plan (optional)
Our wellness benefits, such as Gympass and Zenklub
Private pension plan
Annual bonus
1 month of sabbatical vacation for every 3 years of SumUp
The opportunity to work on large scale fintech products used by millions of businesses around the world
You'll have the space and support to drive your career

About SumUp

We believe in the everyday hero.

Small business owners are at the heart of all we do, so we create powerful, easy-to-use financial solutions to help them run their businesses. With a founder‚Äôs mentality and a 'team-first‚Äô attitude, our diverse teams across Europe, South America and the United States work together to ensure that the small business owners we partner with can be successful doing what they love.

SumUp is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. SumUp does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, colour, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age or any other basis protected by applicable laws or prohibited by company policy. SumUp also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind.

SumUp will not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate.

Job Application Tip

We recognise that candidates feel they need to meet 100% of the job criteria in order to apply for a job. Please note that this is only a guide. If you don‚Äôt tick every box, it‚Äôs ok too because it means you have room to learn and develop your career at SumUp.

Binance is the global blockchain company behind the world‚Äôs largest digital asset exchange by trading volume and users, serving a greater mission to accelerate cryptocurrency adoption and increase the freedom of money.

Are you looking to be a part of the most influential company in the blockchain industry and contribute to the crypto-currency revolution that is changing the world?

We are seeking a Case Analyst to support our expansion into all global frontiers and provide support on engagement with law enforcement agencies.
