description:
Sobre a vaga
About Turing

Turing, a Series D funded unicorn, is on a mission to unleash the world's untapped potential by connecting exceptional software engineers from around the world to top US companies. We use machine learning and automation to source, vet , match and manage exceptional software engineers from around the world to top U.S. and Silicon Valley companies for remote developer positions.

We‚Äôre headquartered in Palo Alto, California and are a remote first company with over 500 employees.
We have raised a total of $140 Million.
Turing has been featured in America's best startup employers by Forbes, 2021 and in Top 10 most innovative workplace companies by Fast Company, 2021.
Turing‚Äôs customers include Coinbase, Rivian, Disney, Wish and J&J and hundreds of other Fortune 500 companies and fast-growing startups.

About the role
We are looking for a Data Science Tech Lead who can work in a data-driven environment and love to identify patterns and insights to improve our products that in turn benefit the business. The data science tech lead maintains the overall vision and specific purposes of the embedded data scientist leading the team to achieve maximum impact. If you have a strong experience in data science, and analytics, and are excited about driving results in a hyper-growth company, we want to hear from you!

Responsibilities
Lead technical data science work in a product area
Advising and mentoring junior scientists on technical issues
Fostering a culture of excellence and inclusion
Work closely with cross-functional partners to drive product improvements through data-driven decisions throughout the product life cycle.
The ownership of data science and analytics for your product area (including data logging and tracking requirements, metric definition, and analyses)
Guide and support embedded scientists in the design and implementation of analyses and experiments
Present clear and compelling stories from complex data analysis to impact strategy and product direction

Requirements
Must-Have:
5-8+ years of experience in analytics as a data scientist
Strong ability to coach data scientists technically and helping them improve their skills
Experience in data collection, aggregation, analysis, visualization, and monitoring
Experience in experimental design, A/B testing, and causal analysis
Experience in predictive modeling and machine learning
Excellent written and spoken communication skills with the ability to present ideas in a clear and concise way
Ability to work in a fast-paced start-up environment
Proficiency in SQL, Python
Nice to Have:
Graduate degree in computational or quantitative fields such as computer science, mathematics, physics, engineering, or equivalent


Advantages of joining Turing:
Amazing work culture (Super collaborative & supportive work environment)
Awesome colleagues (Surround yourself with top talent from Meta, Google, LinkedIn etc. as well as people with deep startup experience)
Competitive compensation with great tax benefits
Expect fast career growth (High growth unicorn firm)
Flexible work timings
Full-time remote opportunity. Turing is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture and celebrate authenticity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristics.

description:
Sobre a vaga
Munich Re is a global leader in agricultural & weather risk transfer solutions. A dedicated team of agronomists, economists, geographers, meteorologists, statisticians and mathematicians as well as IT specialists develop and market risk transfer solutions for a variety of clients in the agricultural sector such as primary insurers, agribusiness companies, farmers, governments, banks and multilateral organizations. With a central hub located in Munich, our experts are distributed across all continents managing a well-diversified portfolio of predominantly weather and market price risks. As reinsurance or derivative underwriters we are not only scientists but also entrepreneurs ourselves, creating value for businesses in the insurance and agribusiness sectors.

Your job

Develop technologies and tools considering the most modern ones to support the most varied fronts of innovation in the agricultural universe within the Munich Re group.
Build structured databases, implement remote sensing tools, statistical analysis, web systems development, APIs and interfaces, and coordinate and/or participate in complex projects with different types of partners, members, and partners.
Develop crop productivity models and tools that support underwriting, portfolio/crop monitoring, and claims.
Work together and support with interdisciplinary innovation teams in Brazil, Latin America, the Caribbean, and Iberia in projects under shared regional coordination, as well as occasional projects from other regions and/or global.
Constantly update concerning new technologies and potential development partners, including but not limited to agro startups (agtechs).
Constant dialogue and exchange of information and experiences with colleagues from different Munich Re units working in agro and innovation in general.
Participate in strategic discussions with the team to identify new business opportunities and provide the necessary solution development.
Analyze the agricultural environment (public policies, plans, and programs) and its potential impact on the insurance and reinsurance market; monitor new trends and opportunities in agribusiness.
Support and assist when required: internal departments (client management, underwriting, finance, claims), identification and connection of business opportunities and key partners, construction of strategic plans, project management, digital solution implementation, knowledge generation and exchange.

Your challenges

Develop technologies and tools that bring a competitive advantage to Munich Re.
Improve underwriting, monitoring, and claims processes related to agricultural insurance.
Be an innovation catalyst, working collaboratively on various projects with different teams, clients, partners, and stakeholders.
Establish and maintain relationships with strategic people, companies, and entities in the agribusiness sector, especially regarding new trends and innovation.

Your profile

Required academic background (minimum): bachelor or higher degree in agronomy, climatology, engineering, statistics or related science fields
Required experience: development of innovation/technology for the agricultural sector
Strong programming with R and/or Python
Experience with PostgreSQL or other relational database management systems
GIS tools and Remote Sensing techniques
Advanced English
Teamwork
Desired skills: Agricultural insurance and underwriting, intercultural competencies, understanding of the agribusiness market and chain, innovation and project management.

At Munich Re, we embrace, and value, the interaction of diverse backgrounds, experience, perspectives and thought. This interaction is the foundation of our open culture, spirit of partnership, of how our teams are built and cultivated, and of how we are supported and developed. And at the centre of this interaction is each of us.

You will work in an environment where we aspire to think big: Change and culture are challenged. We communicate a compelling and shared purpose and direction. We pave the way towards success and see failure as learning.

You are going to experience that we care & dare: We are empathetic. We know when to lead and know when to let others lead. We attract, grow and coach future leaders.

We aim to communicate in a clear & authentic way. We solicit feedback, ask and listen, learn and unlearn.

You will grow with your clients: Whatever our role, we support business, in a thoughtful way, to create value for our clients. We embrace new ways of working applying digitalization to provide solutions.

We lead the We: We have a passion for winning and growing as a team. We inspire people to deliver a joint performance. We create an inclusive environment where different thoughts, generations, cultures and experiences are valued and encouraged.

We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

About Munich Re:

Founded in 1880, Munich Re Group is on the world's leading providers of primary insurance, reinsurance and insurance related risk solution. As pioneers in risk assessment, we promote the digital transformation of the global insurance landscape, expanding products and services as new forms of risk emerge. From space rocket launches to cyber-attacks, from high net worth individual life cover to pandemic, we take care of risk, so our clients can take care of their business.

description:
Sobre a vaga
Recognized as one of Canada‚Äôs fastest-growing companies, Launchpad provides next-generation integration platform capabilities for connecting and managing enterprise automation and data integration. Headquartered in Vancouver, Canada, our operations span both North and South Americas, with a second headquarter located in Santiago, Chile.

In 2021, we were recognized as the winner of the BC Tech Associations Technology Impact Awards 'Company of The Year: Growth'. We recognize the global truth that today, every company is a tech company. To succeed, every company everywhere needs their data and workflows to be integrated and automated. That understanding gave us the confidence to compete with our sector's leading providers, win top-level contracts, and build a truly world-class list of clients that includes Walmart, GM, TIME Magazine, Salesforce, Tableau, Splunk, Bolt.com, Freedom House, and more.

Our vision is to bring people and technology together to work seamlessly to achieve extraordinary business outcomes and create more efficient societies. If this sounds like something you want to be part of, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

Main Responsibilities:

Integrate across systems and present data in the right place at the right time using the tools and platform provided by Salesforce.
Salesforce customization according to any aspect of the business whenever there‚Äôs a requirement
Provide clients with a solution that will grow with their company and work as they need it to.

What you‚Äôll do:

Work closely with Solutions Architect to design Force.com Platform Solutions including, but not limited to, Apex Trigger, Apex Class, Batch Job, Visualforce, Lightning Components
Implement Force.com Platform Solutions as per the Industry‚Äôs coding convention and best practices
Ensure service level availability of the Force.com platform and integration applications and provide on-call support for break/fix/enhancement activities to resolve application issues.
Implement customer-based solutions and develop products on the Force.com platform using Apex and Visual Force
Assist with the planning of application changes, development, and installation of upgrades and new releases.
Integrate multiple systems with Salesforce, including internal proprietary and third party applications
Lead customer-driven solutions utilizing strong technical design skills and strong working relationships with internal groups
Guide users in formulating requirements, advise on alternatives and on the implications of new or revised processing analysis.
Develop, document and enforce application standards and procedures

Experience & Skills:

Computer Science Degree, MIS Degree, or equivalent relevant experience
2-4 years of experience with Salesforce products
Understanding of SDLC
Certified Salesforce Platform Developer 1
Clear concepts and use of Apex, Visualforce, Lightning Web Components, Declarative Automation, Sales Cloud, understanding of integration concepts, methodologies and technologies

Why work for Launchpad?

100% remote
People first culture
Excellent compensation in US Dollars
Hardware setup for working from home
Work with global teams and prominent brands based in North America, Europe, and Asia
Training allowances
Personal time off (PTO) for vacations, study leave, personal time, etc.
...and more!

At Launchpad, we genuinely care about our people as individuals. If you are looking for a team that values growth, drive, and passion for your craft, if you‚Äôre seeking a place to achieve your goals and dreams with fairness and integrity, then you are the future of Launchpad. Launchpad is committed to fostering a diverse and representative workforce and an inclusive work environment where all employees are respected and treated equally.

Are you ready to elevate your career at Launchpad? We want to hear your story! Contact us today.

description:
Sobre a vaga
The Principal Biostatistician at Labcorp is a Lead role. This is a home-based opportunity to work with multiple Sponsors across several therapeutic areas in all phases of medical device trials, including diagnostics and imaging. The Principal Biostatistician will be leading projects, mentoring junior members of the department, and serving as a technical advisor. The position offers an excellent support network with access to Labcorp Drug Development‚Äôs statistical consultants, flexible working solutions, and the opportunity to progress your career. If you are looking to strengthen your Lead expertise within a varied and dynamic environment, then this is a fantastic opportunity.

Job Primary Functions
Perform Lead Biostatistician role on medium and high complexity studies, providing statistical oversight and attending relevant project meetings
Perform project management activities for identified projects including resource planning, timelines and milestone management
Preparation of Statistical Analysis Plans (including mock TFL shells) for medium and high complexity studies
Mentor junior biostatisticians; serve as a technical advisor to departmental employees
Perform complex statistical analyses, quality check statistical analyses developed by other statisticians
Effectively communicate statistical concepts and results to audiences with various statistical knowledge
Conduct overall statistical review of TFLs for complex studies prior to client delivery
Develop the statistical sections of the protocol for medium to high complexity studies
Provide statistical input and review the CSR for complex studies
Attend bid defense meetings for medium to high complexity studies in order to win new business
Represent the department during audits
Education Required
Master‚Äôs degree, equivalent, or higher in Biostatistics, Statistics, or related field
Qualifications
10+ years of overall experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience
Previous experience of leading studies as a Biostatistician in a CRO or at a medical device or pharma company required
Experience with medical device studies preferred
Experience with preparation of Statistical Analysis Plans, analysis, reporting, etc.
SAS¬Æ proficiency including use of a variety of statistical procedures e.g., non-parametric analysis, linear and non-linear models, categorical data and survival analysis required
Ability to effectively communicate statistical concepts, both to internal and external stakeholders
Ability to program in a statistical software package other than SAS¬Æ preferred
A good knowledge of the overall clinical trial process
Some knowledge of CDISC requirements preferred
Labcorp Is Proud To Be An Equal Opportunity Employer

As an EOE/AA employer, Labcorp strives for diversity and inclusion in the workforce and does not tolerate harassment or discrimination of any kind. We make employment decisions based on the needs of our business and the qualifications of the individual and do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy or other medical conditions/needs), family or parental status, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, personal appearance, age, veteran status, disability, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristic. We encourage all to apply.

description:
Sobre a vaga
***Los curriculums deber√°n ser entregados en ingl√©s. Si tu curriculum no est√° en ingl√©s, no ser√° revisado.***

Marketplace Manager
Natural Dog Company is a team of dog experts providing the highest quality healing products for pups around the globe. Natural Dog Company's marketing team is in search of a driven marketing professional for our Ecommerce Marketplace Manager position. https://naturaldogcompany.com/
We are looking for a metrics-driven professional to oversee our Amazon business & advertising strategy. You will build the strategy and execution of Amazon merchandising, marketing, and advertising for the Natural Dog Company brand - requiring deep knowledge of Amazon advertising platform, utilizing the analytics to drive engagement, brand awareness, and return on ad spend.

amazon.com experience is required - not amazon.mx or MercadoLibre

In this role, you will serve as a critical lead for how Natural Dog Company engages with our customers on Amazon. You will bring strong relationship-building experience, product knowledge, organizational skills, as well as a high degree of curiosity to self-motivate and work in a dynamic eCommerce environment. All of this effort will support your ability to track, analyze, and present Key Performance Indicators and insights to the team.

The ideal candidate is a seasoned growth hacker who is passionate about mastering all aspects of Amazon ecommerce! This person is ready to make an immediate impact on our brands by driving increased conversions year-round through improvements to both paid and organic efforts.

Responsibilities
Manage and maintain Amazon.com product, advertising, and merchandising strategy and catalog
Ownership of advertising on Amazon with AMS Sponsored Product & Brand Ads, developing Amazon Media campaigns for Natural Dog Company
Serve as a key contact for all Amazon related activities and lead daily operations of the Amazon business to maintain profitability, sales growth, and customer satisfaction.
Plan, and manage the execution of Amazon sponsored products campaigns and Amazon promotions
Evaluate KPIs to generate insights and recommend future strategies
Develop and maintain product pages and sales forecast, and monitor seller rating.
Work with our inventory and warehouse teams to ensure adequate stock levels and review sales velocity on an ASIN level
Collaborate with in house and external creatives to develop high performing creative assets
Work with a team of paid media specialists to mesh advertising efforts across multiple advertising platforms

Qualifications & Experience
English fluency is required. Resumes must be submitted in English.
5+ years experience in Amazon vendor/seller central platform and advertising and merchandising tools
Ability to develop and manage multiple Amazon advertising campaigns simultaneously across a number of brands
Demonstrated track record of increasing ecommerce revenue via Amazon in an omni-channel business model
Experience dealing with Seller Central problems including negative reviews, listing problems, inventory misplacement etc.
Strong design and consumer analytic skills, including the ability to link actionable items to strategic objectives and the ability to use the data and metrics to back up assumptions and recommendations

You are welcome to apply if you meet the following Required Qualifications:
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing or related field
5+ years of experience in Marketplace advertising and management
5+ years of experience executing growth strategies to reach established sales goals
Experience using data and metrics to drive improvements
Strong understanding of Amazon Seller Central and other third-party marketplaces
Exceptional attention to detail, follow‚Äìthrough and organizational skills
Able to thrive in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial, and dynamic remote environment
Proficient with software such as Google Suite

While not required, we also look for the following Preferred Qualifications:
Advanced Degree in Marketing or related field
Experience working with Project Management tools such as Asana
Experience working with graphic designs
Proficiency with Google Analytics

description:
Sobre a vaga
Our Vision.

SBM Offshore believes the oceans will provide the world with safe, sustainable and affordable energy for generations to come. We share our experience to make it happen.

Our Profile.

We design, build, install and operate offshore floating facilities for the offshore energy industry. As a leading technology provider, we put our marine expertise at the service of a responsible energy transition by reducing emissions from fossil fuel production, while developing cleaner solutions for renewable energy sources. More than 7,000 SBMers worldwide are committed to sharing their experience to deliver safe, sustainable and affordable energy from the oceans for generations to come. Together, we are driving progress forward in a TRUE. BLUE. TRANSITION.

#OGJS

Job Responsabilities

You contribute to the implementation of talent and development related processes, policies and systems, in line with company‚Äôs needs and expertise industry standards
You monitor Talent related processes and systems, using data reporting, and driving continuous improvement and change to meet strategic goals
You advise and coach Local HRBPs to ensure the identification and nurturing of talents to meet current and future business need
You contribute to the definition and implementation of the learning plan, for your remit, in line with Business needs and priorities
You interface with various stakeholders among the HR community, the Business and external network for your remit, being the catalyst that embeds a talent & development culture, in line with Company‚Äôs objectives

Job Requirements

Bachelor‚Äôs Degree
Experience in HR, including with talent management & learning matters
Experience in industry or offshore companies, with operational public
Understanding of business processes and monitoring management
Fluent level of English

GENERAL INFORMATION

SBM Offshore N.V. is a listed holding company that is headquartered in Amsterdam. It holds direct and indirect interests in other companies that collectively with SBM Offshore N.V. form the SBM Offshore Group (‚Äúthe Company‚Äù). For further information, please visit our website at www.sbmoffshore.com . The companies in which SBM Offshore N.V., directly and indirectly, owns investments are separate entities.

SBM Offshore is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. SBM Offshore does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status, or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

Sobre a vaga
Who we are?
We are a global leader and trusted partner focused on developing, manufacturing and distributing agricultural solutions with our brands Challenger¬Æ, Fendt¬Æ, GSI¬Æ, Massey Ferguson¬Æ and Valtra¬Æ, powered by Fuse¬Æ and Precision Planting¬Æ smart agricultural solutions.
Our purpose is to offer farmer-focused solutions to sustainably feed our world. Our core values of transparency, respect, responsibility, integrity and team spirit underpin our work, how we interact with each other and what strategies we employ to fulfill our mission. Our core values are the practices we use daily in everything we do.
If the world of agriculture changes, so do we. With courage. We do this for the farmers. For the people who work for them. For us. For the future.
Join us and experience our platform of global diversity and entrepreneurial spirit as you help us create innovative technologies and positively impact the food of nearly 8 billion people worldwide.

What we are looking for:
The Pl CRM Analyst will play a key part in creating, updating and maintain processes related to Salesforce at AGCO Parts in Americas. This person will help both South and North America with projects related to the CRM and collaborate with internal stakeholders to ensure adoption and improve efficiency. Support Case Management on Customer Service, as well as indentify improvements on Dealers workplaces. Aims to guarantee data quality and consistency between systems. Will also support dashboard and reporting creation, helping Management Team on the definition of metrics and KPIs.

What are you going to do:
Be a functional reference in projects related to CRM (especially Case Management, Report, Dashboard); Analysis, assignment and follow up incidents with IT; Training to key users; KPI¬¥s management; Participate on Projets.

What do you need:
Knowledge and experiences required: - Salesforce; - SAP system; - Tableau knowledge would be a plus.

If you are not an AGCO employee, check more details about this position and apply at:
https://careers.agcocorp.com//job-invite/94231/

Diversity, Equity & Inclusion:
Our vacancies are for everyone. We recognize the importance of diversity, equity and inclusion in our work environment. We consider diversity as a power to leverage creativity and innovation. We work on equity to ensure that all people have fair conditions to be and evolve. Likewise, we invest in promoting an inclusive environment as a key to increasing team satisfaction and generating more business success.

description:
Sobre a vaga
Recognized as the leading software development company in the Americas, our client offers 100% remote modality and an excellent work environment in which employees can thrive, work in multicultural teams, with flexible schedules and endless growth opportunities.

About the Role:

We are looking for Python Senior Developers to join our Development team and participate in different projects made up of multicultural teams distributed throughout the world. We are looking for proactive people, team players passionate about programming in this language and oriented to provide the best experience to the end user. This is an excellent opportunity for those professionals looking to develop in one of the fastest growing companies in the industry!

These developers will face numerous technical challenges, so they must use current technologies, get involved in the mobile world, web applications, devices, etc.

Main Activities:

- Create automation systems and tools to configure, monitor, and orchestrate data infrastructure and pipelines.
- Create data integration services to help onboard new customers as quickly as possible.
- Maintain ongoing reliability, performance, and support of the data infrastructure, providing solutions based on application needs and anticipated growth.

Requirements:

- 5+ years of practical experience in Python and Django development.
- Experience in development with object-oriented programming is desirable.
- 3 years of development using other programming languages.
- Good skills with XML and relational databases (Oracle / MS SQL / MySQL).
- Strong professional experience working with large data structures (including XML) and algorithms.
- Advanced English level.

Benefits:

- 100% remote work.
- Flexible hours - make your own schedule!
- Diverse and multicultural work environment.
- Paid parental leave, vacation & holidays.
- Hardware setup for you to work from home.
- Excellent compensation ‚Äî well above the market average.
- Extensive opportunities for growth and professional development thanks to our mentoring system.

Enjoy the opportunity to have a dynamic lifestyle, better health, and wellness. Find renewed passion in your job, improve your productivity, and benefit from attractive growth opportunities for your career.

If you are interested in being part of a team composed of the best professionals and working 100% goal-oriented in an innovative environment, but with the structure and resources of a multinational market leader, do not hesitate to apply!

A healthtech company on a mission to improve the lives of patients and partners through genomics-based personalized medicine is looking for a Python/Django Developer. The developer will be responsible for designing and developing the application features. The company is committed to helping patients take control of their health by exploring particular risk factors and identifying optimal diets, exercise, and supplement strategies to help people achieve their best lives. As a member of the team, the selected candidate will have an opportunity to provide a unique set of values and learn from the senior and architectural team members. This will be a long-term role that requires an overlap with the EST time zone.

Job Responsibilities:

Participate in the engineering aspect of a professional software development process
Collaborate with different teams to build software that fits the vision and a more holistic purpose
Work closely with product management to implement new features
Advocate for the application‚Äôs performance and quality
Contribute to technical discussions and communicate your ideas clearly
Address complex problems and stay open to debates and brainstorming sessions

Solid expertise in PostgreSQL
Strong communication skills and experience in SQL
Competency in multi-database configurations with Django is desirable

description:
Sobre a vaga
Experience Remote done Right. Over 20 years of remote experience, all 500+ staff are 100% remote and we still grow vibrant relationships, provide exceptional opportunities for career growth while working with stellar clients on ambitious projects

What we're working on
Enterprise companies turn to us to help them launch innovative digital products that interact with hundreds of millions of customers, transactions and data points. The problems we solve every day are real and require creativity, grit and determination. We are building a culture that challenges norms while fostering experimentation and personal growth. In order to grasp the scale of problems we face, ideally, you have some exposure to Logistics, FinTech, Transportation, Insurance, Media or other complex multifactor industries

Requirements
7+ years of professional experience (A technical assessment will be required)
Extensive experience with Selenium
Experience with Cypress/Puppeteer
Strong with browser and API testing
Advanced Fluency in English, written and verbal
Strong understanding of mobile app development frameworks and platforms such as Android, iOS, React Native, Flutter, etc.
Experience with mobile automation testing frameworks such as Appium, Espresso, XCUITest, etc.
Knowledge of mobile-specific testing techniques such as gesture testing, localization testing, battery consumption testing, etc.
Familiarity with testing tools and libraries for mobile app testing, including Charles Proxy, Postman, Fiddler, etc.
Understanding of mobile app performance testing and profiling, including analyzing CPU usage, memory usage, network usage, etc.
Experience in testing mobile applications across different devices and platforms, including smartphones, tablets, wearables, and other IoT devices.
Knowledge of mobile app security testing, including OWASP mobile top 10 vulnerabilities, encryption, secure storage, and other security best practices.
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail, with the ability to identify, troubleshoot, and resolve complex issues.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment and communicate technical information to non-technical stakeholders.
Knowledge of Agile software development methodologies and experience working in Agile teams.

Straight from the Devs

Be 100% dedicated to one project at a time so that you can hone your skills, innovate and grow
Be a part of a team of talented and friendly senior-level developers
Work on projects that allow you to use cutting edge tech. We believe in constantly evolving your mastery

The result? We produce meaningful work and we are truly proud and excited to be creating waves in an industry under transformation.

description:
Sobre a vaga
Translations.com is looking for a skilled and motivated Solutions Engineer to join our team and help grow the GlobalLink Product Suite for global enterprise clients. As an SE, you will play a crucial role in supporting the sales team in a pre-sales capacity, demonstrating the technical aspects and benefits of our products to potential customers. You will report to the Vice President of Content Solutions.

Key Responsibilities:

Engage with potential customers to understand their business needs and demonstrate the value of the GlobalLink solution through discovery process and pre-sales product demonstrations.
Provide technical support during the sales process, including customer meetings and presentations.
Collaborate with the global sales team on post-demo follow-ups, including technology feasibility review, pricing proposals and contract creation.
Support the technology sales efforts of the global sales team.
Become a Subject Matter Expert on the GlobalLink Product Suite, its architecture, and integration components.
Collaborate with Sales, Product, and Engineering teams to drive the success of GlobalLink products by providing customer feedback and staying current with industry trends and new technologies.

Requirements:

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
3+ years of experience in a customer-facing role as a Solutions Architect, Technical Consultant, Partner/Sales/Solutions Engineer, or similar.
Fluency in English, Spanish and Portuguese
Self-motivated, detail-oriented, and able to work independently with minimal instruction.
Excellent technical and communication skills.
Proven experience in demonstrating software solutions and value propositions.
Creative thinking and problem-solving skills.
Ability to travel as required for client meetings and events, with limited travel in the short term due to COVID impact on business travel.

Preferred:

Experience in the localization and translation industry.
Fluency in foreign languages is a plus.
Background in content management systems.
Knowledge of Java, .NET, Web Services, and other web and software technologies.
Experience in developing/architecting global enterprise solutions.
Knowledge of SaaS solutions.

We offer a dynamic and challenging work environment, competitive compensation, and a comprehensive benefits package. If you're ready for new challenges and eager to join a growing company, we welcome your application for this exciting opportunity.


About Us:
Translations.com is a world leader in website and software localization, TMS (Translation Management System) software products, and enterprise-level, professional translation services. Our translation solutions allow a diverse array of clients to deliver local language products, services, applications, training, and content in a culturally appropriate manner.

We were founded on the principle that great service is, and always will be, a key differentiator in the localization industry. Our dedication to client satisfaction is what we consider to be our most valuable asset. From President to Project Manager, we believe that making our clients' lives easier and delivering language services that exceed expectations allows us to develop and maintain strong client relationships, and hence to grow our business. Please visit us at www.translations.com.

By applying, I confirm I have read and accept TransPerfect's Privacy Policy: https://www.transperfect.com/about/data-privacy-recruiting

A fast-growing company that is leveraging the advancements in modern technology to help customers promptly transition to a greener energy economy, is looking for a Data Scientist. The selected candidate will be responsible for building pipelines for tools, testing, and observability to help improve data quality. This is a nice opportunity for developers who are eager to work with cutting-edge technologies while building a lucrative career for themselves.

General information

All posting locations S√£o Paulo, S√£o Paulo, Brazil

Description & Requirements

OBJETIVO
Suportar a entrega do volume e abastecimento de vendas atrav√©s da execu√ß√£o das rotinas- abrangendo o planejamento do m√™s- como o desdobramento de metas e cotas de SKU- constru√ß√£o e acompanhamento do plano de faturamento- bem como a gest√£o completa do ciclo de Remunera√ß√£o Vari√°vel de Vendas- ajudando na integra√ß√£o dos processos entre Heinz e Hemmer.

PRINCIPAIS RESPONSABILIDADES
Suportar o time de vendas com a cria√ß√£o de relat√≥rios e an√°lises atrav√©s do Excel e/ou Tableau- a fim de identificar oportunidades em disponibilidade- alavancagem de venda- descontos etc.
Determinar a meta de Vendas- desdobrando por canal- regional e cliente e estabelecendo as cotas de SKU.
Desenhar e acompanhar o plano de faturamento- suportando na entrega da semana e do m√™s- fornecendo visibilidade e insights di√°rio sobre o andamento dos KPIs.
Gerir o processo de Remunera√ß√£o Vari√°vel de Vendas do desdobramento das metas junto da ger√™ncia comercial- at√© o acompanhamento ao longo do m√™s- execu√ß√£o da apura√ß√£o- levantamento de cr√≠ticas (reliefs) e fechamento do resultado do m√™s para pagamento.
Reportar indicadores financeiros e comerciais da BU- sendo ponto de contato para o time de Performance- respons√°vel pelo c√°lculo- consolida√ß√£o e atualiza√ß√£o das informa√ß√µes no sistema.

REQUISITOS
Superior completo.

Senso anal√≠tico.
Capacidade de resolu√ß√£o de problemas.
Bom relacionamento interpessoal.
Autonomia.
Resili√™ncia.
Senso de dono.

About Us

Kraft Heinz is a global food company with a delicious heritage. With iconic and emerging food and beverage brands around the world, we deliver the best taste, fun and quality to every meal table we touch. We‚Äôre on a mission to disrupt not only our own business, but the global food industry. A consumer obsession and unexpected partnerships fuel our progress as we drive innovation across every part of our company.

Around the world, our people are connected by a culture of ownership, agility and endless curiosity. We also believe in being good humans, who are working to improve our company, communities, and planet. We‚Äôre proud of where we‚Äôve been ‚Äì and even more thrilled about where we‚Äôre headed ‚Äì as we nourish the world and lead the future of food.

Why Us

We grow our people to grow our business. We champion great people who bring ambition, curiosity, and high performance to the table as the guardians of our beloved and nostalgic brands. Good isn't good enough. We choose greatness every day by challenging the ordinary and making bold decisions. All while celebrating our wins - and our failures ‚Äì as we work together to lead the future of food.

Challenging the status quo takes talent. We invest in your purpose and potential by developing skills and nurturing strengths that leave a legacy on our business and a lasting impact on your career. Because great people make great companies, and we‚Äôre growing something great here at Kraft Heinz.

description:
Sobre a vaga
Location : BAL - GASPAR

City : Gaspar

State : Santa Catarina (BR-SC)

Country : Brazil (BR)

Requisition Number : 26349

Bunge has an exciting opportunity available for a Back End Developer . In this role you will be part of a global team working on challenging, meaningful projects impacting core business activities.

Since 1818, Bunge has been connecting farmers to consumers to deliver essential food, feed, and fuel to the world. Looking to the future, our ambition is to continuously reinvent ourselves, leveraging data to be at the forefront of analytics, technology and talent to accomplish our purpose in a better, faster and simpler way. Bunge is committed to operating and thriving in the digital world ‚Äì creating world class agile teams where teammates are empowered and encouraged to collaborate and test and learn to succeed.

At Bunge, people don‚Äôt just come here to work, they come here to grow ‚Äì solving challenges that directly impact the world with a diverse team of thinkers and doers. Bunge offers a strong compensation and benefits package, generous paid time off program, flexible work arrangements, and opportunity to progress. Our hybrid work environment provides a balance of in office and remote work.

Most importantly, in all we do we live our values:

Act as One Team by fostering inclusion, collaboration, and respect
Drive for Excellence by being agile, innovative and efficient
Do What's Right by acting safely, ethically, and sustainably

Overview :

Back End developer role is to integrate the application with all required systems and services and provide clean and easy to use API for the frontend part of the system. Bears full responsibility for the application functionality, performance and scalability. Knows how to write clean modern APIs, integrate with legacy systems and work with databases.

Responsibilities:

Design and develop the business logic and backend systems of the product
Interact with Projects Managers, Business Analysts, Architects, Developers and stakeholders throughout the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC)
Design and develop the business logic and backend systems of the MVP experience
Work closely with frontend developers to design and develop functional, performing and complete APIs
Decipher existing company software systems and be able to hook in application to applicable data sources
Work closely with other developers and QAs to understand the system end-to-end
Write both unit and integration tests, and develop automation tools for daily tasks
Develop high quality, well documented, and
efficient code
Challenge ideas and opinions to avoid pitfalls and inefficient solutions

Qualifications/Requirements:

At least 3-5 years of working experience in NodeJs programming language and related technologies, preferably in a role of backend developer
Deep knowledge of Object-Oriented programing and engineering principles like SOLID
High familiarity with coding best practices, design patterns and modern architectures (e.g. microservices)
Significant experience writing and utilizing autonomous services oriented RESTful API services and performance tuning largescale apps
Knowledge of application server platforms (Websphere, Jboss) as well as cloud solutions (AWS, GCP, Azure)
Working experience with ORM solutions (e.g. Hibernate, JPA, myBatis)
Experience with database systems, with knowledge of SQL and NoSQL stores (e.g. MySQL, Oracle, MongoDB, Couchbase, etc.)
Experience integrating with JavaScript frameworks, such as React, Angular JS... is a plus
Experience with .Net Core
Ability to write effective unit, integration, and API tests
Nice to have knowledge of immutable infrastructure, infrastructure automation and provisioning tools
Experience in Agile Development, as a backend developer (or similar) experience preferred
Understand technical best practices to support Agile development
Understands relationship between Product Owner, Scrum Master, and rest of team
Understanding basics of Scrum methodology
Strong communication skills with ability to communicate complex technical concepts and align organization on decisions
Sound problem-solving skills with the ability to quickly process complex information and present it clearly and simply
Utilizes team collaboration to create innovative solutions efficiently
Passionate about technology and excited about the impact of emerging/disruptive technologies
Engaged, focused and goal-oriented
Open to participating in continuous improvement processes in agile environment
Embraces a culture of trust and complete transparency
Open to learning new ideas outside scope or knowledge

Hybrid work - Gaspar - Santa Catarina or S√£o Paulo - SP

Bunge (NYSE: BG) is a world leader in sourcing, processing and supplying oilseed and grain products and ingredients. Founded in 1818, Bunge‚Äôs expansive network feeds and fuels a growing world, creating sustainable products and opportunities for more than 70,000 farmers and the consumers they serve across the globe. The company is headquartered in St. Louis, Missouri and has 25,000 employees worldwide who stand behind more than 350 port terminals, oilseed processing plants, grain facilities, and food and ingredient production and packaging facilities around the world.

Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship, age, disability or military or veteran status, or any other legally protected status. Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled

description:
Sobre a vaga
Our mission is to unlock the collaborative power of communities by making Web3 universally easy to use, access, and build on.

Working with ConsenSys puts you at the forefront of an evolving paradigm, transforming our society for the better. We fundamentally believe blockchain is the next generation of technology that can lay the foundation for a more just and equitable society.

Blockchain tech is just over 10 years old. Ethereum itself is still a toddler and we‚Äôre far from reaching our full potential. You‚Äôll get to work on the tools, infrastructure, and apps that scale these platforms to billions of users.

You‚Äôll be constantly exposed to new concepts, ideas, and frameworks from your peers, and as you work on different projects ‚Äî challenging you to stay at the top of your game. You‚Äôll join a network of entrepreneurs and technologists that reaches the edge of our ecosystem. ConsenSys alumni have moved on to become tech entrepreneurs, CEOs, and team leads at tech companies.

About Metamask

MetaMask aims to create a thriving engineering organization that supports the well-being of our engineers while empowering them to do work they are proud of and enjoy. We strive for an environment that gives our people high trust and autonomy, while also facilitating collaboration, communication and camaraderie among teams and teammates. We aspire to build a diverse engineering team, including people from all backgrounds and demographics. It is also important to us that working at MetaMask is an experience that catalyzes career growth and learning.

What You‚Äôll Do

We are looking for an experienced Solidity engineer to join the Delegation team to build the most seamless onboarding experience for MetaMask users. You will be working directly with one of the founders of MetaMask on a small team of experienced Solidity developers on researching and implementing a variety of novel use cases that facilitate a secure user experience.

Responsibilities Will Include

Research, experiment with, and advise on implementing delegation in MetaMask.
Involve in all the necessary steps to bring delegation to market. For example, building toolings and maintaining documentation.
This is a small autonomous team and you will be as much of an owner as anyone on the team to bring this idea from conception to production.

Would be great if you brought this to the role

Excellent communication skills (writing and speaking) in English
Experienced in Solidity and JavaScript/TypeScript
Familiarity with EVM concepts such as multisig and ERC-1271
Multiple years of experience shipping Solidity and JavaScript/TypeScript code to production
Understanding of Ethereum and the blockchain ecosystem
Passion for making seamless onboarding experiences for the next billion of blockchain users
Proactive and self-driven to be successful working in a remote environment
Ability to work during U.S. working hours, or have at least 4 hours of overlapping working hours with U.S. time zones (Eastern or Pacific time)

Don't meet all the requirements? Don't sweat it. We‚Äôre passionate about building a diverse team of humans and as such, if you think you've got what it takes for our chaotic but fun, remote-friendly, start-up environment‚Äîapply anyway, detailing your relevant transferable skills in your cover letter. While we have a pretty good idea of what we need, we're ready for you to challenge our thinking on who needs to be in this role.

The salary range for US-based candidates only will be determined throughout the interview process depending on experience and skills. Candidates should anticipate a base salary (not including bonus, equity or other benefits) of $USD[$187,000-$235,000]

ConsenSys is an equal-opportunity employer. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply. We are committed to ensuring that our technology is made available and accessible to everyone. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, colour, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. ConsenSys is aware of fraudulent recruitment practices and we encourage all applicants to review our best practices to protect themselves which can be found (https://consensys.net/careers/best-practices-to-avoid-recruitment-fraud/).

description:
Sobre a vaga

Requisitos da vaga

position: Vendor Solutions Consultant, Financial Planning and Analysis
required_skills: ['Estrat√©gia corporativa', 'Estrat√©gia de mitiga√ß√£o', 'Finan√ßas comerciais', 'Finan√ßas corporativas', 'Melhoria de processos', 'Modelagem de neg√≥cios', 'Opera√ß√µes de vendas', 'Ops', 'Question√°rios', 'Strat']
description:
Sobre a vaga
Only applications of candidates with Mexican citizenship will be evaluated for this role in compliance with the provisions of Article 7 of the Federal Labor Law.

Please submit your resume in English - we can only consider applications submitted in this language.

Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Mexico City, CDMX, Mexico; Buenos Aires, Argentina; S√£o Paulo, State of S√£o Paulo, Brazil; Santiago, Chile; Bogot√°, Bogota, Colombia; Lima, Peru.Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
11 years of experience in FP&A, management consulting, corporate strategy, finance, business, or sales operations.
Experience with Business Finance, Strat Ops FP&A roles and business modeling, management reporting, project management, process improvement, and operational metrics.
Ability to speak and write in English, and Portuguese or Spanish fluently.

Preferred qualifications:

MBA or Master's degree in a finance, management or technical field.
Experience writing and negotiating agreement documents.
Experience managing multiple global stakeholders, and collaborating globally/cross-functionally with vendor, compliance, business, operations, marketing, and product teams.
Ability to engineer financial and operational processes and enable change management.
Excellent written/verbal communication, project management, and stakeholder management skills, with a focus on negotiating and delivering successful projects with vendors.

About The Job

The Google Cloud Vendor Management Organization (VMO) has responsibility for all extended workforce needs across Google Cloud, including but not limited to extended workforce strategy, vendor partner selection, governance and operations, and performance management. The team is focused on partnering deeply with the businesses we support to achieve issue resolution and value creation.

As a Vendor Solutions Consultant, you will assist in sourcing and establishing vendors, engaging structures, and governance models. You will work as an advisor and extended workforce specialist to our business stakeholders, partnering with cross-functional teams for successful execution.

In this role, you will benchmark rates against different functions, enabling Google Cloud to engage high-quality vendors and performance at optimal costs. You will work with global vendors and collaborate with cross-functional business teams (e.g., Cloud Support, Legal, Sales, and Engineering) to manage extended workforce agreements, vendor selection, administration of requests for location strategy, and rate card discussions. You will also support the development of standardized Statements of Work (SOW) terms for Google Cloud services which will protect Google from operational, regulatory, and reputational risks.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations‚Äô ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google‚Äôs cutting-edge technology ‚Äì all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

Partner on the development/execution of vendor agreements and management strategy including planning, commercial models, and productivity improvement programs, to drive supplier performance and meet/exceed performance goals.
Review, analyze, and categorize various agreements across vendor operations and compare against established agreement standards to identify gaps and minimize operational risk for Google with effective mitigation strategies.
Review and propose location strategy, rate cards, and commercial clauses in agreements to identify gaps to established standards and industry best practices, while driving quality and cost optimization.
Conduct primary and secondary external market research around cost benchmarks across global locations and service types, identifying opportunities for improvement of our agreement to payments life-cycle.
Write up requests for cross-documents detailing scope of services, service requirements, capability questionnaires, response templates, and pricing templates.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

description:
Sobre a vaga
Job Title

Project Manager

Job Description

Are you interested in new technologies?

Would you like to work on a variety of international projects involving different market segments?

If yes, the position of Project Manager could well be the ideal next step in your career and personal development.

This is a great opportunity to start in a big project for a lead customer in the e-commerce market and continue your development and responsibilities in the position.

As a Project Manager your main functions/ tasks will be

Monitoring project planning and its revisions
Ensure compliance with key dates and milestones, as well as follow-up on activity advancement processes.
Coordination of the different parts/disciplines involved (departments, subcontractors, customer) for management resources and materials.
Collaboration with your local Project Manager on the analysis and management of risks and valued opportunities.
Ensuring reach across its entire dimension.
Lead and coordinate the on-site team to meet the scope of the project.
Ensure that each discipline leads and oversees their respective subcontractors in supply, times and quality.
'On site' support to key figures of the deployment process Site Manager / Integration Manager / Commissioning Engineer.
Ensure proper customer communication with the different on-site disciplines.
Understand customer needs and expectations and build trust.
Search for new opportunities with the aim of improving the result.

As a Project Manager within Vanderlande Chile, we are looking for a person with the follow experience and skills

Bachelor or Master‚Äôs degree in Engineering, and a strong preference to work within a business to business environment;
Min 4 years of experience in the management of projects in an environment of industrial installations or implementation of industrial projects;
Natural leader with excellent communication and motivational skills
Dynamic problem solver with drive, determination to deliver challenging projects
Strong analytical skills, the ability to use your logistic skills in analyzing and understanding customer processes, creating concept solutions;
Strong communicational skills and a creative approach to build professional client relationships;
Ability to work within an international work environment, especially working within a project organization;
Strong language skills in English (C1), both verbal and written, and a high level of Spanish (B2);
Willingness to travel on-site

Our offer

As a Project Manager, you will get the opportunity to contribute to the growth and profitability of Vanderlande Industries. An organization which has been elected as ‚ÄòTop Employer‚Äô and ‚ÄòBest Employer‚Äô for several years in a row and is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer.

We offer a full-time position in an informal working environment with a lot of opportunities for personal development.

Apply now!

Thank you very much for your interest!

description:
Sobre a vaga
Job Description

Infosys Brazil is looking for professionals with the Snowflake Developer profile.

Job Description

This professional will play a key role in engaging with the business and functional team in providing the most appropriate technical solutions, in compliance with the client's and Infosys' development standards. It will also support knowledge transfer with the aim of providing value-added solutions that enable our customers to meet the ever-changing needs of the global landscape.

Required Qualifications

Experience in SQL or PL/SQL is required. Expertise in database handling languages (SQL and variants)
Certification in Snowflake ( Preferred )
Hands on experience on at least one large scale Data-warehouse Migration to AWS/Azure Cloud
Experience with Native Cloud Databases
Hands on experience on Snowflake DB and Development experience on Snowsql/Snowpipe , task , streams , containers creations and management, Procedures etc.
Knowledge on structured/ semi structure/ unstructured data set .
Knowledge of (or ability to learn) how metrics might translate or should be altered in Snowflake solution to manage the right events
Knowledge of other programming languages and ability to write code (e.g., VBA, python, XML, R) is preferrable .
Expert in data modeling (physical and logical), ER diagrams, data dictionary, data map, normalize/de-normalize, agile data modeling
Nice to have knowledge in data manipulation tools such as: SSMS, SSIS, Access, Excel, Info Steward, Data Services

Main Activities And Responsibilities

Developing and maintaining data architecture and data models
Create standardized procedures for data flows
Conduct efficient data integration with other third-party tools and Snowflake
Create and maintain the documentation of the architecture, data models and maintenance activities
Review and audit existing data models and solutions and propose better processes
Perform tuning, testing and problem analysis
Identify, design, implement and deploy new Snowflake based data architecture
Automate manual processes and optimize the data flows
Collaborate with the data science experts, BI developers and analysts to create custom data models and integrations with Snowflake
Maintain optimal data pipeline with ETL tools
Resolve production issues to ensure seamless data processing
Additional Information

Type of work: CLT , Flexible hours and hybrid format (face-to-face and remote)
Benefit package: Transportation Voucher, Meal Voucher, Day Care Assistance, Life Insurance, Funeral Assistance, Medical and Dental Insurance,
Career: Global performance in national and international clients and/or projects, possibility of moving in an international career.
Development: Infosys Global Education Center is the largest corporate university in the world, we provide more than 80,000 titles of internal training, in addition to courses and certifications with approved partners (Microsoft, Google, Amazon and SAP), free of charge for all our professionals.
About Us

Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in more than 50 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over four decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.

Infosys is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, spouse of protected veteran, or disability.

description:
Sobre a vaga
The Company
Tollanis Solutions Inc is a global, Managed IT Service provider with the mission of empowering change through process and people. Tollanis provides both the technological tools and the expertise that allows organizations to thrive. Our trademarked Synergist Framework allows organizations to create meaningful change by focusing on process and people. We are a global team with offices in North America and India.

The Role
We are looking for an analytical, results-driven Back-end Developer who will work with team members to troubleshoot and improve current back-end applications and processes. The Back-end Developer will use his or her understanding of programming languages and tools to analyze current code and industry developments, formulate more efficient processes, solve problems, and create a more seamless experience for the users. You should have excellent communication, time management, and problem-solving skills.

To succeed as a back-end developer, you should be focused on building better and more efficient programs and delivering an excellent end-user experience. You should be knowledgeable, collaborative, and motivated.

Duties and Responsibilities
Leverage product understanding & roadmap to determine which capabilities should be implemented.
Maintains professional and technical knowledge by tracking emerging trends / new functionality within Azure Cloud releases.
Support the development and maintenance of technology standards, policies, and procedures to support the technology roadmap.
Assist with workflow/process design, best practice education, and administration of solutions when assigned.
Create/update team processes and procedures as necessary.
Assist in creating test plans, and in coordinating/testing enhancements and new versions of Sandbox and Production environments.
Full technical integration of the Zendesk platform into the consumer support environment to include changes, widget implementation, API integration, workflow configuration, and reporting configurations.
Own and maintain documentation for Zendesk setup, issue resolution, customizations, etc.
If needed Zendesk training and certification will be provided. Familiarity or previous experience with the system is a minimum requirement.

Position Type and Expected Hours of Work:
This is a full-time remote position. Current days and hours of work are Monday through Friday, 9:00 AM to 5:30 PM ET United States day.

Requirements:
2+ years of experience with the Microsoft Azure cloud.
Experience with C# with in-depth knowledge of REST APIs.
Experience with Git (Github, GitLab, etc.) and Terraform.
Familiarity with front-end languages (e.g. HTML, JavaScript and CSS).
Experience with the Zendesk Support Suite and Zendesk automation and customization capabilities would be a significant advantage.
Excellent analytical and time management skills.
Teamwork skills with a problem-solving attitude.

What We Offer:
Work from Home ‚Äì we are a remote-first organization.
Flexible working hours
Ability to advance in a fast-growing IT business.
Competitive salary commensurate with experience.

Individuals seeking employment at Tollanis Solutions, Inc are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, or sexual orientation.
Job Features
Job Category
IT

Work From Home (WFH)
Remote from Anywhere

description:
Sobre a vaga
**PLEASE SHARE RESUME IN ENGLISH LANGUAGE ONLY **
We are looking for Deployment Engineer, a key highly technical position within our growing company with dynamic and exciting environment.

The IMS deployment engineer is responsible for integration and implementation of RADCOM IMS Monitoring solution within our customers‚Äô virtual, physical, and cloud-based environments. The engineer will be actively involved with the different aspects of RADCOM solution integration and will work in partnership with multiple departments and functions within the organization.

The engineer shall be viewed by the customer as the Subject Matter Expert for VoLTE and IMS and for the RADCOM IMS and VoLTE monitoring solution, including certification, configuration, administration, and troubleshooting.

IMS Deployment engineer will also be in involved with support escalation of operational issues related to IMS/VoLTE and will work closely with the customer and partners in a dynamic versatile environment with cutting-edge technologies.

Engagements and duties:

¬∑ Work in partnership with internal resources, such as Project Management, Engineering, Professional Services, Product Management and System Architects to push the integration through its phases. He/She will enable the solution in the lab, troubleshoot any issues during integration and will stay actively involved during the production phase as new features and versions are released.
¬∑ Take active role in defining and executing test plan for the VoLTE/IMS services by writing test objects and detailed test plan description, followed by hands-on execution of the test cases in a lab environment while documenting all activity and results.
¬∑ Interact and engage with customers‚Äô personnel handling lab integration, field deployment and operation of RADCOM‚Äôs system, as we well as end users, to assure optimal usability of the RADCOM solution and the highest level of customer satisfaction. He/she will attend daily/weekly meetings with customer and RADCOM internal resources.
¬∑ Handle service request and change requests related to IMS/VoLTE; be involved in tracking and certifying the tickets till resolution
¬∑ Be involved in user training and coach customer‚Äôs users, operations and lab personnel about aspects relating to RADCOM IMS/VoLTE technology, solution components or its infrastructure.
¬∑ Support escalations and issues diagnosis.


Required qualifications:
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Engineering.
At least 2-3 years of experience with networking and network troubleshooting.
Sound knowledge, understanding and experience in networking at all layers
Experience with IMS/VoLTE/VoNR networking and network troubleshooting including solid understanding of IMS core, the different NFs and their role and thorough understanding of IMS/VoLTE call flows of different services and scenarios.
Familiarity and experience with the following technologies and protocols: VoIP, SIP, RTP, Diameter, GTP, IP, DNS, MEGACO.
Experience with Virtualization environments below is an advantage: VMWare, Open Stack, Public Cloud, HEAT Instantiation, Orchestration.
Experience with 4G Wireless core and IMS core - is an advantage.
Knowledge in systems including Linux, shell scripting, Kubernetes ‚Äì an advantage
Experience with Network Function Virtualization (NFV), Software Defined Networks (SDN) or cloud-native technologies - A significant advantage.
Experience with database and analytics is an advantage


**The position requires occasional travel within the US and abroad

description:
Sobre a vaga
Overview:
We are seeking an experienced AWS DevOps Engineer to join our team. We specialize in providing custom software solutions to a diverse range of clients, from startups to Fortune 500 companies. Our focus is on using cutting-edge technology and agile methodologies to deliver the best possible results for our clients.

Job Overview:
The AWS DevOps Engineer will be responsible for managing and maintaining client cloud infrastructure on AWS. This includes designing and implementing scalable, secure, and highly available systems, as well as developing and automating deployment pipelines using modern DevOps tools and practices.

Technologies:
Terraform
Ansible
Docker
Docker-Compose
AWS
Linux
Bash
Ruby (application support)
Python (rarely)
Git
MySQL
ElasticSearch
Redis

Responsibilities:
Design, implement, and manage AWS infrastructure, including EC2 instances, VPCs, S3 buckets, RDS databases, and other AWS services.
Build and manage deployment pipelines using current technologies.
Develop and maintain infrastructure as code using tools such as Terraform and Ansible.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to infrastructure, deployments, and application performance.
Collaborate with development teams to optimize application performance, scalability, and security.
Implement and manage security controls, including IAM roles and policies, VPC security groups, and network ACLs.
Develop and maintain disaster recovery and business continuity plans.
Stay up-to-date with the latest AWS services, DevOps tools, and best practices.

Requirements:
12+ years of experience in AWS DevOps, with a strong background in Linux/Unix administration, networking, and security.
Expertise in AWS services such as EC2, S3, RDS, IAM, VPC, and CloudWatch.
Experience with infrastructure as code tools such as Terraform and Ansible.
Strong scripting skills using Python, Bash, or another language.
Experience with CI/CD tools.
Knowledge of containerization and orchestration tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, or ECS.
Experience with monitoring and logging tools.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
AWS certifications such as AWS Certified DevOps Engineer or AWS Certified Solutions Architect are preferred.

If you have a passion for DevOps and AWS and are looking for a challenging and rewarding career opportunity, we encourage you to apply for this position.

description:
Sobre a vaga
We're looking for a talented and passionate Senior Business Analyst to join Wildlife's War Machines game in Brazil.

We know that the work we do has a high impact on our company's success and culture. The right person for this position is curious by nature, and comfortable in a "take the initiative" environment, loves solving problems, and can thrive in a fast and growing business.

What You‚Äôll Do

Provide high-quality data analysis and recommendations to support business decisions
Assist game stakeholders on all game aspects: features, game economy, UA optimization, CRM campaigns, Engagement, Monetization
Explore, analyze and process massive amounts of data, turning it into actionable business actions
Design, build and maintain reports, dashboards, and metrics, in addition to monitoring and maintaining the integrity and validity of the data

What You Need

A quantitative mind and passion for data
3+ years of work as a product analyst, preferably for a web or mobile company, Online Gaming industry
Strong SQL skills, experience in querying large, complex data sets - Must
Advanced Excel, Tableau knowledge ‚Äì strong advantage
Familiarity and experience with product experiments (A/B tests) - an advantage
Python, R, Scala, or any other scripting language - an advantage
A methodological approach for data together with the ability to present the data clearly and efficiently to support business decisions

More About You

A true team player
Can-do attitude
Excellent communication skills
Organized work methodologies
Self-motivated
Ability to initiate and drive projects from beginning to end independently
A true passion for understanding consumers‚Äô social gaming behavior and tolerance for ambiguity
Excellent English skills
Someone who can turn complex concepts into actionable recommendations

About Wildlife

Wildlife is one of the leading mobile game developers and publishers in the world. We have released more than 60 titles, reaching billions of people around the globe. Today, we have offices in Brazil, Argentina, Ireland, and the United States. Here, we create games that will excite, intrigue, and engage our players for years to come!

Equal Opportunity

Wildlife is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state, and local law.

We're committed to providing accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process.

description:
Sobre a vaga
Overview:
We are seeking an experienced AWS DevOps Engineer to join our team. We specialize in providing custom software solutions to a diverse range of clients, from startups to Fortune 500 companies. Our focus is on using cutting-edge technology and agile methodologies to deliver the best possible results for our clients.

Job Overview:
The AWS DevOps Engineer will be responsible for managing and maintaining client cloud infrastructure on AWS. This includes designing and implementing scalable, secure, and highly available systems, as well as developing and automating deployment pipelines using modern DevOps tools and practices.

Technologies:
Terraform
Ansible
Docker
Docker-Compose
AWS
Linux
Bash
Ruby (application support)
Python (rarely)
Git
MySQL
ElasticSearch
Redis

Responsibilities:
Design, implement, and manage AWS infrastructure, including EC2 instances, VPCs, S3 buckets, RDS databases, and other AWS services.
Build and manage deployment pipelines using current technologies.
Develop and maintain infrastructure as code using tools such as Terraform and Ansible.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to infrastructure, deployments, and application performance.
Collaborate with development teams to optimize application performance, scalability, and security.
Implement and manage security controls, including IAM roles and policies, VPC security groups, and network ACLs.
Develop and maintain disaster recovery and business continuity plans.
Stay up-to-date with the latest AWS services, DevOps tools, and best practices.

Requirements:
12+ years of experience in AWS DevOps, with a strong background in Linux/Unix administration, networking, and security.
Expertise in AWS services such as EC2, S3, RDS, IAM, VPC, and CloudWatch.
Experience with infrastructure as code tools such as Terraform and Ansible.
Strong scripting skills using Python, Bash, or another language.
Experience with CI/CD tools.
Knowledge of containerization and orchestration tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, or ECS.
Experience with monitoring and logging tools.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
AWS certifications such as AWS Certified DevOps Engineer or AWS Certified Solutions Architect are preferred.

If you have a passion for DevOps and AWS and are looking for a challenging and rewarding career opportunity, we encourage you to apply for this position.
