description:
Sobre a vaga
Role Description

We‚Äôre hiring a passionate and talented CI/CX Marketing Lead to join the Marketing Team, to manage NPS campaigns from inception to deployment across LATAM. This role will work closely with our CRM, Community and Marketing Managers, to facilitate campaigns and act as the bridge between segment strategists and execution.

The successful candidate will be detail and excellence execution oriented, who works well with inter-departmental stakeholders and can take action on a variety of tasks from idea phase to implementation, adapting and iterating as needed along the way. The ideal candidate must thrive in fast-paced environments, be able to manage through ambiguity and complexity, and support multiple, simultaneous projects with a regional footprint. This role is critical in driving the success of all strategies across the region.

Responsibilities

Strategy & Delivery:

Satisfaction ecosystem of the NPS survey of the company, standardization of best research practices, with application of Relational and Transactional NPS
Development of reports to drive insights and opportunities from the voice of the customer
Work closely with management to provide customer insights that identify potential product enhancements, UX improvements as well as customer journey enhancements
Partner with the Member Loyalty and Community Managers on the conception, build, and delivery of LATAM campaigns
Recap LTV monthly and create actionable insights and recommendations for all relevant teams
Construction with the business teams of action plans with the greatest possibility of positively impacting NPS in addition to assessing impacts on churn and the correlation that exists with brand tracking, reputation and demonstrations on social media/Google Reviews
Be the subject matter expert on ‚Äúall things WeWork NPS‚Äù and serve as the point person for the broader regional Marketing team on NPS programs and performance
Regularly review email performance with the CMO, Head of Marketing and the local teams, identifying optimization opportunities
Multi-tasking skill set is key: need ability to prioritize multiple concurrent and time-sensitive requests
Continuously review and optimize marketing automation flows, and work with Marketing team to update assets to reflect the evolving brand voice
Make best practice recommendations to the CRM, creative, and brand teams to help optimize the efficacy of messaging touchpoints

Requirements:

3-4 years of CI/CX and NPS campaign experience
English, Spanish & Portuguese speaker.
Experience with marketing automation and CRM tools (Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Pardot, and Simon Data preferred)
Experience with Medallia system preferred
Experience with Whatsapp CRM management
Deep understanding of email KPIs, metrics, and reporting
Analytical approach; comfortable working with data and digging into numbers
Comfortability with HTML and AmpScript a plus, but not required
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with a strong attention to detail
Ability to excel in a fast paced environment
Self-starter and self-direction is a requirement

You Are:

Eager to create world class work that drives business results
Ready and willing to go an extra step for your work and your team
Passionate about collaborating with and delivering for partners
Focused on impact. You work in a way that lifts the team and the organization, not just yourself.
Motivated to work in a place where no two days are the same
You‚Äôre driven, optimistic and get things done. You bring a high level of self-directed energy, and an unrelenting drive to succeed and win.
Data-driven. You understand the importance of effectively measuring and reporting back on all activity
An experimenter. You see every task as an opportunity to test and learn.
Omni-everything: You can work with experts to weave a consistent message in all channels, from media to webinars and events;
A lifelong learner. You believe that brilliance is made, not born, through hard work and commitment, not innate talent. You are a voracious learner and you give and receive feedback openly.

This job posting is for a position with an entity owned and operated by an independent franchisee and not WeWork Inc. or its subsidiaries. This franchisee owns a license to use WeWork Inc.'s logos and office designs, for example, when running its co-working business. However, this franchisee is a separate company and a separate employer from WeWork Inc. and its subsidiaries. If you are hired for the job described in this posting, the franchisee will be your employer, not WeWork Inc. or its subsidiaries. WeWork Inc. and its subsidiaries have no control over employment matters and will not receive a copy of your employment application and will have no involvement in any employment decisions, including whether you receive an interview for the job or whether you are hired.

description:
Sobre a vaga
If you are passionate about the world of renewable energies, you are motivated to contribute to a more sustainable world and you want to be part of a diverse team and a vibrant culture, don't miss this opportunity to take a new step in your professional life!

What do we do?

Atlas Renewable Energy was founded by an experienced team, of pioneers in the development of renewable energies, with a recognized track record in the US, Latam, and Europe. Since its founding in 2017, Atlas Renewable Energy has established itself in the Americas as one of the fastest-growing large-scale clean energy generators in the region.
Our approach is focused on creating tailored solutions to provide clean energy to large consumers, guaranteeing the highest level of excellence during the development, construction, and management of projects and serving as agents of change in the communities where we operate, promoting a lifestyle sustainability, diversity, and inclusion and supporting their development. Our leadership in the industry is shown through the implementation of rigorous quality controls in the execution of our projects and total transparency, as well as by our innovative character

What are we looking for?
We are looking for a Performance Inverter Engineer, responsible for improving the production, performance, and availability of the inverters installed in the Atlas plants.
The Performance Inverter Engineer will develop/continue excellent relationships with Atlas‚Äôs internal and external stakeholders: O&M Contractors, inverters vendors, and transmission operators.

What Challenges you will face?
Perform root cause analysis (RCA) of inverters issues.
Analyze and troubleshoot issues with inverters.
Provide training and technical support to field technicians.
Real-time performance monitoring of operating plants.
Support technical discussion and RCA with inverters vendors.
Support the H&S team to build procedures and instructions for inverters maintenance.
Support inverter contracts terms and condition negotiation.
Support the procurements team for inventory control and optimization

What specific knowledge do you require?
Minimum 8- 10 years of related experience with knowledge in Solar and Wind inverters operation.
Bachelor of Science or Engineering degree
Portuguese and English
PowerPoint, Excel, Word MS Project
Basic knowledge of Python, Bid data, and AI.


What does Atlas offer you?

Belong to a multicultural, inclusive, and diverse environment. We have a presence in the USA, Mexico, Brazil, Chile, Uruguay, and Colombia, and now Spain.
Being part of a company that promotes flexibility: work by objectives, Hybrid/flexible work style (home-office or in the office) in coordination with your supervisors.
20 work days of vacation (which you can take in advance, without having completed the year) and additional days of rest for the end-of-the-year holidays.
other economic benefits, such as a performance bonus, and food vouchers.
We promote sports with our ‚ÄúIn Motion‚Äù benefit,
We promote Health and Life, with our health and life insurance with high-level coverage.

description:
Sobre a vaga
What You'll Do

As a part of BCG‚Äôs X Delivery team, you will work closely with consulting teams on a diverse range of advanced topics. You will have the opportunity to leverage software development methodologies to deliver value to BCG's Consulting & BCG X (case) teams, BCG X Product teams and Practice Areas (domain) through providing software developer subject matter expertise, and accelerated execution support.

You will collaborate with teams to gather requirements, specify, design, develop, deliver and support software solutions serving client needs. You will provide technical support through deep understanding of relevant tools and processes to build high quality and efficient technology solutions. Assignments will range from short term Proof of Concepts/Minimum Viable Products to long term cases with enterprise grade software development as a critical enabler through the project level description of the role responsibilities and impact within the organization.

YOU'RE GOOD AT

Technical Skills:

Must have strong experience:

Unix-based command line & development tools
Version control (e.g. Git)
Python
Charting libraries (HighCharts, D3.js, Recharts, Plotly, Altair)
Cloud computing platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, etc.)
Containerization (Docker, Kubernetes, etc.)
Relational databases (PostgreSQL, MariaDB, MySQL, etc.)
NoSQL databases (MongoDB, Neo4j, Redis, etc)
Spark or other distributed big data systems (Hadoop, Pig, Hive, etc.)
Stream-processing frameworks (e.g. Kafka)
Data pipeline orchestration tools (Airflow, Prefect, Dagster, etc.)

Nice to have:

C, C++, C#
Java, Scala
Julia, Go, Rust
JavaScript + HTML5 + CC3 (FRONTEND)
React or other modern JS framework (Angular 2+, Vue, etc.) (FRONTEND)
Flask, FastAPI, Django or NodeJS (BACKEND)
TypeScript
CI/CD tools (CircleCI, Octopus deploy, Jenkins, etc.)
Infrastructure as code (Terraform, Chef, Puppet, Ansible, etc.)
Deployment (Helm charts, Octopus Deploy, etc.)
Monitoring tools (Datadog, New Relic, App Dynamics, etc.)
Security tools (sonarqube, Veracode)
Unit testing frameworks (Pytest, Mocha, Jest, etc.)
Automated UI testing tools (Selenium, Cypress, Playwright, etc.)
Postman or other API testing tool

Job Requirement:

Bachelor's / Master's degree in computer science, engineering/technology or equivalent
Excellent oral and written communication skills in Portuguese and English

Work Experience:

Relevant domain of Data Engineering across industries and work experience providing analytics solutions in a commercial setting
Consulting experience will be considered a plus

You Bring (experience & Qualifications)

Functional Skills:

Selecting and integrating any Big Data tools and frameworks required to provide requested capabilities
Implementing ETL process(s) across on-premise and cloud architectures
Monitoring performance and advising any necessary infrastructure changes

Working with case (and proposal) teams:

Defining and explaining expected analytics outcome; defining approach selection
Delivering original analysis and insights to case teams, typically owning all or part of an analytics module and integrating with case teams
Establishing credibility by thought partnering with case teams on analytics topics; drawing conclusions on a range of external and internal issues related to their module
Communicating analytical insights through sophisticated synthesis and packaging of results (including PPT slides and charts) with consultants.
Collects, synthesizes, analyses case team learning & inputs into new best practices and methodologies.
Assuring proper sign‚Äêoff before uploading materials into internal repository for reference; sanitizing confidential client content in marketing documents
Able to build and sustain relationships with business stakeholders to generate project work by self-leveraging regular connects

Team requirements:

Guides juniors on analytical methodologies and platforms, and helps in quality checks
Contributes to team‚Äôs content & IP development
Imparts technical trainings to team members and consulting cohort

Communicating with confidence and ease:

You will be a clear and confident communicator, able to deliver messages in a concise manner with strong and effective written and verbal communication.

Thinking Analytically:

You should be strong in analytical solutioning with hands on experience in advanced analytics delivery, through the entire life cycle of analytics. Strong analytics skills with the ability to develop and codify knowledge and provide analytical advice where required.

Our data analytics and artifical intelligence professionals mix deep domain expertise with advanced analytical methods and techniques to develop innovative solutions that help our clients tackle their most pressing issues. We design algorithms and build complex models out of large amounts of data.

Additional Information

BCG X is the tech build & design unit of BCG. Turbocharging BCG‚Äôs deep industry and functional expertise, BCG X brings together advanced tech knowledge and ambitious entrepreneurship to help organizations enable innovation at scale. With nearly 3,000 technologists, scientists, programmers, engineers, and human-centered designers located across 80+ cities, BCG X builds and designs platforms and software to address the world‚Äôs most important challenges and opportunities. Teaming across our practices, and in close collaboration with our clients, our end-to-end global team unlocks new possibilities. Together we‚Äôre creating the bold and disruptive products, services, and businesses of tomorrow.

BCG GAMMA as part of BCG X is dedicated to building cutting-edge AI and digital systems that go beyond prototypes to transform our clients‚Äô core businesses. Powered by proprietary data assets, our custom products integrate into clients‚Äô unique tech stacks to enable better, faster decision making.

description:
Sobre a vaga
About Us

WEX is a global leader in financial technology solutions, based in Portland, Maine, United States, with

over 6,000 WEXers distributed in over 40 countries. We simplify the complexities of payment systems

across continents and industries like Fleet, Corporate Payments, and Benefits. We look to manage

employee benefits, streamline how companies pay and get paid by suppliers, save on fuel costs, or

modernize how companies manage their fleet, WEX solutions reduce the administrative burdens.

About The Opportunity

WEX is an innovative payments and technology company leading the way in a rapidly changing environment. Our goal is to simplify the business of running a business for our customers and free them to spend more time, with less worry, on the things they love. We are on a journey to build a unified, world class user experience across our products and services and leverage customer driven innovation to power our growth and strategic initiatives.

This is a really exciting time to be working in Data & Analytics at WEX. We are driving towards our True North vision of providing the right data, in the right place, at the right time so that we can enable and accelerate the journey to being a data-driven organization. There is strong executive support for all things data and it is viewed as a critical component for our enterprise transformation activities. What we need now is someone with a passion for solving problems and driving actionable outcomes with data. You will do this through performing and developing the following competencies: Insights Driven, Stakeholder Aligned, Results Focused, Dynamic Collaboration, Quality Mindset.

Centralized within the Digital organization, the Data & Analytics team is growing rapidly in order to support new initiatives that will enable business stakeholders to more effectively leverage data to support their daily activities. We are a lively, collaborative group of data enthusiasts who find great joy in delivering high value data solutions to our internal customers. We work on the top priority efforts across the organization and are key to enabling data-driven decision making.

You will be expected to

Identify and clean data to perform data analysis and exploration and create data visualizations to tell data stories
Analyze business problems using data from internal and external sources to provide insight to decision-makers
Work collaboratively with team members and stakeholders to highlight opportunities where data solutions could improve business processes
Identify and interpret trends and patterns in datasets to inform business decision-making
Ability/willingness to learn new technologies

We are looking for a professional who has

Insights Driven: Clear hypothesis and objective driven analytics that help drive our business decisions and ongoing metrics
Stakeholder Aligned: Understand the needs and audience for deliverables with a succinct and tailored message to maximize impact
Results Focused: Rigorous focus on how analytics drive the end to end experiences with clear path to production and measurable impact
Dynamic Collaboration: Drive continual improvement of our teams best practices and processes to power collaboration
Quality Mindset: Trust in our findings is critical so data and analytic quality is understood and accounted for from the beginning
Solid experience working in an analytics function, with a balanced mix of working with business stakeholders and getting in the weeds technically.
Good experience building data visualizations with one or more modern reporting tools (Tableau, Power BI, Looker, etc.)
Strong interpersonal communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills
Strong proficiency in SQL
Ability to tell stories with data & visualizations to both technical and non-technical audiences, targeting the operational level
Ability/willingness to learn new technologies

It would be great, if you had already had the opportunity to work with

An interest in building collaborative relationships with cross-functional stakeholders
Experience building automated and scalable solutions for self-service through Tableau or other tools to enable greater data self-sufficiency for a broad data consumer audience
A desire to become a business partner by understanding stakeholder needs and translating them into data deliverables

description:
Sobre a vaga
About The Internship

We're looking for a Data Analyst / Scientist intern to join our Safety Marketplace team to provide data expertise as we work to make this world a safer place to move around. In this role, you'll be part of and work closely with a cross-functional team consisting of engineers, product managers, safety ops, as well as other data scientists and applied scientists. This role will perform analyses related to our machine learning-based products.

What You‚Äôll Do

Develop dashboards, pull data for analyses, build readouts for scientific experiments, opportunity sizing analyses, rule creation, review work by team members, and present results to the team.

Basic Qualifications

Written and spoken proficiency in English and in Portuguese
Currently enrolled in Master‚Äôs or Ph.D. degree
Availability to work 3 months full time in 2023 starting in June (flexible start date)
Working rights in Brazil (no sponsorship available)
Skills in Analytics, SQL, Python, dashboarding, stats

Bonus Points If

See the forest **and** the trees: Strong data analytics, you know the details that matter
Trip obsessed: Taking time to build helpful relationships, you earn the trust of others within Uber through strong situational awareness and reliability
One Uber: You demonstrate optimism, respect others and work well in a team
Go get it: Understanding and being fully aware of how our business operates and how it makes money and sustains profitable growth, now and in the future
Great minds don‚Äôt think alike: diversity of thought in teams makes us stronger.
Bonus points for experimentation (e.g. A/B testing) and machine learning

Internships @ Uber

You have the rare chance to create a global impact - we're moving real people and assets and reinventing transportation and logistics. We offer expansive mentorship from Uber employees to guide you through your internship experience and for you to build personal networks and friendships with hardworking people who share your passion for technology.

Uber is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

Offices continue to be central to collaboration and Uber‚Äôs cultural identity. Unless formally approved to work fully remotely, Uber expects employees to spend at least half of their work time in their assigned office. For certain roles, such as those based at green-light hubs, employees are expected to be in-office for 100% of their time. Please speak with your recruiter to better understand in-office expectations for this role.

description:
Sobre a vaga
51,000 people. 49 countries. Over 120 office locations.

We‚Äôre not just engineers. We‚Äôre a global team of data scientists, consultants, construction workers and innovators all working to create a better tomorrow. Every day, we help customers in energy, chemicals and resources get one step closer to solving our planet‚Äôs toughest issues. Climate change. The energy transition. Digital transformation. And how we can deliver a more sustainable world.?

Whatever your ambition, there‚Äôs a path for you here. And there‚Äôs no barrier to your potential career success. For more information, visit Worley.com

Position Summary

This role reports into the Mining NeXT team and will support diverse projects being executed out of that group and across the Global NeXT Worley business. The candidate will be involved in all phases of project execution, collecting and analysing data to improve and/or develop systems and processes. Primary duties will include researching and mapping business processes, making reports with recommendations to project and product management and analysing the potential impact of potential scenarios. The individual will also advise and engage stakeholders, presenting research findings and supporting senior members and SMEs of the team.

Responsibilities

Engages with key stakeholders and users, collaborating cross-functionally to understand and document business processes. Collaborates with project team to define, develop, and ensure adherence to deliverables and deadlines
Has a high level of digital literacy to comprehend the digital systems and solutions supporting the Project and engineering process and can propose what solutions should be provided to improve the current state to a NorthStar vision
Conducts interviews to gather customer requirements via workshops, questionnaires, surveys, site visits, workflow storyboards, use cases, scenarios, and other methods.
Identifies and establishes scope and parameters of requirements analysis on a project-by-project basis to define project impact, outcome criteria, and metrics.
Translates conceptual customer requirements into functional requirements in a clear manner that is comprehensible to developers/project team.
Creates process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to developers and/or the project team.
Develops and conducts peer reviews of the business requirements to ensure that requirement specifications are correctly interpreted.
Assists with the interpretation of customer requirements into feasible options, and communicates these back to the business stakeholders.
Manages and tracks the status of requirements throughout the project lifecycle; enforces and redefines as necessary.
Communicates changes, enhancements, and modifications of business requirements ‚Äî verbally or through written documentation ‚Äî to project managers, sponsors, and other stakeholders so that issues and solutions are understood.
Responsible for full end to end process documentation
Able to demonstrate capability in conceiving & influencing ideas that focus on improving productivity & reducing costs.
Expert in managing change and influencing stakeholders for projects with high profile clients:
Expert in Management of Change and organizational change processes

Basic Qualifications

Job Specific Knowledge / Experience:

Minimum 5+ years of strong experience in managing complex IT and Engineering projects
Experience using the following: BABOK (CBAP) / PMBOK (PMP) / Agile PM / Agile BA
BA certification, ITIL, PRINCE II etc
Relevant degree qualified
A background in engineering and/or business-related fields

Skills

Analytical, data-driven, resourceful and autonomous
Ability to actively engage stakeholders, users and team to ensure processes are executed consistently
Ability to manage multiple priorities and thrive under tight deadlines and high-pressure situations
Ability to design and deliver transformational initiatives
Excellent attention to detail
Proficient at communicating conclusions to leadership in concise manner

People Skills

Interpersonal: Builds appropriate, constructive, and effective business relationships throughout the organization; uses diplomacy and tact; is approachable; communicates clearly, accurately, and consistently both verbally and in written matters. Employs the principles of active listening and encourages feedback from others.
Teamwork: Enjoys working in a small high calibre team with high visibility to senior stakeholders. Able to work and liaise with multiple teams and stakeholders, deal with strict deadlines, able to prioritise workloads and help other team members to achieve team goals.
Action Orientation: Achieves results set by self and others, meets timelines, pushes to achieve stretch goals, and demonstrates enthusiasm, persistence and tenacity. Breaks down work into executable tasks.
Intellectual Capacity - Deals with new concepts and complexity comfortably. Examines problems carefully and thoroughly and understands their interdependencies. Can pull information and ideas from many sources and see the importance of many factors.

Working Arrangements

Role coverage: Global
Role: Full time
Flexible working arrangement: Remote or Working from home allowed, onsite travels necessary when mandated by team lead or clients

51,000 people. 49 countries. Over 120 office locations.

We‚Äôre not just engineers. We‚Äôre a global team of data scientists, consultants, construction workers and innovators all working to create a better tomorrow. Every day, we help customers in energy, chemicals and resources get one step closer to solving our planet‚Äôs toughest issues. Climate change. The energy transition. Digital transformation. And how we can deliver a more sustainable world.?

Whatever your ambition, there‚Äôs a path for you here. And there‚Äôs no barrier to your potential career success. For more information, visit Worley.com

What We Offer You

Providing an agile culture and challenging work opportunities results in a positive work environment. Our people enjoy competitive compensation packages and a fun, personal, collaborative and safe working environment. We value equal employment opportunity and are committed to promoting fairness, equality and diversity.

Our policy is to conduct background checks for all candidates who accept an offer of employment with us.

If you have the passion and talent to keep up, it's time to test the limits of what you can become. Find your future with Worley.

description:
Sobre a vaga
Hogarth Worldwide is the world‚Äôs leading creative content production company. Born to make the best work brilliantly, we combine craft, insight and technology to bring creative work to life for many of the world‚Äôs most famous brands.

Diversity & Inclusion

Hogarth is an equal-opportunity employer. That means we believe in creating a truly inclusive culture that values diversity, equity and inclusion for everyone through our ideas, our people, how we behave and how we conduct ourselves. We strive to recruit people from diverse backgrounds and support them to achieve long-term success. This not only makes Hogarth a better company and place to work, but an environment where everyone can give their point of view, experience connection, enjoy opportunity and feel a sense of belonging.

We welcome applications from everyone, regardless of race, ethnicity, religion or belief, gender, gender identity, age, national origin, marital status, military veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, or physical or mental disability. As part of our commitment to making our hiring processes as equitable as possible, we are currently rolling out a policy which ensures that hiring managers review CVs only after they have been processed through an automated anonymisation system. This aims to ensure that all candidates are considered for interview based solely on their experience and what they can bring to the role. The solution, provided by MeVitae, scans and redacts CVs to reduce potential reviewer bias.

Please contact careers@hogarth.com if you need the job advert or form in another format.

What does a Project Manager do at Hogarth?

Lead projects from requirements definition through deployment, identifying schedules, scopes, budget estimations, and project implementation plans, including risk mitigation.

Key areas of responsibility:

Lead projects from requirements definition through deployment, identifying schedules, scopes, budget estimations, and project implementation plans, including risk mitigation.
Define tasks and required resources.
Create schedule and project timeline.
Track deliverables and alarm when timeline, quality or budget of the tasks is likely to be impacted, presenting mitigation plan if needed.
Lead quality assurance.
Monitor and report project progress and, when necessary, adapt scope, timelines, and costs to ensure that project team adheres to project requirements along with Production Lead approval.
Establish and maintain relationships with appropriate internal and external stakeholders, providing day-to-day contact on project status and changes.
Report project outcomes and/or risks to Production Lead.
Maintain JIRA up to date including tasks that need to be fulfil by other members of the team.
Be the guardian of the best practices of project management determined by Hogarth Project Management Direction.
Be the guardian of all documentation including reports and definitions.

Requirements

Advanced English Level.
Experience managing projects.
Experience working with Audiovisual Production and/or Digital.
Experience with Agile Methodologies, Project Scheduling, Budgeting.
Excellent verbal and written communication in both PORT and ENG.
Heavy user of JIRA.
Experience working with KPIs.

Data

We rely on legitimate interest as a legal basis for processing personal information under the GDPR for purposes of recruitment and applications for employment.

When you click the "Submit Application" button at the bottom of this page, this will send all the information you have added to Hogarth WW. Before you do this, we think it's a good idea to read through our Privacy statement. This explains what we do with your personal data when you apply for a role with us, and, how you can update the information you have provided us with or how to remove it.

description:
Sobre a vaga
About you

You are someone who wants to influence your own development. You‚Äôre looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests and be able to grow professionally.

You bring to Applaudo the following competencies:
Desirable bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or a related field.
5+ years of experience in designing and coding IVR systems and supporting integration and testing.
5+ years of experience writing code in common programming languages such as VXML, C/ C+, Java, .NET, J2EE, JSP and database technologies.
Strong software architecture skills and understanding of design patterns.
Ability to develop solutions for contact centers in complex environments.
Integration experience with Call Center environments and third-party platforms.
Excellent collaboration and communication skills.
Strong English communication skills are mandatory, as you will be working directly with US-based clients.

You will be accountable for the following responsibilities:
Take ownership of the execution of IVR projects, meeting specified timelines and requirements.
Provide ongoing support and maintenance for the IVR environment, resolving issues and ensuring system stability and performance.
Stay updated on relevant IVR technologies and trends. Mentor and guide team members to ensure they have the necessary skills to meet the organization's vision.
Collaborate with the architecture team to design and detail technical solutions for new product implementations and upgrades to existing IVR solutions.
Create and maintain technical specification documents, including architectural diagrams and call flows for the enterprise IVR systems.
Conduct QA activities such as peer reviews and supervising reviews to ensure compliance with HIPAA regulations, diversity principles, and corporate integrity and compliance program policies.

Qualifications

Designing and coding IVR systems and supporting integration and testing.
Common programming languages such as VXML, C/ C+, Java, .NET, J2EE, JSP and database technologies.

Additional Information
Here at Applaudo Studios values as trust, communication, respect, excellence and team work are our keys to success. We know we are working with the best and thus treat each other with respect and admiration without asking. Submit your application today, and don't miss this opportunity to join the Best Digital team in the Region!

We truly appreciate all the hard and outstanding work our team makes every day at Applaudo Studios, and that's why the perks that we offer, are deeply thought and designed as a way to thank them for their commitment and excellence.

Some of our perks and benefits:
Work from home
Flexible schedule
Celebrations
Special discounts
Entertainment area
Flexible workspaces
Great work environment
Private medical insurance

*Benefits may vary according to your location and/or availability. Request further information when applying.

description:
Sobre a vaga
Job Summary

Work/responsibilities regularly span multiple job families within this job group. Applies research and principles of engineering to the planning, design, development, documentation, and testing/debugging of a variety of instruments, equipment, systems and/or software. This job family is intended to accommodate 1) jobs whose accountabilities span two or more job families within the job group; 2) jobs that are not covered by a defined job family within the job group; 3) managerial roles spanning more than one family that are not broad enough in scope and impact to be assigned to the Business Unit/General Management job family within the Management job group.

Qualification:

BSc/MSc or equivalent in Process engineering, chemical engineering or equivalent.
Previous Experience: Proven ability of process engineering / project management of equipment used in Food & Beverage manufacturing in an EPC company
Proven track record of having lead and successfully executed various sophisticated projects within Food & Beverage industry or equivalent
Commercial acuity on project level, successful track record of claims management
Experience of working on projects in various cultures.
Experience of working with outside subcontractors including mechanical fabricators, electronic fabricators, Software designers and automation professionals.

Position Proficiencies:

Ability to review and comment customer URS, tender and contract documents and possible executions' strategy to meet customer requirements.
Use of MS Office tools, SAP PP & PS, CAD Viewers, Adobe Acrobat
Detailed understanding of projects and contracts management, change and claim handling
Knowledge and understanding of the current industry guidelines for designing, manufacturing, testing and detailing Food & Beverage process equipment
Project management experience for the execution of system projects in accordance to the defined specifications, time schedule and cost.
Direct experience of working in the Brewing and Beverage industry would be an advantage.

Other Requirements:

Ability and willingness to work in a multinational and interdisciplinary team with a high degree on global travelling.
Ability to communicate effectively on sophisticated technical / engineering issues at the highest level. Pall internal as well as with the customer.
Language skills English, Portuguese, preferably a third language as an addition.
Ability to guide other team members from the key experiences and detailed technical know-how.

Specific Duties & Responsibilities

Take ownership of large scale and sophisticated projects, take ownership from handover phase form quote to execution until final sign of the project which may include multiple different teams.
As project lead manage scope, timeline and contract to meet customer expectation against budget and quality
After Order placement execute the proposed engineered system solution based on agreed and defined contractual specification together with a defined project team as project manager and supporting process engineering.
Ability to share the working experience and expertise with other team members and act as technical specialist/mentor within the team to develop the organization by mentoring Project managers and process engineers on their daily work and on critical technical questions which require specific knowledge and experience in this field.
Support applications engineering in giving advice with tender & URS analysis, discuss, propose and define final engineered technical system solution and associated costing.

Essential Job Functions:

80 % Responsible to handle global assigned projects according to contract, project budget, the required timing and quality including accurate scope & claim management from first contact via order award to full completion of the project, including Responsible for the analysis of contract and tender documents and the technical elaboration of the engineered equipment solution.
Seek the responsibility and ownership for the proposed equipment solution during project execution with a multidisciplinary team (establishment of project plan, coordination of project team, progress reporting and cost control)
Respect current industrial standards applicable for the project and work in accordance to our established quality management system.
Execute and coordinate all qualification activities included in the project (pre-FAT, SAT)
Responsible for complete project sign off.
Responsible for internal and external project reporting
10 % Responsible for providing technical guidance in critical questions to the other team members while acting as a coach/trainer.
10 % Taking ownership for key technical expertise and knowledge and making sure the organization can benefit from the expertise thru trainings and advices.

Danaher Leadership Anchors and Behaviors ‚Äì Understands and complies

Charts the Course (Utilizes Critical Thinking, Moves Strategy to Action, Leads in a Global Environment)
Drives Innovation & Growth (Listens and responds to customer needs, Cultivates and enables breakthrough thinking to drive growth, encourages balanced risk taking to advance innovation)
Leads through DBS (Champions continuous improvement, solves problems, Drives for results)
Builds People, Teams & Organizations (Relentlessly attracts, engages and develops people, build strong, effective and diverse teams, Creates followership through collaboration)
Acts with Integrity (Consistently uses sound judgment, operates with transparency and is trusted, Demonstrates humility and self-awareness)

When you join us, you‚Äôll also be joining Danaher‚Äôs global organization, where 80,000 people wake up every day determined to help our customers win. As an associate, you‚Äôll try new things, work hard, and advance your skills with guidance from dedicated leaders, all with the support of powerful Danaher Business System tools and the stability of a tested organization.

At Danaher, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.

If you‚Äôve ever wondered what‚Äôs within you, there‚Äôs no better time to find out.

description:
Sobre a vaga
Overview

When you think of InComm Payments, think of Innovative Payments Technology. We were founded over 30 years ago and continue to be a pioneer in the payment (FinTech) industry. Since our inception, we have grown to be a team of over 3,000 employees in 34+ countries around the world. We own over 400 global technical patents and a network that includes over 525,000 points of retail distribution that points to our industry expertise.

InComm Payments works with the most recognized and valued brands in the world, and we are partnered with most of the world‚Äôs leading merchants. InComm Payments is highly focused on our people and their growth, and we work hard to make a career at InComm Payments meaningful and rewarding. We value innovation, quality, passion, integrity, and responsibility in all that we do, and we are looking for great people to join our team as we move forward towards a very bright future.

You can learn more about careers at InComm Payments here: www.incomm.com or connect with us on Twitter , Facebook , LinkedIn , or Our Blog .

About This Opportunity

We are looking for a dedicated individual to join our team as a PMO Analyst. The responsibilities include managing the day-to-day activities in the PMO, providing guidance on PMO policies and processes, overseeing project management staff, and collaborating with other department leaders to develop projects and programs.

Ideal Candidate: To be successful as a PMO Analyst, you should demonstrate strong leadership and communication skills. Ultimately, a top-notch PMO Analyst should be well organized and able to work under pressure.

Why InComm?
Work in a global organization with over 2,500 employees
Opportunity to work within an innovative sector and be involved with leading global brands in Brazil
An opportunity to be a part of a fun and exciting team that is passionate about the payments and prepaid industries

Responsibilities
Collaborate with other department leaders to define, prioritize, and develop projects.
Plan projects, including setting deadlines, prioritizing tasks, and assigning team members to various deliverables.
Analyze financial data, including project budgets, risks, and resource allocation.
Provide financial reports and budget outlines to Executives.
Oversee the development of projects to ensure tasks are efficiently carried out while upholding the company's standards.
Draft new and improve upon existing project management policies and processes.
Continuously evaluating projects to ensure they are meeting company standards, adhering to budgets, and meeting deadlines.
Accurately document project's creation, development, and execution as well as documenting the project's scope, budget, and justification.

Qualifications
A Bachelor's degree in Business, Administration, or a related field.
A Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification may be advantageous.
A minimum of three years' experience in the industry.
A minimum of one year's experience in a supervisory position may be advantageous.
Strong leadership skills.
Good written and verbal communication skills.
Strong attention to details and technicalities.
Excellent organizational and technical skills.
Good interpersonal and multi-tasking skills.
Excel advanced skills
Team player.
Fluent in English and Portuguese
This position is eligible for the Employee Referral Bonus Program - Tier II

position: Vendor Solutions Consultant, Compliance Program Management, Google Cloud
required_skills: ['Comunica√ß√£o', 'Consultoria de gerenciamento', 'Contabilidade gerencial', 'Documenta√ß√£o', 'Estrat√©gia corporativa', 'Gest√£o de fornecedores', 'Gest√£o de riscos de fornecedores', 'Resolu√ß√£o de problemas', 'Risk Operations', 'Simula√ß√£o de processos']
description:
Sobre a vaga
Please submit your resume in English - we can only consider applications submitted in this language.

For Mexico applicants: Only applications of candidates with Mexican citizenship will be evaluated for this role in compliance with the provisions of Article 7 of the Federal Labor Law.

Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Mexico City, CDMX, Mexico; Buenos Aires, Argentina; S√£o Paulo, State of S√£o Paulo, Brazil.Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in management consulting, corporate strategy, risk operations, or vendor risk management.
Experience in developing process maps, risk mitigation frameworks, business modeling, management reporting, and operational metrics.
Ability to speak and write in English fluently.

Preferred qualifications:

MBA or advanced degree in Compliance/Risk Management, Legal, Financial, or a related field.
2 years of experience in a risk management role at a large corporation or in a strategic advisory role.
Ability to engineer risk mitigation and operational processes, and enable change management.
Ability to understand data sources, maintain data accuracy, and hygiene.
Excellent business judgment and problem-solving skills, with the ability to formulate hypotheses, design tests, and use problem-solving techniques to evaluate solutions.

About The Job

The Google Cloud Vendor Management Organization (VMO) manages the extended workforce needs across Google Cloud, including extended workforce strategy, vendor partner selection, governance/operations, and delivery management.

As a Risk and Compliance Vendor Solutions Consultant, you will be a risk consultant to the organization, managing risk operations and programs for thousands of contractors across the Cloud organization and Google as a whole. You will work as an advisor and extended workforce specialist to our business stakeholders, partnering with international cross-functional business teams such as Cloud Support, Legal, Sales, and Engineering to ensure compliance adherence in extended workforce agreements and global vendor selection, operation, and management processes. By providing diligent review, guidance and subject matter expertise on risk mitigation best practices, you will help enable compliant performance and secure, agile scalability while protecting Google from operational, regulatory, and reputational risks.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations‚Äô ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google‚Äôs cutting-edge technology ‚Äì all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

Identify, document, and manage risks across extended workforce lifecycles, implementing risk mitigation strategies around co-employment, access, kob functions, roaming, business continuity, return-to-office, etc.
Develop communication plans to operationalize extended workforce policies globally, while measuring and monitoring effectiveness of risk and compliance projects.
Collaborate and manage relationships, and drive alignment with a broad range of Partner teams for risk and compliance projects.
Mange requirements from Vendor Management Office (VMO) key stakeholders, identifying and documenting current pain points/opportunities, and developing process maps for current and future state.
Interact with global vendors and collaborate with cross-functional business teams across Google Cloud Support, Sales, and Engineering.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

description:
Sobre a vaga
A U.S.-based company that is developing a shipping platform to assist e-commerce businesses in managing their shipping operations, is looking for a Business Intelligence Data Analyst. The selected candidate will be responsible for creating a compelling shipping experience for customers. The company's goal is to even out the playing field by giving businesses access to shipping tools and terms that they otherwise wouldn't have. The company has managed to secure more than $152mn during their Series E round of funding. This position requires 6+ hours of overlap with the PST time zone.

Job Responsibilities:

Build analytics systems to process and transform data
Connect to multiple shipping carriers around the world from one API and dashboard
Build a self-serve platform for internal stakeholders and external customers
Build analytics systems to process and transform data of massive scale into valuable operational and business insights for our internal and external customers
Build and maintain the business intelligence infrastructure and tools to present data with the most effective data visualization techniques and artifacts
Ensure that stakeholders are able to digest the insights from the analyzed datasets
Design, develop, scale, and evolve our self-service business intelligence solutions (e.g. Reports/Dashboards/Visualizations)
Utilize business intelligence technologies to convert business needs into effective visualizations, dashboards, and reports.
Improve the data models and data elements that business intelligence tools rely on by working together with data engineering and business teams
This will make data more accessible and encourage data-informed decision-making throughout the organization
Continuously identify opportunities and demands for better data management, quality, and delivery
Communicate and explain findings and suggestions at various levels with a definite bias toward effective learning and outcomes
Be a living example of the company's culture in your daily interactions and work
Promote the use of data to guide decisions

Job Requirements:

Bachelor‚Äôs/Master‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 3+ years of relevant experience as a software engineer
Strong background in Data and Business Analysis
2+ years of experience working with BI or data engineering
Extensive experiences working with one or more BI platforms, such as Tableau and Looker
Working knowledge of data modeling (for example, dimensional modeling) and data analysis in a data warehouse
Comprehensive knowledge of SQL and the capacity to create and analyze complex SQL queries
Excellent knowledge of database management systems and the ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) framework Quick to pick up new skills and applications
Effective communication, presentation, and problem-solving abilities
Understanding of business processes, best practices, data lifecycles, and standard operating procedures
Thorough knowledge of customer requirements and a drive for client success
Display your commitment to excellence in craftsmanship, ongoing improvement, and team success
Experience working with implementing the ETL process is nice to have
Experience with Python and Looker Platform is desirable
Solid experience with Cloud Data Warehouses like AWS Redshift is preferred
Some knowledge of Source Control(git) and CI/CD pipelines is desirable
Nice to have some experience with advanced data analysis using Machine Learning
Possess problem-solving aptitude
Good English communication skills

description:
Sobre a vaga
Experience Remote done Right. Over 20 years of remote experience, all 500+ staff are 100% remote and we still grow vibrant relationships, provide exceptional opportunities for career growth while working with stellar clients on ambitious projects

What we're working on
Enterprise companies turn to us to help them launch innovative digital products that interact with hundreds of millions of customers, transactions and data points. The problems we solve every day are real and require creativity, grit and determination. We are building a culture that challenges norms while fostering experimentation and personal growth. The result? We produce meaningful work and we are truly proud and excited to be creating waves in an industry under transformation.

Sobre a vaga
Project Description:
One of the world's largest providers of products and services to the energy industry has a need to develop and support cloud-based enterprise information system in Oil & Gas domain.
Our project is stable, long-term and constantly adopts new technologies.

DevOps practice is tasked with the development, provisioning, operations, and performance of a global, multi-region, multi-cloud software as a service, and developer integration platform.

Work supposes close cooperation with Customer team located in Houston and following Agile principles.
Our team is senior, supportive and friendly.

In this role candidates will operate independently and as part of a team to ensure that all software, hardware, and related components are protected from cyber attacks. Duties will include developing security systems, analysing current systems for vulnerabilities, and handling any and all cyber attacks in an efficient and effective manner. Candidates should have strong IT skills and a deep understanding of cyber attacks methodology, including but not limited to Fortify SCA scans, WebInspect scans, RAF developing, and overall security policies development and deployment.

Responsibilities:
As a WAF / Security Infra engineer, you will be responsible for managing the WAF infrastructure and performing infrastructure scanning based on CSP (cloud Security Posture) tool and some manual verification.
The goal is to create the report and reduce the risk in our Clous services.

WAF / Security Infra engineer should be well-rounded and be able to communicate clearly and concisely. They should be vocal in providing ideas, observations, and statuses that help the team.

Mandatory Skills Description:
Knowledge about AWS, Azure infrastructure
WAF knowledge and troubleshooting.

Nice-to-Have Skills:
Languages: Terraform, Ansible, JavaScript, and Python.
Cloud Providers: AWS, Azure

Languages:
English: B2 Upper Intermediate

Seniority:
Regular

description:
Sobre a vaga
642904BR

Introduction

In the Information Age, data is the most valuable resource. If you can describe yourself as the powerful combination of data hacker, analyst, communicator, and advisor, our Data Specialist position is the right one for you. As a savvy liaison for our teams, you will create solutions and provide actionable insights that shape the future of our business.

Your Role and Responsibilities

In this role, you'll work in our IBM Client Innovation Center (CIC), where we deliver deep technical and industry expertise to a wide range of public and private sector clients around the world. These centers offer our clients locally based skills and technical expertise to drive innovation and adoption of new technology.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

SQL
DBT
Git
Docker
Cloud Data Engineering, GCP strongly preferred

***Todas as vagas s√£o eleg√≠veis para pessoas com defici√™ncia ou reabilitadas.***

Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise

Fluent In English

About Business Unit

IBM Consulting is IBM‚Äôs consulting and global professional services business, with market leading capabilities in business and technology transformation. With deep expertise in many industries, we offer strategy, experience, technology, and operations services to many of the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Our people are focused on accelerating our clients‚Äô businesses through the power of collaboration. We believe in the power of technology responsibly used to help people, partners and the planet.

Your Life @ IBM

In a world where technology never stands still, we understand that, dedication to our clients success, innovation that matters, and trust and personal responsibility in all our relationships, lives in what we do as IBMers as we strive to be the catalyst that makes the world work better.

Being an IBMer means you‚Äôll be able to learn and develop yourself and your career, you‚Äôll be encouraged to be courageous and experiment everyday, all whilst having continuous trust and support in an environment where everyone can thrive whatever their personal or professional background.

Our IBMers are growth minded, always staying curious, open to feedback and learning new information and skills to constantly transform themselves and our company. They are trusted to provide on-going feedback to help other IBMers grow, as well as collaborate with colleagues keeping in mind a team focused approach to include different perspectives to drive exceptional outcomes for our customers. The courage our IBMers have to make critical decisions everyday is essential to IBM becoming the catalyst for progress, always embracing challenges with resources they have to hand, a can-do attitude and always striving for an outcome focused approach within everything that they do.

Are you ready to be an IBMer?

About IBM

IBM‚Äôs greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we‚Äôre also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business. At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it‚Äôs time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Location Statement

For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.

Being You @ IBM

IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

description:
Sobre a vaga
Job Description

PSA BDP, a member of the PSA Group, is a leading provider of globally integrated and port-centric supply chain, transportation, and logistics solutions. The company is headquartered in Philadelphia, PA, and employs more than 5,500 people worldwide.

We are a team that celebrates our unique diversity and close-knit community atmosphere. Our core values begin at the very top and span the broad reach of our global community.

We offer dynamic careers for those individuals looking to be a part of something bigger and provide unequivocal opportunities for growth within the organization.

PSA BDP serves over 5,000 customers, including some of the world's leading multinational companies within the chemical, retail & consumer, life sciences & pharmaceuticals, and electric vehicle & industrial verticals.

Job Overview:

We are seeking an experienced Active Directory Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing and maintaining our organization's Active Directory environment, including designing, implementing, and managing complex Active Directory infrastructure solutions. This individual will be responsible for ensuring the smooth functioning of various IT systems and applications, detecting and resolving issues, and making recommendations to improve overall IT performance.

Responsibilities:
Design, implement, and maintain the organization's Active Directory infrastructure, including domain controllers, group policies, and authentication mechanisms.
Develop, test, and deploy Active Directory policies and procedures to ensure compliance with industry best practices and regulations.
Monitor and analyze system performance and make recommendations to improve system capacity, reliability, and availability.
Configure and manage Active Directory-related tools and technologies, including Azure AD, AD Federation Services, and certificate authorities.
Work closely with other IT team members and stakeholders to ensure smooth functioning of the overall IT infrastructure.
Participate in the development and implementation of IT policies and procedures to ensure compliance with industry best practices and regulations.
Provide support to end-users and troubleshoot issues related to Active Directory systems and tools.
Develop and maintain documentation related to system configurations, procedures, and standards.
Continuously monitor and assess Active Directory infrastructure to identify areas for improvement and make recommendations for updates and upgrades.

Job Requirements

Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
At least 3-5 years of experience in managing and maintaining Active Directory infrastructure.
Expert-level knowledge of Active Directory infrastructure, including domain controllers, group policies, and authentication mechanisms.
Experience with Active Directory-related tools and technologies, including Azure AD, AD Federation Services, and certificate authorities.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Willingness to work outside of regular business hours and be available for on-call support.

description:
Sobre a vaga
Job Description:

Position Summary:

The Senior Analyst at Blue Umbrella is a senior team leader position, supporting business and team goals as an experienced research analyst that has consistently demonstrated work and operational excellence. It is the responsibility of a Senior Analyst to ensure that research work is conducted and completed at a high level of quality and in a timely manner.

Primary Responsibilities:
Conduct quality assurance checks to ensure that:
Proper qualitative background research tools and processes on the requested companies / individuals and their related associates are completed in accordance to relevant SOPs
Research information are collected and analyzed using a variety of media, namely, government databases, (listed) company public disclosures, Internet, and proprietary databases of major newspapers and journals
Collected information are accurately summarized into an English summary report applying in-house style and assist in its refinement
Detailed accurate reports are completed on time
Identify relevant risks, discrepancies and any information of the clients‚Äô interest
Perform due diligence reviews for various purposes such as AML / KYC compliance and third-party management
Understand and support team and/or business goals as outlined by a manager
Demonstrate a firm understanding of client concerns and requirements
Consistently provide feedback and play a key role in the development of team members
Lead the execution of ad hoc projects and assignments, often to tight deadlines
Keep abreast of industry-related news
Contributing to continuous improvement efforts, e.g., providing input/feedback and/or assisting in the execution of training reviews, process and efficiency improvements, product innovation, etc.
Understand and prioritize business concerns amid potential operational challenges
Comply with and enforce the implementation of processes, standards and values of the company as outlined in the policies and employee handbook

Qualifications:
Possess at least 5 years work experience in relevant fields, e.g. AML, KYC compliance, qualitative research and media, in which at least 1 year is at supervisory level
Solid understanding of due diligence, KYC / AML requirements, or third-party screening
Language proficiency in Portuguese, Spanish and English, and able to consolidate Portuguese, Spanish and English research information into English summary
Strong attention to detail with ability to produce accurate and quality work under tight deadlines and minimal supervision
Possess excellence in understanding source information and able to summarize them into a report in a logical and concise manner
Proven ability to manage multiple case assignments and projects simultaneously and effectively
Possess strong analytical skills with strong knowledge in conducting research in open sources and databases (i.e. Internet, government databases, and media databases)
Ability to identify deficiencies of current practices and workflow
Possess strong leadership skills and people management skills with proven ability to retain, motivate and develop a team
Possess effective communication skills to deliver client‚Äôs requirements and feedback
Well-organized as well as able to work accurately and efficiently under pressure
Possess good interpersonal communication skills
Bachelor‚Äôs degree holder
Legally authorized to work in Sao Paulo City, SP, Brazil.

Preferred Qualifications:
Ability to adapt to continuous changes and challenges
Possess and exhibit an interest in personal development by actively seeking new challenges and/or additional responsibilities
Possess and consistently leverage upon strong communication skills, both inter- and intra-team

Normal Working Hours and Conditions:

Core business hours are generally 9:00 am ‚Äì 6:00 pm. However, this position will require work to be performed outside of normal business hours based on Company operations across different time zones. Travel also may be required.

Employee must be able to:
Concentrate
View data and other information (visual acuity)
Communicate with others, verbally and in writing (talking and hearing)
Manipulate a keyboard (repetitive motions)
Sit and stand
Walk or otherwise move through the office and any client site

We are an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

AML Rightsource is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

description:
Sobre a vaga
642480BR

Introduction

In the Information Age, data is the most valuable resource. If you can describe yourself as the powerful combination of data hacker, analyst, communicator, and advisor, our Data Specialist position is the right one for you. As a savvy liaison for our teams, you will create solutions and provide actionable insights that shape the future of our business.

Your Role and Responsibilities

In this role, you'll work in our IBM Client Innovation Center (CIC), where we deliver deep technical and industry expertise to a wide range of public and private sector clients around the world. These centers offer our clients locally based skills and technical expertise to drive innovation and adoption of new technology.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

Data engineer to work on Data pipelines for ETL process development related to Data Privacy and Insights domain.

Skills

Experienced Cloud Data Engineer

Azure

Build and develop Azure Data Warehouse solutions
Azure Big Data
ETL in Cloud

SQL

Spark

Scripting: Python (experience preferred) , Scala (knowledge)

Soft Skill - Customer Communication. Teamwork

***Todas as vagas s√£o eleg√≠veis para pessoas com defici√™ncia ou reabilitadas.***

Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise

Java, Spring Boot or experience with Azure upgrades

About Business Unit

IBM Consulting is IBM‚Äôs consulting and global professional services business, with market leading capabilities in business and technology transformation. With deep expertise in many industries, we offer strategy, experience, technology, and operations services to many of the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Our people are focused on accelerating our clients‚Äô businesses through the power of collaboration. We believe in the power of technology responsibly used to help people, partners and the planet.

Your Life @ IBM

In a world where technology never stands still, we understand that, dedication to our clients success, innovation that matters, and trust and personal responsibility in all our relationships, lives in what we do as IBMers as we strive to be the catalyst that makes the world work better.

Being an IBMer means you‚Äôll be able to learn and develop yourself and your career, you‚Äôll be encouraged to be courageous and experiment everyday, all whilst having continuous trust and support in an environment where everyone can thrive whatever their personal or professional background.

Our IBMers are growth minded, always staying curious, open to feedback and learning new information and skills to constantly transform themselves and our company. They are trusted to provide on-going feedback to help other IBMers grow, as well as collaborate with colleagues keeping in mind a team focused approach to include different perspectives to drive exceptional outcomes for our customers. The courage our IBMers have to make critical decisions everyday is essential to IBM becoming the catalyst for progress, always embracing challenges with resources they have to hand, a can-do attitude and always striving for an outcome focused approach within everything that they do.

Are you ready to be an IBMer?

About IBM

IBM‚Äôs greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we‚Äôre also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business. At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it‚Äôs time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Location Statement

For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.

Being You @ IBM

IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

description:
Sobre a vaga
Hogarth Worldwide is the world‚Äôs leading creative content production company. Born to make the best work brilliantly, we combine craft, insight and technology to bring creative work to life for many of the world‚Äôs most famous brands.
Diversity & Inclusion
Hogarth is an equal-opportunity employer. That means we believe in creating a truly inclusive culture that values diversity, equity and inclusion for everyone through our ideas, our people, how we behave and how we conduct ourselves. We strive to recruit people from diverse backgrounds and support them to achieve long-term success. This not only makes Hogarth a better company and place to work, but an environment where everyone can give their point of view, experience connection, enjoy opportunity and feel a sense of belonging.
We welcome applications from everyone, regardless of race, ethnicity, religion or belief, gender, gender identity, age, national origin, marital status, military veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, or physical or mental disability. As part of our commitment to making our hiring processes as equitable as possible, we are currently rolling out a policy which ensures that hiring managers review CVs only after they have been processed through an automated anonymisation system. This aims to ensure that all candidates are considered for interview based solely on their experience and what they can bring to the role. The solution, provided by MeVitae, scans and redacts CVs to reduce potential reviewer bias.
Please contact careers@hogarth.com if you need the job advert or form in another format.
What does a Project Manager do at Hogarth?
Lead projects from requirements definition through deployment, identifying schedules, scopes, budget estimations, and project implementation plans, including risk mitigation.
Key areas of responsibility:
Lead projects from requirements definition through deployment, identifying schedules, scopes, budget estimations, and project implementation plans, including risk mitigation.
Define tasks and required resources.
Create schedule and project timeline.
Track deliverables and alarm when timeline, quality or budget of the tasks is likely to be impacted, presenting mitigation plan if needed.
Lead quality assurance.
Monitor and report project progress and, when necessary, adapt scope, timelines, and costs to ensure that project team adheres to project requirements along with Production Lead approval.
Establish and maintain relationships with appropriate internal and external stakeholders, providing day-to-day contact on project status and changes.
Report project outcomes and/or risks to Production Lead.
Maintain JIRA up to date including tasks that need to be fulfil by other members of the team.
Be the guardian of the best practices of project management determined by Hogarth Project Management Direction.
Be the guardian of all documentation including reports and definitions.
Requirements
Advanced English Level.
Experience managing projects.
Experience working with Audiovisual Production and/or Digital.
Experience with Agile Methodologies, Project Scheduling, Budgeting.
Excellent verbal and written communication in both PORT and ENG.
Heavy user of JIRA.
Experience working with KPIs.
Data
We rely on legitimate interest as a legal basis for processing personal information under the GDPR for purposes of recruitment and applications for employment.
When you click the "Submit Application" button at the bottom of this page, this will send all the information you have added to Hogarth WW. Before you do this, we think it's a good idea to read through our Privacy statement. This explains what we do with your personal data when you apply for a role with us, and, how you can update the information you have provided us with or how to remove it.

description:
Sobre a vaga
We are a digitally native technology services company where innovation, design and engineering meet scale. We use some of the latest technologies in the digital and cognitive field to empower organizations in every aspect.

Right now, we are looking for a Cloud Engineer to join our team at Globant!

You will get the chance to:
Work with professionals who have created some of the most revolutionary solutions in their fields.
Make an impact. Work in large-scale projects globally.
Develop your career in our Studios. Each Studio represents deep pockets of expertise on the latest technologies and trends and delivers tailored solutions focused on specific challenges.
Develop your career within an industry or multiple industries.
Work in the city you want, and be nourished by cultural exchanges.
Be empowered to choose your career path: we have more than 600 simultaneous projects, so you can choose where and how to work.
Be part of an agile pod. Driven by a culture of self-regulated teamwork, each team -or POD- works directly with our customers with a full maturity path that evolves as they increase speed, quality and autonomy.

What will help you succeed:
Believe and love what you do.
Have imagination and love innovating.
Being flexible & goal oriented.
Being capable of taking a step back to look at a bigger picture.
English communication skill is a must (B2 or upper).
Experience with a variety of Cloud Solutions such as IaaS, PaaS and SaaS.
Experience with migration from On-prem infrastructure to Cloud implementations.
Strong knowledge on Operating Systems (Linux and Windows) deploy, troubleshooting, administration and support.
Solid knowledge of Networking and base protocols for system administration.
Solid understanding of Security, Availability, Scalability and resilience in Cloud environments.
Experience on cloud technologies such as GCP, AWS, Azure.
Knowledge on Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
Good understanding on Microservices and containers.
Strong knowledge of Puppet or Chef experience (Configuration Management and/or Continuous Delivery) and integration with virtual environments (Vagrant, VirtualBox, AWS EC2).
Good understanding of monitoring resources and services on Cloud environments.
Configuration management and automation tools.

At Globant we believe that an inclusive culture and a diverse environment makes us stronger. We encourage people to have an inclusive spirit as our global footprint expands. We seek to generate a place of inspiration and growth for everyone. A safe space, based on equity as a value, where everyone's careers can be promoted and developed in the same way. There is no innovation without diversity and there is no improvement without plurality.

Are you ready?
