description:
Sobre a vaga
A fast-growing company that is developing deep-tech solutions to help farmers transition to sustainable agriculture through the use of AI and sensor technology, is looking for a Deep Learning Engineer. The engineer will be in charge of enhancing and improving the current models and algorithms. The company is developing tractor-mounted smart camera systems that let farmers track the health of their plants and monitor pest activity in real-time. The company has managed to securely raise more than $125K during their Pre-Seed round of funding.

Job Responsibilities:

Work together with cross-functional teams to specify the project's needs and outputs
Analyze and assess the effectiveness of deep learning algorithms and models
Design and create a whole deep learning pipeline (data gathering, pre-processing, training, validation, and deployment) for analysis of images and videos in real-time
Utilize and improve models on Edge devices with constrained computational power

Job Requirements:

Bachelor‚Äôs/Master‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or Electric Engineering (or equivalent experience)
At least 3+ years of relevant experience as a Deep Learning Engineer
3+ years of expertise in building multi-task perception models based on deep learning at the production level.
Skilled in cross-attention, GAN, and advanced deep learning architectures such as the Voxel/BEV grid-based feature
Basic knowledge of multiview geometry, traditional computer vision, and 3D computer vision
3+ years experience working on deploying models on Edge devices and limited computational resources (Nvidia Jetson or other similar)
Strong proficiency in C++ (for model deployment, re-simulation, pre/post-processing)
Demonstrable experience with Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, and other deep-learning frameworks
Nice to have some familiarity with Sensor Fusion, Localization, ROS, and 3D reconstruction or overall working in Robotics perception applications or Automated driving systems
Knowledge of software versioning, tracking, and documenting tools (Jira)
Prolific experience working with Computer Vision
Familiarity with DevOps and Docker is desirable
Nice to have experience working with Python and Machine Learning
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills

description:
Sobre a vaga
dunnhumby is the global leader in Customer Data Science, empowering businesses everywhere to compete and thrive in the modern data-driven economy. We always put the Customer First.

Our mission: to enable businesses to grow and reimagine themselves by becoming advocates and champions for their Customers. With deep heritage and expertise in retail ‚Äì one of the world‚Äôs most competitive markets, with a deluge of multi-dimensional data ‚Äì dunnhumby today enables businesses all over the world, across industries, to be Customer First.

dunnhumby employs nearly 2,500 experts in offices throughout Europe, Asia, Africa, and the Americas working for transformative, iconic brands such as Tesco, Coca-Cola, Meijer, Procter & Gamble and Metro.

We‚Äôre looking for an Applied Data Scientist Manager who expects more from their career. It‚Äôs a chance to apply your expertise to distil complex problems into compelling insights using the best of machine learning and human creativity to deliver effective and impactful solutions for clients. Joining our advanced data science team, you‚Äôll investigate, develop, implement and deploy a range of complex applications and components while working alongside super-smart colleagues challenging and rewriting the rules, not just following them.

What We Expect From You
Degree in a relevant subject
Programming skills (Hadoop, Spark, SQL, Python)
Prototyping
Statistical Modelling
Analytical Techniques and Technology
Quality Assurance and Testing
Experience leading teams
Experience handling clients
What You Can Expect From Us

We won‚Äôt just meet your expectations. We‚Äôll defy them. So you‚Äôll enjoy the comprehensive rewards package you‚Äôd expect from a leading technology company. But also, a degree of personal flexibility you might not expect. Plus, thoughtful perks, like flexible working hours and your birthday off.

You‚Äôll also benefit from an investment in cutting-edge technology that reflects our global ambition. But with a nimble, small-business feel that gives you the freedom to play, experiment and learn.

And we don‚Äôt just talk about diversity and inclusion. We live it every day ‚Äì with thriving networks including dh Gender Equality Network, dh Proud, dh Family, dh One and dh Thrive as the living proof. Everyone‚Äôs invited.

Our approach to Flexible Working

At dunnhumby, we value and respect difference and are committed to building an inclusive culture by creating an environment where you can balance a successful career with your commitments and interests outside of work.

We believe that you will do your best at work if you have a work / life balance. Some roles lend themselves to flexible options more than others, so if this is important to you please raise this with your recruiter, as we are open to discussing agile working opportunities during the hiring process.

For further information about how we collect and use your personal information please see our Privacy Notice which can be found (here)

Sobre a vaga
Job Description

If you‚Äôve ever used an ATM, paid a bill through your phone, sent money to a friend or shopped online, chances are your transaction was safeguarded and processed using our software. Now it‚Äôs your turn to serve the payment needs of organizations and people the world over.

As a Technical Consultant in S√£o Paulo (Brazil) / Bogot√° (Colombia) you will join a diverse, passionate team, dedicated to making possibilities happen in the payments industry!

Join the Team Making Possibilities Happen

If you‚Äôve ever used an ATM, paid a bill through your phone, sent money to a friend or shopped online, chances are your transaction was safeguarded and processed using our software. Now it‚Äôs your turn to serve the payment needs of organizations and people the world over.

Job Summary:

Ensures new and existing ACI customers receive a first class delivery service in accordance with customer expectations and contractual agreements. Primarily responsible for the identification/development of solutions for customers using company products, outsourced solutions and/or proprietary tools/techniques implemented by others. Defines customer needs and develops a plan and proposal for delivery of the project. Viewed by customers as a consultant. Performance is typically evaluated based on utilization, (i.e., billable hours).

Job Responsibilities:

Analyzes client‚Äôs business needs, integrates client‚Äôs business strategies and recommends appropriate information technology solutions utilizing ACI‚Äôs methodologies. Conducts analysis of corporate objectives, business functions and processes. Fully understands the customer‚Äôs functional and technical requirements and is involved in the specification of these.
Provides analysis, consultation and advice to project delivery associates on all technical aspects of the engagement. Recommends and implements process improvements.
Supports the regional/product‚Äôs business development and sales support efforts for a particular territory, industry or account.
Assists customer with implementation efforts as necessary to ensure successful product adoption.
Anticipates the implications and consequences of risks or business situations and take appropriate action to prepare for possible mitigation actions and or contingencies. Identifies information needed to clarify a risk or business situation, seeks that information from appropriate
sources and uses skillful questioning to draw out the information.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Understand and adhere to all corporate policies to include but not limited to the ACI Code of Business Conduct and Ethics.

Knowledge, Skills and Experience required for the job:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent experience.
2 years relevant experience.
Some Unix/Linux experience.
Some SQL experience.
Payments experience preferred.

Preferred Knowledge, Skills and Experience needed for the job:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Systems/Management, Business, or Finance.

Benefits: In return for your expertise, we offer growth, opportunity, and a competitive compensation and benefits package in a casual work environment.

Are you ready to help us transform the world of electronic payments? To learn more about ACI Worldwide, visit our web site at www.aciworldwide.com

ACI Worldwide is an AA/EEO employer in the United States, which includes providing equal opportunity for protected veterans and individuals with disabilities, and an EEO employer globally

description:
Sobre a vaga
At G-P, our mission is to break down barriers to global business, enabling opportunities for everyone, everywhere. With remote-first and diverse teams all around the world, our people are the key to achieving this mission. That‚Äôs why we trust our Dream Team members with the flexibility and autonomy to do their best and most innovative work, encourage and support their personal growth and career development, and believe in recognition for a job well done.

The work you‚Äôll be a part of here will have a positive impact on people and their work/life possibilities around the world. Our industry-leading SaaS-based Global Employment Platform‚Ñ¢ enables our customers to expand and grow into 180+ countries, creating more opportunities for global success ‚Äì without requiring entity or subsidiary setup.

Beyond the power of our platform, we never forget that behind every hire is a human being. And that brings us to you.

Beyond a competitive compensation and benefits package, what we offer to all employees is the clear and simple promise of Opportunity Made Possible. Come expand your skills in new ways and experience the thrill of impacting the way the world works, today and in the future.

About The Position

This role will be an integral part of the Ethics, Risk, & Compliance team and will work closely with our Legal, Finance, People, and Global Operations teams.‚ÄØ ‚ÄØThis role will support the Company‚Äôs efforts to adhere to legal standards and policies, understanding the employment law landscape, and staying ahead of changing regulations.

The role will be based in Brazil with an emphasis on researching North America and LATAM employment regulations and assisting with meeting the compliance requirements. The successful candidate will need to be comfortable with continuous change due to our constantly changing external and internal environment, working at the pace of the business, and delivering on multiple simultaneous priorities. The successful candidate will work with colleagues across different departments and time zones.

What You'll Do
Support the Risk & Compliance Manager ‚Äì LATAM with employment law research.
Develop a proactive approach to stay ahead of employment law trends.
Receive, research, and respond to requests from other members of the Legal team, such as Employment Counsel, Corporate Compliance, Fraud Prevention, and Health and Safety
Synthesize information and deliver concise and comprehensive reports on requested topics that can be shared with internal and external stakeholders and collaborators.
Update internal documentation and communicate to members of Legal regarding documentation revisions.
Regularly edit and revise documents, such as policies, communication alerts, and research reports for distribution
Administrative tasks, such as periodic regulatory filings or updates to our knowledge center
Ad hoc assignments, as needed.
What We're Looking For
Undergraduate or graduate degree in legal, library science, or liberal arts.
Paralegal experience is a plus.
3-5 years of experience in a research role preferred.
Proven ability to collaborate cross-functionally.
Detail oriented with strong analytical and organizational skills.
Intellectually curious with an ability to dig for answers.
Track record of successfully juggling multiple functions, projects, and priorities
Able to navigate ambiguity and shift direction when priorities change.
Comfortable in a global, fast paced, high growth, rapidly evolving workplace.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
About Us

G-P helps growing companies unlock their full potential by making it possible to build highly skilled global teams in days instead of months. Through our SaaS-based platform, we help find, hire, onboard, pay, and manage team members, quickly and compliantly, to expand growth opportunities for everyone, everywhere ‚Äì without the hassle of setting up local subsidiaries or branch offices.

G-P. Global Made Possible.

G-P is a proud Equal Opportunity Employer, and we are committed to building and maintaining a diverse, equitable and inclusive culture that celebrates authenticity. We prohibit discrimination and harassment against employees or applicants on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, and pregnancy-related conditions), gender identity or expression (including transgender status), sexual orientation, marital status, military service and veteran status, physical or mental disability, genetic information, or any other legally protected status.

G-P also is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need an accommodation due to a disability during the interview process, please contact us at careers@g-p.com.

description:
Sobre a vaga
What you'll do

As a Senior Data Scientist, you will be responsible for conducting in-depth data analysis, developing advanced statistical and machine learning models, and providing strategic guidance based on data-driven insights. Your role will involve collaborating with cross-functional teams and leading scientific research to develop cutting-edge data science solutions. The ideal candidate will have a strong scientific background, exceptional analytical skills, and a deep understanding of statistical modeling and machine learning algorithms.

Responsibilities
Develop advanced statistical and machine learning models, and lead scientific research for cutting-edge data science solutions.
Utilize vibration data to detect and predict failures in machinery and equipment.
Develop and implement predictive models for failure probabilities and remaining useful life.
Perform data analysis, preprocessing, and feature extraction on vibration data.
Design and validate machine learning models for failure classification and prediction.
Create informative reports and visualizations to communicate findings and insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams and provide mentorship to junior data scientists.
Ensure data governance compliance and stay updated on advancements in failure detection techniques.

Requirements
5+ years in Data Science related fields
Advanced degree (Master's or Ph.D.) in a quantitative field such as computer science, mechanical engineering, or a related scientific discipline.
Proven experience as a Data Scientist with a focus on failure detection and vibration analysis.
Strong expertise in signal processing techniques and vibration analysis methodologies.
Proficiency in statistical analysis, machine learning algorithms, and predictive modeling.
Strong programming skills in languages such as Python, R, or MATLAB.
Experience with feature extraction and preprocessing of vibration data.
Familiarity with relevant tools and libraries for data analysis and machine learning.

Bonus Points
Fluent English proficiency

Compensation
Competitive salary and stock options
R$800/mo to use in a wide range of places that accept the Visa flag
GymPass so you don't sit/work all day
100% funded English / Spanish course
30 days of paid annual leave
Education and courses stipend
Every 4 years, earn a trip anywhere in the world
Day off in the week of your birthday
From R$2400/year remote work allowance
Mental health support: we cover 40% of the cost of your therapy
Health plan with national coverage and without coparticipation.
Dental Insurance: we help you with dental treatment for a better quality of life.
Sports Incentive: R$300/mo extra if you practice activities

position: Data Center Eng Ops Tech I, DCEO Technician
required_skills: ['An√°lise de causa raiz (RCA)', 'Descomissionamento', 'Event Ticketing', 'Indicadores-chave de desempenho', 'Infraestrutura de data center', 'Passagens a√©reas', 'Root Cause', 'Sistemas de abertura de chamados', 'Solu√ß√£o de problemas t√©cnicos', 'Walkthroughs']
description:
Sobre a vaga
Description

How would you like to be a part of Earth‚Äôs most customer-centric company? You would work with teams of front-line responders who support the operations of some of the world‚Äôs most powerful data centers. Our Data Center Engineering Operations team maintain and operate our critical infrastructure systems so that they are prepared to stand up against any situation.

AWS has the world‚Äôs largest cloud computing portfolio. As an Amazonian you will work in some of the most sophisticated, safe, and secure data centers in the world. Our Engineering Operations Technicians I (EOT‚Äôs) help keep them that way by working with the brightest minds from around the globe to help test and implement the newest technology and work practices to meet the demands of a changing market.

We have a passion for learning and evolving, it‚Äôs how we have helped define ourselves as leaders in the industry. Let‚Äôs work hard, have fun, and make history!

Key job responsibilities
Maintain the critical data center infrastructure ensuring 99.999% uptime of the world's largest cloud computing portfolio.
Ensure that security procedures are followed.
Monitor the performance of operations and maintenance of electrical, mechanical and fire/safety equipment within the data center.
Provide key performance indicators to senior engineers.
Assist in facility troubleshooting and rack level events respecting Internal Service Level Agreements (SLA).
Work on projects of moderate complexity.
Perform rack installation, rack decommissioning, walkthroughs and other critical facility infrastructure related activities.
Accompany vendors on site, ensuring that all work performed is in accordance with established practices, procedures and local legislation.
Work on basic support such as ticketing systems, root cause analysis, change management processes, and creating/revising operational procedures.
A day in the life
Work on foot on uneven terrain. Maintain balance and perform tasks using a ladder.
Regularly lift and/or move up to 18Kg alone or in a group for 18Kg+.
Regularly walk, use hands and fingers, reach with hands and arms, stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl, climb up and down stairs, bend, work above the shoulders, grasp, carry, push and pull.

Basic Qualifications
Electrical/Mechanical Technical High school or Bachelor in Electrical/Mechanical Engineering or related area.
Advanced English: read/write/speak.
Preferred Qualifications
Relevant experience in data centers or mission critical facilities (e.g. hospital, military facility, public safety facility, etc.).
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

description:
Sobre a vaga
About Us

WEX is a global leader in financial technology solutions, based in Portland, Maine, United States, with

over 6,000 WEXers distributed in over 40 countries. We simplify the complexities of payment systems

across continents and industries like Fleet, Corporate Payments, and Benefits. We look to manage

employee benefits, streamline how companies pay and get paid by suppliers, save on fuel costs, or

modernize how companies manage their fleet, WEX solutions reduce the administrative burdens.

About The Opportunity

Our team consists of small, agile development teams focused on building state of the art solutions from the ground up using the best technology available. We focus on cloud-based microservice solutions to help achieve fast, scalable results that allow our business partners the flexibility they need to compete in our competitive market.

Our team of professionals works hard, covers for one another, and maintains a work-life balance. We own our results and we take pride in ownership in everything we do.

Changing the world isn‚Äôt easy, and we have a lot of work ahead of us. From new product features to automation, to supporting microservices, we‚Äôve got more work than we can handle and we‚Äôre looking for great people to come along for the ride.

You will be expected to

Design and Implement data driven strategies that transform processes to enable efficiency and scale
Architect new process flows to implement Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
Translate data transformation strategies into implementation plans, then execute on those plans to deliver requirements
Respond to changing business requirements by adapting data stores to address current business conditions
Work collaboratively with the Data Engineering team to create data streams from WEX source systems into the Data Platform
Collaborate on, and implement solutions that enable Analysts to leverage Data Science tools and applications to drive improvements

We are looking for a professional who has

Have a BS or MS in a relevant field OR can make us feel intensely confident that you don‚Äôt need one
Have solid experience with Data Analytics & Engineering experience, including Data Management, Architecture
A demonstrable working understanding of at least one modern programming framework (i.e. Python, Pyspark, Spark) and at least one modern API framework (i.e. REST)

It would be great, if you had already had the opportunity to work with

Can show us one or more passion projects or open-source work you have contributed to in your own time
Have demonstrable experience with systems engineering and automation
Have experience with DevOps practices and procedures
Have working knowledge of AWS, Snowflake, dbt
Have familiarity with SAS, Talend or similar data tools
Enjoy hanging out with your team
Learn how to use and leverage WEX‚Äôs Data Platform using documented standards & best practices

description:
Sobre a vaga
Business Systems Analyst

As the world works and lives faster, FIS is leading the way. Our fintech solutions touch nearly every market, company and person on the planet. Our teams are inclusive and diverse. Our colleagues work together and celebrate together. If you want to advance the world of fintech, we‚Äôd like to ask you~ Are you FIS?

About The Role

As a Business Systems Analyst, you‚Äôll act as the voice of the customer to ensure that our teams continue to deliver more best-in-breed products that advance the way we pay, bank and invest. You‚Äôll work‚ÄØas‚ÄØpart‚ÄØof‚ÄØa‚ÄØteam‚ÄØ‚ÄØand must be a‚ÄØself- motivated,‚ÄØproactive,‚ÄØand‚ÄØout-of-the-box‚ÄØthinker.



About The Team

What you will be doing~
Working within a team to define business requirements and/or enhancements to existing products and services or investigating new offerings as required
Working with a project team to determine how to best verify and validate new product features and/or services prior to introduction to existing or new clients
Conducting tests to ensure changes made by programmers are correct or new installations/services meet the end user requirements

What You Will Need
Knowledge of financial services industry and an understanding of end-to-end systems development life cycles
A bachelor‚Äôs in a business related field, information systems or equivalent experience

Added Bonus If You Have

Payments industry experience

Prior analysis or testing experience in the cards (credit, debit or prepaid) industry.

Any BASE2000, BASE Global and/or Payments One Experience

What We Offer You

A career at FIS is more than just a job. It‚Äôs the change to shape the future of fintech. At FIS, we offer you~
A voice in the future of fintech
Always-on learning and development
Collaborative work environment
Opportunities to give back
Competitive salary and benefits

Privacy Statement

FIS is committed to protecting the privacy and security of all personal information that we process in order to provide services to our clients. For specific information on how FIS protects personal information online, please see the Online Privacy Notice .

Sourcing Model

Recruitment at FIS works primarily on a direct sourcing model; a relatively small portion of our hiring is through recruitment agencies. FIS does not accept resumes from recruitment agencies which are not on the preferred supplier list and is not responsible for any related fees for resumes submitted to job postings, our employees, or any other part of our company.

description:
Sobre a vaga
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Get to know our team:

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda has deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and has built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

Due to continued expansion, there are multiple analyst roles within the marketing team across different marketing channels. While the scope will vary depending on these channels, here are some examples:

Experimentation and optimizing campaign performance: Experiment with ads/campaign structures and bidding& pricing strategies on partners such as Google, Bing, TripAdvisor, Trivago, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests.
Modeling: Analyze vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop predictive models using data science techniques (e.g. understanding the impact on bookings from large-scale TV campaigns or demand elasticity from pricing optimization), and liaise with product teams on an implementation roadmap
Reporting, analysis, and insights: Building dashboards to track performance, derive insights, understand growth levers, and communicate recommendations via presentations to stakeholders

What you‚Äôll Need to Succeed:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering business, science, or relevant field of study
0 to 4 years experience in data crunching from top-tier consulting, investment banking, private equity or strategy/business role for a fast-growing global tech company
Experience in one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g., SQL, SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA and visualization tools, e.g. Tableau, Power BI, etc.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
Ability to move fast and be efficient, making decisions on objective data evidence
Innate desire to take ownership, make an impact and influence outcomes
Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail and ability to work independently

It‚Äôs great if you have:

Experience in digital marketing or e-commerce
Experience with A/B testing and other testing metrics
Strong presentation and negotiation skills

description:
Sobre a vaga
Why join us

TRACTIAN is reimagining industrial systems so that every frontline maintenance worker can realize their full potential. We're building software and hardware in one place‚Äîdisrupting long-standing institutions with products and experiences that better serve the ambitions of our clients.

Working at TRACTIAN allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. Our team members have the autonomy needed to accomplish challenging goals. We are a growth-stage startup and you will work directly with the founders, helping to define the vision, product and user experience.

Product at TRACTIAN

The product organization develops infrastructure, databases, apps and services using IoT data. Our Developers and Engineers work together to make services and databases work as a core asset across the company. Our work is ingrained in Tractian‚Äôs decision-making process, in the efficiency of our operations and services, and in the industry-leading experience we provide our consumers.

What You'll Do

As a Senior Data Engineer, you will be responsible for making machines more reliable by combining three key shifts in the industry: Analytics, Internet of Things and User Experience. The intersection of these trends allows Tractian to provide machines with a mechanical nervous system and the awareness to optimize their own health, thereby accelerating human productivity and safety.

Responsibilities

Be responsible for incremental improvements of our frontend and backend microservices that interact with our databases and customers

Create and improve new data ingestion, wrangling, storage tool, and services

Improve Python, JS/TS codes present in the main application today

Be part of a fast-growing data engineering team;

Architect, develop and operate our data architecture and frameworks

Deliver scalable, testable, maintainable, and high-quality code

Help drive optimization, testing, and tooling to improve services quality

Work extensively with AWS and technology

Facilitate and drive collaboration with developers and stakeholders to seek exciting and results-oriented user-centric data problems

Requirements

Proficiency in at least one major programming language (e.g. Javascript) and ability to pick up new tech skills independently

Proven knowledge of Kafka, Apache Parquet, MongoDB, Postgres

2+ years of experience in complex SQL and CQL

Conceptually familiar with AWS cloud resources (S3, VPC, EC2, RDS,...)

Bonus Points

Experience using build, deployment and orchestration tools such as Docker, Kubernetes and Terraform

Compensation

Competitive salary and stock options

R$800/mo for you to use with food in supermarkets, restaurants and delivery

GymPass so you don't sit/work all day

Optional fully funded English / Spanish courses

30 days of paid annual leave

Education and courses stipend

Earn a trip anywhere in the world every 4 years

Day off during the week of your birthday

R$200 a month for remote work allowance

Mental health support: we cover 40% of the cost of your therapy

Health plan with national coverage and without coparticipation

Dental Insurance: we help you with dental treatment for a better quality of life.

Sports Incentive: R$300/mo extra if you practice activities

Up to R$5.000 bonus for referring new Blue Caps

Sobre a vaga
dunnhumby is the global leader in Customer Data Science, empowering businesses everywhere to compete and thrive in the modern data-driven economy. We always put the Customer First.

Our mission: to enable businesses to grow and reimagine themselves by becoming advocates and champions for their Customers. With deep heritage and expertise in retail ‚Äì one of the world‚Äôs most competitive markets, with a deluge of multi-dimensional data ‚Äì dunnhumby today enables businesses all over the world, across industries, to be Customer First.

dunnhumby employs nearly 2,500 experts in offices throughout Europe, Asia, Africa, and the Americas working for transformative, iconic brands such as Tesco, Coca-Cola, Meijer, Procter & Gamble and Metro.

We‚Äôre looking for an Applied Data Scientist Manager who expects more from their career. It‚Äôs a chance to apply your expertise to distil complex problems into compelling insights using the best of machine learning and human creativity to deliver effective and impactful solutions for clients. Joining our advanced data science team, you‚Äôll investigate, develop, implement and deploy a range of complex applications and components while working alongside super-smart colleagues challenging and rewriting the rules, not just following them.

What We Expect From You
Degree in a relevant subject
Programming skills (Hadoop, Spark, SQL, Python)
Prototyping
Statistical Modelling
Analytical Techniques and Technology
Quality Assurance and Testing
Experience leading teams
Experience handling clients
What You Can Expect From Us

We won‚Äôt just meet your expectations. We‚Äôll defy them. So you‚Äôll enjoy the comprehensive rewards package you‚Äôd expect from a leading technology company. But also, a degree of personal flexibility you might not expect. Plus, thoughtful perks, like flexible working hours and your birthday off.

You‚Äôll also benefit from an investment in cutting-edge technology that reflects our global ambition. But with a nimble, small-business feel that gives you the freedom to play, experiment and learn.

And we don‚Äôt just talk about diversity and inclusion. We live it every day ‚Äì with thriving networks including dh Gender Equality Network, dh Proud, dh Family, dh One and dh Thrive as the living proof. Everyone‚Äôs invited.

Our approach to Flexible Working

At dunnhumby, we value and respect difference and are committed to building an inclusive culture by creating an environment where you can balance a successful career with your commitments and interests outside of work.

We believe that you will do your best at work if you have a work / life balance. Some roles lend themselves to flexible options more than others, so if this is important to you please raise this with your recruiter, as we are open to discussing agile working opportunities during the hiring process.

For further information about how we collect and use your personal information please see our Privacy Notice which can be found (here)

description:
Sobre a vaga
A fast-growing company that is developing deep-tech solutions to help farmers transition to sustainable agriculture through the use of AI and sensor technology, is looking for a Deep Learning Engineer. The engineer will be in charge of enhancing and improving the current models and algorithms. The company is developing tractor-mounted smart camera systems that let farmers track the health of their plants and monitor pest activity in real-time. The company has managed to securely raise more than $125K during their Pre-Seed round of funding.

Job Responsibilities:

Work together with cross-functional teams to specify the project's needs and outputs
Analyze and assess the effectiveness of deep learning algorithms and models
Design and create a whole deep learning pipeline (data gathering, pre-processing, training, validation, and deployment) for analysis of images and videos in real-time
Utilize and improve models on Edge devices with constrained computational power

Job Requirements:

Bachelor‚Äôs/Master‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or Electric Engineering (or equivalent experience)
At least 3+ years of relevant experience as a Deep Learning Engineer
3+ years of expertise in building multi-task perception models based on deep learning at the production level.
Skilled in cross-attention, GAN, and advanced deep learning architectures such as the Voxel/BEV grid-based feature
Basic knowledge of multiview geometry, traditional computer vision, and 3D computer vision
3+ years experience working on deploying models on Edge devices and limited computational resources (Nvidia Jetson or other similar)
Strong proficiency in C++ (for model deployment, re-simulation, pre/post-processing)
Demonstrable experience with Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, and other deep-learning frameworks
Nice to have some familiarity with Sensor Fusion, Localization, ROS, and 3D reconstruction or overall working in Robotics perception applications or Automated driving systems
Knowledge of software versioning, tracking, and documenting tools (Jira)
Prolific experience working with Computer Vision
Familiarity with DevOps and Docker is desirable
Nice to have experience working with Python and Machine Learning
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills

description:
Sobre a vaga
At G-P, our mission is to break down barriers to global business, enabling opportunities for everyone, everywhere. With remote-first and diverse teams all around the world, our people are the key to achieving this mission. That‚Äôs why we trust our Dream Team members with the flexibility and autonomy to do their best and most innovative work, encourage and support their personal growth and career development, and believe in recognition for a job well done.

The work you‚Äôll be a part of here will have a positive impact on people and their work/life possibilities around the world. Our industry-leading SaaS-based Global Employment Platform‚Ñ¢ enables our customers to expand and grow into 180+ countries, creating more opportunities for global success ‚Äì without requiring entity or subsidiary setup.

Beyond the power of our platform, we never forget that behind every hire is a human being. And that brings us to you.

Beyond a competitive compensation and benefits package, what we offer to all employees is the clear and simple promise of Opportunity Made Possible. Come expand your skills in new ways and experience the thrill of impacting the way the world works, today and in the future.

About The Position

This role will be an integral part of the Ethics, Risk, & Compliance team and will work closely with our Legal, Finance, People, and Global Operations teams.‚ÄØ ‚ÄØThis role will support the Company‚Äôs efforts to adhere to legal standards and policies, understanding the employment law landscape, and staying ahead of changing regulations.

The role will be based in Brazil with an emphasis on researching North America and LATAM employment regulations and assisting with meeting the compliance requirements. The successful candidate will need to be comfortable with continuous change due to our constantly changing external and internal environment, working at the pace of the business, and delivering on multiple simultaneous priorities. The successful candidate will work with colleagues across different departments and time zones.

What You'll Do
Support the Risk & Compliance Manager ‚Äì LATAM with employment law research.
Develop a proactive approach to stay ahead of employment law trends.
Receive, research, and respond to requests from other members of the Legal team, such as Employment Counsel, Corporate Compliance, Fraud Prevention, and Health and Safety
Synthesize information and deliver concise and comprehensive reports on requested topics that can be shared with internal and external stakeholders and collaborators.
Update internal documentation and communicate to members of Legal regarding documentation revisions.
Regularly edit and revise documents, such as policies, communication alerts, and research reports for distribution
Administrative tasks, such as periodic regulatory filings or updates to our knowledge center
Ad hoc assignments, as needed.
What We're Looking For
Undergraduate or graduate degree in legal, library science, or liberal arts.
Paralegal experience is a plus.
3-5 years of experience in a research role preferred.
Proven ability to collaborate cross-functionally.
Detail oriented with strong analytical and organizational skills.
Intellectually curious with an ability to dig for answers.
Track record of successfully juggling multiple functions, projects, and priorities
Able to navigate ambiguity and shift direction when priorities change.
Comfortable in a global, fast paced, high growth, rapidly evolving workplace.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
About Us

G-P helps growing companies unlock their full potential by making it possible to build highly skilled global teams in days instead of months. Through our SaaS-based platform, we help find, hire, onboard, pay, and manage team members, quickly and compliantly, to expand growth opportunities for everyone, everywhere ‚Äì without the hassle of setting up local subsidiaries or branch offices.

G-P. Global Made Possible.

G-P is a proud Equal Opportunity Employer, and we are committed to building and maintaining a diverse, equitable and inclusive culture that celebrates authenticity. We prohibit discrimination and harassment against employees or applicants on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, and pregnancy-related conditions), gender identity or expression (including transgender status), sexual orientation, marital status, military service and veteran status, physical or mental disability, genetic information, or any other legally protected status.

G-P also is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need an accommodation due to a disability during the interview process, please contact us at careers@g-p.com.

position: Solutions Engineer, Concepting Applications and Estimating Services (CANES)
required_skills: ['Ci√™ncia de dados', 'Design de processos', 'Engenharia de processos', 'Engenharia industrial', 'Equipamento de manuseio de materiais', 'MHE', 'Reconhecimento de padr√µes', 'Reliability Analysis', 'Simio', 'Storage Systems']
description:
Sobre a vaga
Description

Amazon created one of the most sophisticated supply chains in the world. From the introduction of Amazon Prime, to the use of advanced technology for package delivery, Amazon consistently drives change from the front of the pack.

Amazon is seeking an experienced and detail oriented Solutions Design Engineer. This individual will deep-dive and challenge current processes, equipment, and procedures, in our North American and Emerging Market (ECCF) fulfillment network, in order to come up with creative and implementable process improvement initiatives. This individual will also concept and design development of new and existing fulfillment center layouts.

A successful candidate will have an established background in developing high-performance physical systems, a strong technical problem solving ability, excellent project management skills, and an internal motivation to achieve results in a fast-paced and often ambiguous environment. Amazon‚Äôs culture encourages innovation and expects engineers and managers alike to take a high level of ownership in solving complex problems. The successful Sr. Solutions Engineer is an agile natural self-starter with the ability to keep relentlessly driving projects and various functional teams and individuals at all levels of the organization.

Key job responsibilities
Own the design and development of engineering solutions for complex material handling challenges considering human/equipment interactions for the North America and ECCF fulfillment network
Lead and coordinate concept and design development efforts for optimal solutions for the North America and ECCF fulfillment network through equipment specification, material flow, process design, ergonomics, associate experience, operational considerations and site layout
Work closely with vendors, suppliers and other teams to create innovative solutions
Simultaneously manage multiple high-visibility projects and tasks while effectively influencing, negotiating, and communicating with internal and external business partners, contractors and vendors
Provide technical leadership for large-scale engineering projects
Conduct post mortem on designs after implementation in partnering with Safety and
Build strong relationships with partner organizations within the company such as Start-up, Launch team, Worldwide Design team, Construction, Procurement, Information Technology, Loss Prevention, Facilities, Safety, Change Management, PMO and Operations
Ability to travel up to 25% to interact with internal and external business and technical leaders
A day in the life

A Day in the Life of a Solutions Engineer involves working with both internal and external teams. Internally, the Solutions Engineer will work with operations to understand initiatives and then present solutions to them. Along the way, working with other teams to understand and validate the design for safety, maintainability, and functionally. In the background, the engineer will be working directly with the MHE integrator and storage vendor to manage the project during the design.

About The Team

Concept and Applications aNd Estimating Services (CANES) is part of the Global Engineering Technology Services (GETS) team. We develop concepts for potential MHE and storage retrofit projects within North America and the ECCF. We work with vendors to develop proposals and then develop the budgets for the projects. We work closely with many internal and external teams to develop MHE solutions which allows us to deliver a variety of solutions. Our internal stakeholders include: Operations, WW Engineering, Finance, Safety, ACES, RME, and Operations Engineering.


Basic Qualifications
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Mechanical/Industrial/Process Engineering or related STEM field
4+ years of experience in Design/Innovation, Research & Development, Manufacturing/Process/Industrial Engineering.
Experience with complex MHE and packaging lines or process design based on Lean Manufacturing or Toyota Manufacturing System
Experience using MS Excel, MS Project, and CAD software
Experience leading engineering design projects and interacting with cross-functional teams
Preferred Qualifications
MBA, Master‚Äôs Degree or other advanced degree in Mechanical/Industrial/Process Engineering, Operations, Business Administration or related field and at least 5 years of progressively responsible experience in the specialty
Experience with complex automated material handling equipment, packaging technologies, and systems including robotics and high-speed manufacturing
Proficiency in AutoCAD 3D
Proficiency in using advanced simulation modeling tools (Flexsim, Arena, Simio, etc)
Proficiency in running SQL queries and data mining
Experience in engineering and estimating material handling and storage systems
Operations Management/ Fulfillment/Distribution Center experience preferred
Capital project management skills
Proficiency with concepts like system architecture, optimization, system dynamics, system analysis, statistical analysis, reliability analysis, and decision making
Design-in-Safety experience
Ability to work independently in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment
Ability to manage, influence, negotiate, and communicate with external business partners and internal teams to meet organizational capacity needs

description:
Sobre a vaga
We are looking for a qualified Database Engineer to design stable and reliable databases, according to our company‚Äôs needs. You will be responsible for developing, testing, improving and maintaining new and existing databases to help users retrieve data effectively. As part of our IT team, you will work closely with developers to ensure system consistency. You will also collaborate with administrators to provide technical support and identify new requirements. Communication and organization skills are keys for this position, along with a problem-solution attitude. Ultimately, you should be able to ensure our database systems run effectively and securely on a daily basis.

Responsibilities:
Develop, construct, test and large-scale database systems like as Postgres, Redshift, DynamoDB and Elasticsearch.
Provide recommendations and implement ways to improve data reliability, efficiency, and quality.
Make use of performance monitoring tools to issue optimizations and performing tuning tasks, applying data patterns like partitioning, sharding, etc.
Ensure architecture will supports the requirements of stakeholders (Data Scientists and Business Intelligence teams) and the business in general.

Requirements
BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related subject.
Proven hands-on experience on PostgreSQL, Redis and no-SQL technologies (DynamoDB, MongoDB, Elasticsearch, etc).
A solid understanding of database engines performance metrics, being able to operate with diverse monitoring tools: PGanalyze, AWS Performance Insights, etc.Knowledge on Amazon Web Services in special Amazon Athena/RedShift.
English or Spanish is a plus.

Benefits
Medical and dental assistance - You don't have to worry about co-participation fees. Here our RecargaPayers have access to excellent hospitals throughout Brazil, without worrying about discounts at the end of the month.
Life insurance - Because we know that your life is worth a lot.
Flexible Meal voucher - What does it mean? You can choose how you want to spend your $$ in Lunch, Market, Pharmacy, Courses, Mobility, Education ... yes, lots of possibilities.
TotalPass - Healthy mind, healthy body.
Money in your RecargaPay Wallet monthly - To pay for that one bill and still have cashback. And specially to tell us how we can improve even more.
Spanish lessons - S√≠, ac√° trabajamos aprendiendo.
Up to 70% discount on English courses - Why not be trilingual?
Discount in Universities for Undergraduate, Graduate and MBA courses - Knowledge is never too much, is it?
No Dress-Code - Here you can be YOU!

Diversity and Authenticity at RecargaPay

We are a company formed by dream-makers. That challenges the status quo, the market, and the ‚Äúalways been like this‚Äù thing. That proposes the new, the different, that will, in fact, make a difference.

And we are doing it all because we are diverse. We are women, men and non-binaries, LGBTQIA + and heterosexuals, trans, cis and fluid gender. White, black, yellow and multicolored. Young, mature, with and without disabilities. And without defined patterns.

We are authentic. We are talented. Authenticity is what moves us.

That's why here at RecargaPay you are free to be who you are, every single day.

The use of your Data

The candidate, when sending the curriculum with personal and professional data to participate in RecargaPay's recruitment and selection process, is aware that the data will be used for the necessary analysis and validations throughout the recruitment process and for hiring, if necessary, as well as authorizes RecargaPay to share the curriculum data with other companies in the RecargaPay group in case opportunities arise in line with the candidate's profile.

In compliance with Law 13.709 / 18, LGPD - General Data Protection Law, the candidate may ask for the updating, rectification and modification of his information during the recruitment and selection process, or, still, request the non-use of the data under the terms applicable law.

description:
Sobre a vaga
Rockwell Automation is a global technology leader focused on helping the world‚Äôs manufacturers be more productive, sustainable, and agile. With more than 25,000 employees who make the world better every day, we know we have something special. Behind our customers - amazing companies that help feed the world, provide life-saving medicine on a global scale, and focus on clean water and green mobility - our people are energized problem solvers that take pride in how the work we do changes the world for the better.

We welcome all makers, forward thinkers, and problem solvers who are looking for a place to do their best work. And if that‚Äôs you we would love to have you join us!

Job Description

Kalypso, A Rockwell Automation Business, is a professional services firm dedicated to helping clients discover, create, make, and sell better products with digital. We believe that innovation across the value chain is the single most important factor for long-term growth and success.

We are passionate about our work and committed to helping clients become more innovative, competitive, and productive. The Kalypso team consists of diverse industry and technical experts with proven experience delivering results. Our people are recognized business, industry, and technical thought leaders with a passion for innovation.

As a provider of professional services, our people are the key to success. We are looking for the absolute best to join our world-class team. We want balanced individuals who are willing to go the extra mile to provide the sustainable results our clients expect. At the same time, we are looking for real, multi-dimensional people ‚Äì Characters with Character ‚Äì who complement their expertise and intelligence with personality and integrity.

Kalypso is seeking exceptional candidates who are looking for an exciting career as a SENIOR SOFTWARE ENGINEER

Location: Brazil (Remote)

As we have diverse Clients, across multiple industries and geographies, we expect our Sr. Software Engineers to have a high degree of adaptability when it comes to the problems they are asked to solve. We work with IoT (Internet of Things), Data Science, PLM (Product Lifecycle Management) through implementations, integrations, customizations, enhancements, and upgrades in both on-prem and cloud environments. No two projects are the same ‚Äì the ability to learn quickly and be a problem solver is a must! The work is fast-paced, demanding, and provides unparalleled exposure to unique opportunities. The learning curve can be quite steep at times, but our team will help you develop a broad set of skills and enable you to explore areas that are of interest to you. Our focus is on helping clients extract value from their software solutions, not just on making the technology work.

Responsibilities:

Develop technical and functional specifications based on software design and performance.
Assist in the data modeling and requirements definition mapping.
Development of software extensions and integrations using specific APIs.
Ability to work on different projects at the same time.
Contact with customers in the USA, Europe, and Asia.
Performs intermediate system administrative functions.
Provide client support, including but not limited to: troubleshooting, software upgrades, and enhancements.
Perform Data Migration (Data Analysis, Manipulation, and Migration using an ETL process).
Commit to meeting and exceeding customer service metrics, Service Level Agreements (SLA‚Äôs).
Effective status reporting within the team and with the clients.
Manage requirements from multiple clients simultaneously.
Work with multi-disciplinary and cross-cultural teams.
Perform intermediate system configuration and customization.
Perform intermediate installations of tools to support development.
DevOps development and implementation.
Ensure quality of code by performing unit testing and code reviews.
Support to PTC products (Team works development and support).
Contribute to internal initiatives and tool building.
Assist in the development of technology demonstrations as required by the broader Rockwell Automation organization.

Basic Qualifications:

Degree in Computer Science, Digital Systems, Software Development, or related.
4+ years of experience developing in any of the following Java, Python, JavaScript, C#, .NET, SQL languages, or related.
Experience with Oracle Database and/or MS SQL Server.
Experience working with different OS platforms, any Linux distros, and Window‚Äôs.
Understanding of application architecture.
Experience using leading software development practices, technical documentation (requirements, functional specifications, test plans, etc.).
Exposure to AWS and/or Azure cloud.
Versatility, flexibility, and proactivity when resolving technical issues and dealing with ambiguity.
Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively and collaborate with clients, peers, and managers.
Personal commitment to quality and on-schedule delivery; proven ability to establish and meet milestones and deadlines.
Basic understanding of business requirements and the process of translating them into well-engineered and integrated technical solutions; attention to detail.
Strong communication skills in English, both written and verbal (Spanish is a plus).
Willingness to travel.
All applicants applying for job openings based in Brazil must be authorized to work in Brazil.

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience developing and publishing mobile applications is a plus.
Network management is a plus.
Experience working with PLM systems is a plus.
Knowledge of JavaScript, Groovy Script, HTML and CSS is a plus.
Experience with cloud platforms and cloud IoT tools is a plus.
Knowledge of NoSQL databases, such as Cosmos, Dynamodb, InfluxDB or Mongodb.
Experience working with UX design is a plus.

description:
Sobre a vaga
Description

How would you like to be a part of Earth‚Äôs most customer-centric company? You would work with teams of front-line responders who support the operations of some of the world‚Äôs most powerful data centers. Our Data Center Engineering Operations team maintain and operate our critical infrastructure systems so that they are prepared to stand up against any situation.

AWS has the world‚Äôs largest cloud computing portfolio. As an Amazonian you will work in some of the most sophisticated, safe, and secure data centers in the world. Our Engineering Operations Technicians I (EOT‚Äôs) help keep them that way by working with the brightest minds from around the globe to help test and implement the newest technology and work practices to meet the demands of a changing market.

We have a passion for learning and evolving, it‚Äôs how we have helped define ourselves as leaders in the industry. Let‚Äôs work hard, have fun, and make history!

Key job responsibilities
Maintain the critical data center infrastructure ensuring 99.999% uptime of the world's largest cloud computing portfolio.
Ensure that security procedures are followed.
Monitor the performance of operations and maintenance of electrical, mechanical and fire/safety equipment within the data center.
Provide key performance indicators to senior engineers.
Assist in facility troubleshooting and rack level events respecting Internal Service Level Agreements (SLA).
Work on projects of moderate complexity.
Perform rack installation, rack decommissioning, walkthroughs and other critical facility infrastructure related activities.
Accompany vendors on site, ensuring that all work performed is in accordance with established practices, procedures and local legislation.
Work on basic support such as ticketing systems, root cause analysis, change management processes, and creating/revising operational procedures.
A day in the life
Work on foot on uneven terrain. Maintain balance and perform tasks using a ladder.
Regularly lift and/or move up to 18Kg alone or in a group for 18Kg+.
Regularly walk, use hands and fingers, reach with hands and arms, stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl, climb up and down stairs, bend, work above the shoulders, grasp, carry, push and pull.

Basic Qualifications
Electrical/Mechanical Technical High school or Bachelor in Electrical/Mechanical Engineering or related area.
Advanced English: read/write/speak.
Preferred Qualifications
Relevant experience in data centers or mission critical facilities (e.g. hospital, military facility, public safety facility, etc.).
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

description:
Sobre a vaga
Job Description

About us

From Arthur Guinness to Johnnie Walker, our business was founded on people of great character, and in 250 years, nothing‚Äôs changed. We‚Äôre the world‚Äôs leading premium alcohol company. Our brands are industry icons. And our success is thanks to the strength of our people, in every role. It‚Äôs why we trust them with our legacy. And it‚Äôs why we reward them with the career-defining opportunities that they deserve.Our ambition is to create the best performing, most trusted and respected Consumer Products Company in the world. To achieve these, we need the world‚Äôs very best people.Feel inspired? Then this may be the opportunity for you.

Job Description

The IBP Manager is responsible for leading and driving a collaborative and efficient monthly One Plan IBP process. This role is responsible for running on a weekly and monthly basis IBP meetings to align a consensus plan with CMO, Sales, Marketing, Supply, and Finance. It is also responsible for managing any overlays to the baseline volume driven by new product introductions, promotions, price increases and any other commercial activity that may affect demand.

IBP Manager leads end to end cross-functional business planning to ensure that commercial and operational strategies are aligned to support successful execution of Diageo‚Äôs business objectives. Responsible for managing and leading teams focused on portfolio optimization. It is also accountable with the market for the forecast accuracy and bias performance to achieve agreed upon targets.

The role needs to ensure a balance on all aspects and trade-offs of supply, including managing inventory levels and minimizing out of stocks, whilst delivering a responsive supply chain that fulfils sales forecasts accurately. The person should have an end to end business comprehension, including Financial knowledge and leadership skills capable of assuring process adherence and value.

Functions

Integrated Business Planning
Consensus Forecast approval with key stakeholders including the General Manager and the Area Directors.

KPIs (at Country Level)

Sales Forecast Accuracy - Monthly and Weekly
Sales Forecast Bias
Forecast Value Add by step
System KPIs ‚Äì SKUs with forecast and no sales
Demand Plan stability
Extreme error ‚Äì Oversell /Undersell

Lead the OnePlan process in the Market and cross functional monthly planning rhythm

Facilitate IBP meetings (process steps) with cross functional leaders.
Set targeted, high impact agenda, compile inputs from stakeholders across the business.
Regular review cadence for Senior Leadership alignment and gap assessment.
Support issue identification (supply constraints, available capacity) and initiate cross-functional resolution ‚Äì coach and support to ensure comprehensive, fact-based decisions
Accountable for successful implementation of PRM and S&OE reviews.
Lead the alignment and consensus of the 24-month rolling demand plan on SKU/depot level in weekly and monthly buckets in support of the IBP & S&OE process.
Lead the Demand Review and Management Business Review steps of the IBP process with the Marketing, Supply, Finance and Commercial teams.
Facilitate Demand Control (S&OE) process including weekly meetings for quicker decision making in the short term.
Ensure delivery of cross-functional inputs to the S&OP process to guarantee quality plans are received.
Work in partnership with Finance team to ensure volume is correctly translated into value (cash-up) for S&OP process.
Ensure that all relevant financial elements of the demand plan (NSV, GP, price mix) are properly identified, discussed and agreed in the S&OP cycle, guaranteeing a single volume-value conversation.
Challenge activity plans volume assumptions based on historical trends where necessary to drive an unbiased forecast.
Collaborate with the COE Demand Planners, local Innovation and Commercial teams on volume and size assumptions, shipment timings and cannibalization projections for all new product introductions.
Lead demand and supply integration and continuously drive alignment towards a single plan.

Generate 18 month Consensus Demand Plan (volume)

Analyze & manage volume assumptions, considering all relevant factors, both internal and external.
Certify that the financial forecast is derived from the APO volume plan and that it contemplates all relevant S&OP agreements.
Communicate critical forecast changes and supply constraints to stakeholders in the Supply Chain, Sales and Finance teams, as well as the CoE.
Leads Demand Planners to conduct root cause analysis to identify drivers of forecast error and work together to take the necessary corrective action to drive continuous improvement in forecast accuracy and bias performance.
Ensure scenario planning for significant events in market (duty changes, customer activities, economic conditions changes, etc.).

Skills And Capabilities

End to end business comprehension.
Solid business financial knowledge.
Leadership skills capable of assuring process adherence and value
Excellent analytical, organizational and decision-making skills.
Strong influencing and stakeholder engagement skills; able to manage multiply stakeholders across functions and geographies
Ability to challenge senior stakeholders and manage tension in IBP conversations.
Exceptional communication skills ‚Äì verbal, written and presentation.
Detailed understanding of end to end supply chain operational processes within Diageo e.g. IBP, S&OP, DRP, MPS, inventory, conversion, logistics and customer service.
Proficient in MS applications e.g. Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Access, Outlook
Previous experience working with SAP APO is preferred; however, experience with similar planning tools will be considered

Experience

+8 years in Supply Chain planning experience (Demand Planning, Supply Planning, Material Planning), including significant experience managing S&OP process.
Finance roles would also be considered.
Wider cross-functional experience preferable e.g. Commercial, Finance or Supply.
Prior experience leading and embedding IBP best practice ways of working
High degree of quantitative and analytical skills.

Qualifications

Degree or equivalent in appropriate supply chain, mathematical, engineering, or business degree.
APICS CPIM / CSCP or equivalent desirable.

Diversity statement

Celebrating our inclusive and diverse culture is core to Diageo‚Äôs purpose of ‚Äúcelebrating life every day everywhere‚Äù. This purpose is, in itself, inclusive in nature, as it values everybody irrespective of background, disability, religion, gender identity, sexuality or ethnicity.

We know that for our business to thrive and for Diageo to realize its ambition, we depend on having diverse talent with a range of backgrounds, skills and capabilities in each of the 180 countries in which we operate and to reflect our broad consumer base. We view diversity as one of the key enablers that helps our business to grow and our values, purpose and standards set the conditions for us to respect the unique contribution each person brings.

Flexibility is key to success in our business and many of our staff work flexibly in many different ways, including part-time, compressed hours, flexible location. Please talk to us about what flexibility means to you and don‚Äôt let anything stop you from applying.

Character Is Everything!

Worker Type

Regular

Primary Location:

Sao Paulo

Additional Locations :

Job Posting Start Date

2023-05-11

description:
Sobre a vaga
What you'll do

As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in designing, developing, and deploying cutting-edge machine learning models and systems. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to identify business needs, gather requirements, and translate them into scalable machine learning solutions. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in machine learning, deep learning, and software engineering, along with a passion for solving complex problems and driving innovation.

Responsibilities
Design and develop scalable machine learning models and algorithms.
Train and evaluate models using large datasets to achieve high performance.
Preprocess and engineer features from raw data to enhance model performance.
Deploy machine learning models into production environments and integrate them into existing systems.Stay updated with the latest advancements in machine learning and conduct research to explore new techniques.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams and provide technical guidance and mentorship.
Optimize model performance and address performance bottlenecks in machine learning pipelines.

Requirements
Master's or Ph.D. degree in computer science, machine learning, or a related field.
5+ years of proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, with a focus on developing and deploying machine learning models.
Strong proficiency in machine learning frameworks and libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn).
Expertise in deep learning architectures and techniques.
Proficient in programming languages such as Python, C++ or C.
Experience with data preprocessing, feature engineering, and data visualization.
Strong understanding of software engineering principles and best practices.
Excellent problem-solving skills and a passion for tackling complex challenges.

Bonus Points
Fluent English proficiency.
Knowledge of cloud platforms and distributed computing framework

Compensation
Competitive salary and stock options

Mental health support: we cover 40% of the cost of your therapy
Health plan with national coverage and without coparticipation.
Dental Insurance: we help you with dental treatment for a better quality of life.
Sports Incentive: R$300/mo extra if you practice activities

description:
Sobre a vaga
About Us

WEX is a global leader in financial technology solutions, based in Portland, Maine, United States, with over 6,000 WEXers distributed in over 40 countries. We simplify the complexities of payment systems across continents and industries like Fleet, Corporate Payments, and Benefits. We look to manage employee benefits, streamline how companies pay and get paid by suppliers, save on fuel costs, or modernize how companies manage their fleet, WEX solutions reduce the administrative burdens.

About The Opportunity


Our team consists of small, agile development teams focused on building state of the art solutions from the ground up using the best technology available. We focus on cloud-based microservice and data solutions to help achieve fast, scalable results that allow our business partners the flexibility they need to compete in our competitive market.

Changing the world isn‚Äôt easy, and we have a lot of work ahead of us. From new product features to automation, to supporting microservice and data solutions, we‚Äôve got more work than we can handle and we‚Äôre looking for great people to come along for the ride.

You will be expected to

Design and Implement data driven strategies that transform processes to enable efficiency and scale
Translate data transformation strategies into implementation plans, then execute on those plans to deliver requirements
Respond to changing business requirements by adapting data stores to address current business conditions
Work collaboratively with the business to create data marts that support business intelligence solutions
Collaborate on, and implement solutions that enable Analysts to leverage Data Science tools and applications to drive improvements

We Are Looking For a Professional Who Has

Have solid experience with Data Analytics & Engineering experience, including Data Management, Architecture
Have a demonstrable working understanding of at least one RDBMS (i.e. Oracle, SQL Server, Postgres)
A demonstrable working understanding of at least one modern programming framework (i.e. Python, Pyspark, Spark) and at least one modern API framework (i.e. REST)


It would be great, if you had already had the opportunity to work with

Can show us one or more passion projects or open-source work you have contributed to in your own time
Have demonstrable experience with systems engineering and automation
Have working knowledge of AWS, Snowflake, and dbt
Enjoy hanging out with your team
Learn how to use and leverage WEX‚Äôs Data Platform using documented standards & best practices

Our 4.5-star rating on GlassDoor.

The Position:

Team Augmentation: You will integrate yourself directly into our client's team and work alongside their existing designers and engineers on a daily basis.
Design & Build: You will work on a FullStack Labs product team to build and deliver a product to our clients.

Virtual company events each month.
Ample opportunity for career advancement.
Continuing education opportunities.

FullStack is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form, which can be provided upon request during our hiring and interview process.

About the Role:

We are looking for Python Senior Developers to join our Development team and participate in different projects made up of multicultural teams distributed throughout the world. Sobre a vaga
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Controllership Senior Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing financial data, identifying trends, and providing valuable insights to drive strategic decision-making. As a key member of our finance department, you will contribute to budgeting, forecasting, and financial reporting processes.

Responsibilities / Tasks

Conduct thorough analysis of key performance indicators, including revenue, cost of sales, expenses, and capital expenditures, to identify trends and variances.
Monitor and report on performance indicators, providing in-depth analysis and recommendations to improve financial outcomes.
Assist in the development of budgeting, financial forecasting, and operating plans, utilizing advanced modeling tools.
Consolidate quarterly and monthly financial reports, ensuring accuracy and timeliness of financial statements.
Evaluate existing processes and identify opportunities for streamlining and driving efficiencies.
Develop comprehensive financial models and analyses to support strategic initiatives.
Provide accurate and timely financial recommendations to management for effective decision-making.
Collaborate with senior management and department heads, offering valuable insights and support for their financial needs.
Prepare ad-hoc reports and perform in-depth analysis as requested.
Offer guidance on cost-effective operational strategies to minimize risk and maximize profitability.
Present clear and concise data and information to assist in business decision-making.

Your Profile / Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Business, or Economics.
Strong knowledge of International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS).
Previous experience working in FP&A
Fluent or native-level English proficiency is required.
Ability to thrive in a changing and challenging environment.
Strong problem-solving skills and a detail-oriented mindset.
Proficiency in data analytics and the ability to derive meaningful insights from financial data.
Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and take initiative.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
A minimum of 7 years of relevant work experience in financial analysis or related areas.
Strong working knowledge of ERP/Financial Systems & Applications.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office, particularly Excel.
Experience with SAP is preferred.
Experience with ERP implementation or conversion is a plus.
Knowledge of multi-dimensional analysis tools like Access or building relational databases is an advantage.

Join our team of finance professionals and contribute to our company's success. We offer a competitive compensation package and a rewarding work environment. If you meet the qualifications and are excited about this opportunity, please submit your application. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for further evaluation.

Did we spark your interest?

Then please click apply above to access our guided application process.
