Sobre a vaga
Imagine New Horizons....

Do you want to be inspired and enjoy coming to work? At Dassault Syst√®mes, we empower our employees and support their passion for changing the world and building. Let‚Äôs design new horizons together with the power of 3DEXPERIENCE virtual universes!

What will your role be?

You will join the Global DELMIA Hub Delivery service, a team composed of 200 people spread over the world belonging to Value Engagement Worldwide.

Value Engagement is a framework dedicated to sales, presales & services activities, created by Dassault Syst√®mes. It is based on a consulting approach with the aim of discovering, maximizing, piloting and securing the potential value that our solutions can bring to customers.

Your mission is the implementation of major manufacturing operations management (MoM) projects in different industries (such as Aerospace, Automotive, Marine Offshore, Energy or High Tech), following the Value Engagement model. MoM has become essential today for the production cycle of companies covering the fields of ordering, logistics, execution of manufacturing, traceability, quality management and performance analysis.

You will help international companies to reinvent engineering, operations and planning to achieve excellence in manufacturing in the context of Manufacturing 4.0 where the keywords are Digitalization of business processes, Team collaboration, interoperability with IS and IoT, Dashboarding and Big Data.

The Challenges Ahead

As a DELMIA Apriso Consultant, you ensure, under the responsibility of the project team leader, the quality of deliveries and customer satisfaction in alignment with the Value Engagement framework in general and the Value Delivery phase in particular
Configure, develop specific needs and perform unit tests
Deliver expertise to our customers and partners
Participate in the different phases of a project in a V cycle or Agile context
Develop and update technical documentation
Support key users in the adoption and use of their solution
Provide expertise on all MoM Apriso modules: Logistics Execution System (LES) and Manufacturing Execution System (MES)
Your Key Success Factors
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field
A first significant experience in a similar position
Exposure to DELMIA Apriso product a plus
Knowledge of SQL / Javascript / JQuery / C# languages
Knowledge of HTML / CSS / XML web technologies
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work with teams

Proficient English Communication Skills, written and verbal
Ability and willingness to travel up to 20% of the time

description:
Sobre a vaga
Job Description

Your role in helping us shape the future:

Provide prompt and quality support to IT Operations teams by responding to alerts relating to IT infrastructure and fixing the underlying condition using established standard procedures. Escalating to other teams in IT Operations when their involvement is required to fix the condition causing the monitoring alert. Take on tasks in the IT infrastructure lifecycle related to provisioning.

Are you up to the challenge?

Join a dedicated IT infrastructure team that is tasked with implementing new and exciting technologies that drive our business efficiencies and support our employees and customer revenue stream. Monitors and tracks service impacting changes in the Enterprise infrastructure
Monitor and analyze incident alerts regarding outages or degradation in infrastructure components and services affecting the Enterprise using monitoring tools
Perform VM deployment and other repeatable IT infrastructure provisioning tasks.
Work with IT Operations teams during the installation, upgrade, or decommissioning of infrastructure or software

You should definitely have:

1 ‚Äì 2 years of IT experience
Systems Administration experience on Windows and Linux servers
Familiarity with ticketing tools ‚Äì ServiceNow, Remedy, etc
Experience with system and infrastructure monitoring tools ‚Äì Argent, ManageEngine, vCenter, Nagios, Oracle OEM, Whatsup Gold, Prometheus, etc
Excellent communication (both verbal and written) and organizational skills, ability to take technical direction and prioritize tasks
English Fluency required- please submit a resume in English

It would be nice if you had:

Certifications in Windows Server, Linux, VMware and/or Networking Technologies
Working knowledge of Citrix or other application delivery technologies
Good understanding of TCP/IP and ability to understand and assist in solving network server problems or network infrastructure issues
Understanding of distributed systems architecture and general knowledge of multiple technical disciplines
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Information Systems or equivalent

What it‚Äôs like to work with us:

Intelsat is connecting the world and transforming the satellite and inflight connectivity landscape by reaching beyond the traditional satellite industry. We are defining new products that will open new, profitable markets. We connect the aviation industry and air travelers with innovative technology and applications, and we do it all in a high-energy environment that welcomes the next challenge. To help us reach this goal, you should be a bold thinker who will perform a key role in shaping Intelsat innovation for years to come.

We emphasize personal and professional growth
Awesome benefits including PTO, medical, tuition reimbursement, and trainimg.
Flexible work arrangements
Fun, diverse, and inclusive culture

Other Job Info:

These statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this job. This is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of employees assigned to this job.

About Us

As the foundational architects of satellite technology, Intelsat applies our expertise to develop breakthrough solutions that advance and secure boundless applications for our customers and partners.

At Intelsat, we increase human potential by connecting people, communities, businesses, and governments. Our employees enjoy a casual and collaborative environment, where we celebrate professional excellence in pursuit of the corporate mission. We hire skilled professionals who work in various areas such as: satellite engineering, network operations, cloud architecture, accounting, sales, legal, and more. Browse our current job openings or create a professional profile to stay informed about opportunities that match your interests and expertise.

Intelsat is subject to regulation by certain U.S. Government national security agencies, which require that we collect and share certain Personally Identifiable Information (‚ÄúPII‚Äù) with the U.S. Government to obtain permission to employ non-U.S. persons in certain roles. If selected for a role at Intelsat, we may collect and share your PII for these purposes.

Intelsat is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer including Vets and Disabled

position: Senior Data Engineer - DSP for Vibration Analysis
required_skills: ['NoSQL', 'Python', 'SQL', 'Amazon S3', 'Amazon Web Services', 'An√°lise de vibra√ß√µes', 'C++', 'Ci√™ncia da computa√ß√£o', 'Ingl√™s', 'MongoDB']
description:
Sobre a vaga
What you'll do

We are looking for a highly motivated and skilled Data Engineer with expertise in Digital Signal Processing (DSP) for Vibration Analysis Sensors to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining data pipelines and infrastructure for processing and analyzing vibration data obtained from sensors using DSP techniques. The candidate should also have experience with software development, data modeling, and data warehousing.

Responsibilities
Design, develop, and maintain data pipelines and infrastructure for processing and analyzing vibration data obtained from sensors using DSP techniques.
Develop and implement DSP algorithms for processing and analyzing vibration data, including filtering, transformation, feature extraction, and classification.
Collaborate with data scientists, software engineers, and other stakeholders to understand requirements and develop solutions to complex data problems.
Design and implement data models and schemas for storing and retrieving vibration data and associated metadata in data warehouses and data lakes.
Ensure data quality and consistency across various data sources and platforms.
Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and industry trends in DSP, Vibration Analysis, data engineering, and data science.

Requirements
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in data engineering, with a focus on Digital Signal Processing for Vibration Analysis Sensors.
Strong knowledge of DSP fundamentals, including filtering, transformation, feature extraction, and classification.
Experience with software development in languages such as Python, Go or C++.
Experience with data modeling and schema design for data warehousing and data lakes, using tools such as SQL and NoSQL.

Bonus Points
Experience with data storage solutions and ETL, working with different databases (AWS S3, Scylla, MongoDB and others)
Knowledge designing event-driven applications (like Kafka)
Fluent English proficiency

Compensation
Competitive salary and stock options
R$800/mo to use in a wide range of places that accept the Visa flag
GymPass so you don't sit/work all day
100% funded English / Spanish course
30 days of paid annual leave
Education and courses stipend
Every 4 years, earn a trip anywhere in the world
Day off in the week of your birthday
From R$2400/year remote work allowance
Mental health support: we cover 40% of the cost of your therapy
Health plan with national coverage and without coparticipation.
Dental Insurance: we help you with dental treatment for a better quality of life.
Sports Incentive: R$300/mo extra if you practice activities
